When friends come to visit, we usually take them to Tootoomoo and we've recommended it to numerous people.All the staff members I have dealt with have been really friendly, except one that I spoke to the other day. He was a bald guy with a goatee and was working on the till by the front door. He was really snappy and service certainly wasn't delivered with a smile. I'm giveing this place full marks here, because it is fantastic, but I'm just hoping it will be noted that this guy's attitude was crap.

Have been a few times now but went on my own last week. Had poached eggs and toast and it was brought to me exactly as I'd asked - no spinach, no dressing, just butter on the bread and a light sprinkling of salt. You'd be amazed at how difficult this can be perceived in other restaurants.The eggs had no taste of the vinegar used to cook them which for me was pure heaven. I would go so far as to say that Boyce Da Roca is the only place ive ever had poached eggs done so nicely and ive eaten in some high class establishments.

Really worth having a meal here for quality of food and value in London. This is not a plush high class restaurant, but it's not trying to be that, its a French bistro style eatery with good varied menu, food of excellent quality at a very reasonable price. Lovely welcome by authentic French owner and staff.

We took some friends here on a Saturday night and had a really good meal. We shared a couple of the platters to start and 3 of us had pizzas, and one had pasta, sharing a bottle of wine. All of the food was really good and the service was great too, really pleasant waiter. Very reasonably priced considering the location and I would definitely go back here again.

This is the worst ever restaurant I have ordered and eaten from. We ordered, as take away, beef rendang (9.25), katsu curry (8.95) and pak choy with oyster sause (4.50) The beef rendang turned out to be only thick coconut gravy with what seemed to be a spoonful of the remains of a chunk of brisket; the katsu, instead of a chicken breast cutlet, were slithers of chicken skin and sinews; and the pak choy dish comprised only two miserable stalks of the vegetable that was completely overcooked. The rice was was dry and stale. I have never been more appalled that a Dim T kitchen, or any for that matter, has the audacity to serve their customer the food the way and manner in which they did No diner should be insulted this way. It is an absolute disgrace and we shall never dine at any Dim T again.
Its right in the heart of baker street where Maddame taussands and Planetarium is. Staff not that friendly and a bit hit and miss sorry.
Lovely pub food and friendly atmosphere, enjoyed an impromptu dinner stop here one night after work. Fish was cooked well and salad not 'overdressed'.
Just popped in for a drink on my way back to the hotel, staff are very friendly. Located opposite the IBIS

Short and sweet menu. Unfortunately the waitress didn't highlight the specials which I didn't notice until I had ordered. Crust was very tasty but the centre of the pizza seemed a bit soggy. Great prices and definitely a cut above pizza express etc. It's quick in and out but sometimes that's what you want. I would definitely return.

My husband discovered this restaurant on line and I am very glad he did. We went there to celebrate our wedding anniversary and had a wonderful meal. The staff were welcoming and the service was friendly and efficient. We shared a sausage platter to start which was superb. My husband had fillet steak and I had ribeye, both were superb.Unfortunately we had no room for dessert, but I'm sure that if we had then that too would've been excellent. It was not cheap, but I do think it was well worth the money. They also have an excellent wine list.

We dinned here Saturday 25th July and from start to finish it was great. We was seated in the bar area where we had our cocktails, then shown to our table. The staff are brilliant and very knowledgeable about the food ( yes Daniel is good), the food was delicious and the atmosphere is great. Was given a voucher by the Restaurant for the same deal so will defiantly be returning (We would even without the voucher)All in all we had a great night and was not rushed at all.
Great food great service and super ambient it was very delicate especially the Kobe beef fantastic !
Very loud but good service good Italian food and very buzzy. The menu accommodates all. Clean toilets and table not to close together. Easy parking outside. Well worth a visit and you must book

The restaurant looks superb! I grabbed a take away, and found the service to be quick and the staff very upbeat and friendly, which was great to see them getting involved in the late Friday night mood :-)The cod and chips were delicious, the fish fresh and tasty, the batter crispy, and the chips cooked perfectly.I will definitely be going back!
Beautiful homely food and the most friendly staff in town. I'm going back with my Irish friends to remind us of home and with my international friends to show them what Irish food is all about!

After a long day in the big smoke, decided that the three of us would give Prezzo a go. The service was excellent, but the restaurant was all but empty with only 4 tables occupied. The time we visited was 6.30 on a Friday night.The food was OK, exactly what you'd expect from such an establishment, so all in all, it was a relaxing evening meal with family, exactly what I was looking for.My wife said that the area near the toilets smelt a bit, but I didn't notice anything when I visited. Is it worth a visit? If you want a decent meal, then yes. Highlight? The small desert and coffee combos are great, but if think other restaurants also do these now such as Pizza Express
Brillinat fun, the stafff were great and teh music was brilliant for a pre-party warm up. Super location and great if fabric is next on your list

Not far from Chapel Market, this is the place to end up at after visiting the nearby Alma and CBC.There is always a good selection of cask and keg craft beers. Beers are pricey, but the pizzas are great and good value. Service and atmosphere is great.

Hampered by my dietry restrictions Prezzo did well indeed. Gluten-Free pizzas and a chef with a diveine sugo casa made life without cheese more than bearable. It was great! A mistake was made and apologized for, beautifully atoned for, in short an excellent choice.

This is a long establishment and the menu has never changed for 30 years. Simple honest provincial French food. Chef, George comes from Mauritius. Not an extensive menu.. which is why it is so good. Great fish soup, the best and consistently great rack of lamb, the smoothest crÌ¬me brulee. The owner, Adele cannot be nicer o his customers.

i went to Busaba Westfield for a meal yesterday with my work colleges since we haven't got a chance to do our xmas party. when we went to the restaurant it was pretty busy, but 9 of us was taken to seat within 3 mins. The staff was very friendly and all of my colleges was very impressed with the food. I had the grilled salmon dish,.i am not a fish person i have to say, but the salmon just cooked so perfect and taste absolutely Delicious. As a person travel many times to Thailand, i have to say Busaba Ethai is one of the best Thai restaurant in London. what more, i introduced the Thai Cuisine to a couples of my colleges has never had a Thai meal before. Threrfore, i am sure Busaba westfield will be definitely their choice when they come to do their shopping.Thank you Basaba Westfield for the great time, service and food!!! We will be back!

Very poor slow service_had to constantly try to get the waitresses attention. Then were told, in not a nice or apologetic way, that there was no time for us to have a final drink at our table and no space at the bar_even though 5 of us had just spent £300. Food was good, although very overpriced. Too many good places in Borough Market to bother going back here.

Well I was a member in the past but don't do London trips any more as I am part retired and today I was a guest of a member. I had forgotten how really upper class British this place is.. the traditional British decor and smartness of all the staff is exceptionally comforting. The service for food in the lounge areas is really perfect. I had a Caesar salad as well as tea and it was excellent. Thank you

My date and I bought the Groupon voucher for a burger, sides and beer. I had the pulled pork burger which was fantastic, meat soft and juicy with a real kick of chilli, which is perfect for me. She had the charter house burger which was a large slab of beef burger covered with applewood smoked cheese and crispy bacon. Again juicy and full of flavour. Both had chips an shared the onion rings and homemade coleslaw. Cannot complain about any of it. Extremely good value for money, we couldn't finish it all!  I wasn't overly sure of what to expect, especially on a date, but we are pleasantly surprised. Service was great, staff real friendly and I highly recommend it. Will be coming back very soon.Thank you.

Reared on Puddings and Pies so we just had to try this place while in London for the day. The Kate and Sydney Pudding was one of the best I have ever had and my Gran used to make some great ones. Loved the Pub but due to the tables being close in the Restaurant, it is a little claustrophobic and the day we went it was full of rather noisy people which marred the meal somewhat. That may be just us, but we like to be able to converse without having to raise our voices but the helpings were generous and the quality more than made up for the atmosphere on the day. Would certainly go again.

We try to get to the Green Pea whenever we can. There's nowhere like it and that's the point. Just enjoyed another cosy evening with the food we love. Tom is the icing on the cake and other staff are very friendly, too. Best Guiness in London. Don't miss out - we are so pleased we found this gem.
The food was good, the staff were attentive (without being "in your face") and pleasant. Wines reasonably priced. Added to this the view along the river, excellent value for the money.

Being a fan of Jamie Oliver, I had to try his trendy eatery in Covent Garden. It did not disappoint. The way he is able to transform the simplest of ingredients into the most flavorful and complex combinations is the reason I continue to be the fan I am!
Pret is great for a quick healthy snack. It can be on the pricier side but it's worth it as the food is prepared fresh throughout the day. They have a range of sandwiches, salads and snacks.

Pret a manger in Piccadilly is a large well equipped restaurant. The coffee was good and the sandwiches and salads are freshly prepared. There is plenty of seating and a self clear system operates. The tables are clean as were the toilets. An ideal place for a quick coffee and sandwich for lunch while sight seeing or working.
I love the no bread options. I am always on low carb and it so good to find lovely food that IS NOT A SANDWICH !!!! More of the avacodo and no bread options please.

We visited the R.S. Hispaniola to celebrate a 90th Birthday. We were made very welcome, the staff were friendly and efficient. The food was excellent beautifully presented and very tasty. I t was an excellent venue but I think the weather made the day beautifully sunny with stunning views of London
A small out of the way Indian restaurant - Wonderful food, fantastic service & great value for money. Highly recommended + you get a free liqueur of your choice at the end of the meal. ;-)
We went here for a meal before a prom at the Royal Albert Hall. The food was lovely and the service attentive without being intrusive. Although at the time we went the rest
Went into the cellar which was chilly. Service excellent and food came out quickly. Food was very tasty, however was luke warm, over cooked and burnt.

Sunday lunch with a friend. We found the ambience pleasant - warm, busy and friendly. Service wa efficient. The set menu proved good value - especially for London. Soup was excellent. Pate likewise. Main courses were good but portions on the small size. Wine good and not overpriced. Will return.

I visited this restaurant on reccommadation and we were not disappointed with our meal. We had booked a table but we were late arriveing and this was not a problem despite being busy we were allocated a table. Service was good and the food was excellent. We had kalamari for starters ,followed by a mixed kebab ,and sea bass fillets which was excellent. Wine was good and tia maria coffee great. It has quite a good atmosphere and will definitely return to sample some more of the varied menu.

Visited the restaurant on Thursday evening with four friends. The waitress was ok but when the starters Arrived I sat there watching the others tucking in to theirs while I waited for what seemed an eternity until mine eventually Arrived.For my main I ordered the Taleggio Burger (described on the menu as covered in melted Taleggio cheese). Imagine my surprise when I discovered no cheese when I lifted up the bun top! I brought this to the attention of the waitress who informed me that they had ran out of cheese. I stated that it was then just a plain burger. She said that the only cheese they had was mozerella or blue. Not liking blue I opted for mozerella. So there I was again sitting waiting while the others were tucking in.When the burger Arrived I was told that they did have Taleggio after all and had added it to my burger. The burger was served without any apology.The food was ok but I found it very over priced for what you get.This was my first and definitely my last ever visit to a Strada restaurant.

I have eaten here a few times. Very tasty and well presented meals. Great place for family meals or group meals. Wide variety of vegetarian meals. The restaurant has very nice lighting to enhance mood if you choose a seat inside. Its best to choose tables outside during the summer time. You got to try the tea with lemon grass. Very refreshing. The waiters are very helpful and pleasant. Food is reasonably priced. Great menu. A real taste of Thai!

The food is simply stunning, among the best I have tasted in a long time. Staff are attentive and we had the bay seating on the ground floor which was comfortable and intimate. If you seek the porky you need to book the evening session. Ensure you save space for desert.

I have came to visit my friend in Fulham and he took me to this lovely little fish and chips. It is my first time in here and I loved it. It was a good big portion and was so tasty. I will be back in here for sure. Staff was so good to us as well .

This "fast" food chain has a really nice concept, the atmosphere is really cool and the food, fantastic. They even serve vegan dishes (yuhuu!) and the price range is acceptable. They are also found everywhere. I recomend it 100%!
Cozy, lovely, good service, comfortable.. everything you could ask for
This little Italian place makes many different kind of Lasagna and more... great capuccino and amazing Italian croissant it's very good for aperitiveo as well.

The restaurant is quite noisy with bad, loud music playing. The starters were good - but two of us had the lobster burger as the main course which was completly tasteless and boring!! No salad - dressing or seasoning - just a dry bun with tasteless lobster and a few pieces of onion! Terrible! We got one tiny portion of mayo for five people's portion of chips - and had to ask again and again to get more. The waitress was rude and didn't ask us how the food was before we asked for the bill, so seemed shocke when we displayed our dissatisfaction. Then without appologising tried to justify the quality. We also noticed after leaving that we were only served half of the bottle of the white wine we bought earlier.As we complained about the food she got very offended and didn't return to our table and we had to ask another waiter to pay the bill! All in all. A very bad experience so I definitely wouldn't recommend this place!!!

Me and my fiance stayed over at an hotel nearby and decided to have our first pub experience. We went to the second floor but not without waiting for 10 minutes for someone to tell us that that's where we were supposed to have dinner (I thought we were waiting for a table to vacate in the first floor). We waited a further 20 minutes for the waitress to finally take our order. Make no mistake: the space is wonderful. Nice, lavish decor, with a wonderful chandeliers, nearly entirely in red, black and gold tones, in a very almost 1800's-ish style which pleased us very much. Truly mesmerizing.I ordered a cheeseburger and my fiance ordered a salad. Those took another 15 minutes. This was not due to the kitchen, as we could see our food standing there, but due to the waitress doing nothing but talk (with the barman), and very little of what she was supposed to do (we could see other people in other tables having the same issue). Our food Arrived a tad bit cold on account of the described but it was still excelent. That's why I'm awarding 4 stars instead of 3, because I can't base my whole experience on the waiting alone. My fiance tried a wine there that is now a permanent presence in our home (a Chilean Pinot Noir).To wrap it up: excelent food, amazing wine, beautiful space and decor, but a service that leaves a lot to be desired. Not sure if it's supposed to be a part of the pub experience but... was not pleased nonetheless!

Celebrated our wedding annivesary at the Chancey Lane resturant. Quiet night which we liked as the service was personal and food great.Tasted about 10 wines before I choose a very good merlot. Food was excellent could not fault it.

very good Asian food and excellent service. Extremely cheap for London - about £28 a head including drinks for as much food as you can eat. However - you cant book. They make you queue outside for about 20 minutes then herd you into a bar. The bar is packed and everyone is buying beers and cocktails. After about half an hour you get shown to your table. Looking around there were a number of free tables. I suspect they create the queuing system to boost bar sales while you wait. They don't have to do this

Fun atmosphere right in the middle of Coveant Garden. Pizzas were delicious and the pork dish was unique and oh so tasty. Our server, Kaye, was very friendly and helpful when we asked questions about the menu and steered us to some terrific food...and some good wine. Thumbs up!

It's far from the run of the mill Indian restaurant for several reasons. In appearance a long room the majority of whose seats are high stools with a direct view of the cooking area behind one might be forgiven for mistaking it for a new branch of Spanish tapas chain Barracuda. In common with Barracuda as much service is offered from waiters within the kitchen as opposed to behind the diners in the restaurant proper. Then the food. From a menu diveided up into sections such as Bread/Rice, Veg, Meat, Fish and Pudding what I sampled was quite remarkable. Advised as a single diner to order two mains and a side I opted for smoked haddock with cauliflower and kichiri served in a stone bowl (Korean style) into which I stirred a raw egg yolk (Korean style). This was preceded by minced lamb with ginger which I accompanied with some rice. Both were mild subtle dishes but generously portioned. As I ate I watched parathas being rolled and pressed in front of me as well as sweet potatoes being grilled as well as a vast cauldron of an orange sauce bubbled away with vigour. A bottle of sparking water sufficed but I could have chosen a craft beer or a glass of wine from quite a selection. I concluded with a rice pudding with rhubarb and cardamom and even appreciated a filter coffee as opposed to espresso which was unavailable. This is a superb new addition to the London restaurant scene. My meal was one of the best ive tasted for some time of any cuisine, let alone Indian. And one can enjoy the theatre of watching everything being prepared as an added bonus:

I was pleasantly surprised by Jamie's restaurant here right in the middle of Covent Garden. Had to queue to get it but tables cleared quickly so not too long. Friendly, courteous, helpful staff. Good selection of food ranging from good old English fish and chips (posh style with pureed mushy peas!) to pizzas and steaks. Why the food is served on top of a beer mat on the plate I'm not too sure but hey oh that's London.
Lunched here yesterday. Had the burger and fries. The burger was cooked well, good quality and flavour. Thought it was very reasonable priced for central London. One of the best burgers ive eaten.

I treated my mother to lunch here and what a treat it was! We were offered a table that wasn't next to the glass so we requested to be moved when the next available table became free. The staff were very accommodating with this and moved us as soon as one did. The views were just incredible and luckily it was a sunny blue sky day. The food was lovely, I had the salmon fishcakes and my mum had the tuna tartare. The dessert was slightly disappointing, it was clearly pre-made but quite some time ago as it was very cold it didn't taste fresh. However I would definitely return, possibly for dinner next time!

Cafe Spice was a bit of a disappointment. I found the spice limited or refined into a taste that wasn't recognizable as Indian. The menu is limited and the offerings contemporary - by which I mean "unrecognizable". I love an Indian, but I was hard pressed to anticipate the tastes I was ordering. I'm not into kangaroo or ostrich and I wasn't sure if I'd be ordering sag/mushroom paneer or something entirely different (it wasn't clear on the menu). I played it safe so I could compare Spice with the hundreds of other Indian restaurants I'd eaten at. The dosa lacked the customary tang in the wrap and in a blind taste I'm not sure I'd identify the filling as anything but peppered potatoes. The dal on the other hand redeemed the meal - so ive added a star to this review. Spice is the place to come if you're bored with Indian cuisine and want a change or didn't like Indian spice to begin with.

As an American, I'm a bit frightened of pre-wrapped triangle sandwiches (of Jim Dandy nightmare fame). At Pret, the sandwiches and soups are made fresh everyday and they are very good. Smoked salmon with cream cheese is the lowest calorie option.

wife and I had lunch here and after enjoying the branch in Wandsworth on previous occasions we were left very disappointed here. The place was not particularly busy and the staff were initially very friendly. We ordered a main each and a side dish. The waitress didnt bother to write it down and I noticed she approached other tables on her way back to place the order. The mains Arrived and she had forgotten the side dish. We then had to wait to catch her and by the time the side was served I had finished my main. There was no apology offered. We then asked for coffees, and again she forgot. They finally Arrived after a very long wait and this time she had the grace to admit she just forgot! Finally it took her over 10 minutes to fetch the bill. It seemed that every time a member of staff passed customers tables they were intrusively trying to sell extra courses or extra drinks. To add insult to injury , they add 12% service charge. If they are going to charge it, they should provide it. We both chose pasta dishes and they were so so, at least the coffee is good, but £2.20 single espresso.

We were given a champagne lunch to replace a gift from our Son of a city cruise the later being cancelled by them. It was not cheap to get to London from Folkestone but we were looking forward to something special, how wrong can you be. We were welcomed aboard by a very polite girl on the desk and awaited the menu. What we were not aware that this menu was what is called the summer special, there was a choice of 3 starters none of which appealed and were offered instead some bread and olives, the bread 3 thin slices of some sort of French stick. For the main course I took the grilled trout with new potatoes, the wife went for the chicken with mushrooms and new potatoes, after 5 minutes of picking through the meal neither of us could eat our meals the potatoes were done in a rather strange sauce the mushrooms hardly existed and the trout looked more like salmon the chicken was a small leg with a bone stuck in the middle. Having returned the meals hardly touched we went for the ice cream which was delicious. The waitress apologised for the limited menu saying it was up to the Chef to decide on the Summer special and gave us 2 red rover tickets valid until 31/3/2016 as compensation. Sorry all, not impressed however you might be luckier than we were.

This restaurant had been recommended to me as having the best gluten free pizza - and it did not disappoint. We went on a Thursday evening and thought it would be busy but it was exceptionally quiet. Wine list is very good too. Definitely will return!

My husband adores Efes. When I'm out he relishes sneaking in there to get a takeaway! Food is very authentically Turkish. Fresh salad, tasty meats and lovely rice dishes. The staff are lovely too. Only improvement I could suggest is the lighting! It is bright in there!
My mother in law booked the place for my husband's birthday. The food is great and the service is very good as well. We will definitely come again.
There are nicer Byrons in London but if you're looking for a quick gourmet burger meal between shopping in Westbourne Grove, this does OK.

The One Tun is a great little pub and hotel off one of the side streets in London. If you like the pub atmosphere and the old style hotel with updated furnishings this is the place to be. Easy walking distance to many historic land marks. The staff was friendly and very helpful.

Although I rarely enter a restaurant completely empty, I was with friends in London on a hot afternoon somewhat later than normal lunchtime, and we liked the menu. The service was superb: attentive to a fault, and ready to supply all the information one wanted. The food was cooked to perfection, and when we left a tip of about 18%, the wait-staff insisted upon green tea for the road, gratis. One should not be misled by the unassuming appearance of this restaurant, for it is worth much more than they charge.

Popped in for a drink. Nice decor with great ambient lighting and soothing background music. Wide range of beer / wine. Wine on the pricey side £10.50 for 375mls but very nice. Probably adjusting to London prices :)
Popped in for some lunch. Food was ok, felt a bit rushed and not really welcomed by the staff. Was also a bit cramped in there. For a location such as this I would of expected a bit more.

I live locally and had heard good things... Tried it this evening, and was so disappointed with the menu. It is very small in terms of choice and eclectic, so possibly not to my taste. I had fish stew and the fish was undercooked, I did not bother sending it back as it had taken ages to come and I could not be bothered, in hindsight I should have said something as it was £18! Applebee's up the road is still my n1 around there, never let us down in 8 years that we have been going ther. Sadly for Elliot's it's the first nd last time we will be going there..

I eat here every now again with people from work and so have tried a fair selection of dishes from the menu. Nothing has been horrible but nothing stands out as delicious either. Service can be quite slow and I find the old cinema interior to be quite gloomy. It all feels a bit depressing to me. On the plus side the meal deals and daily menus are reasonably priced and being a Spoons it does have a great selection of ales.

Each time we have visited this restaurant we were never disappointed. Food is lovely and the staff are always eager to recommend something to you either food or wines. I had duck with port wine and cherries and it was lovely. They have a large menu so lots of choices and we always try and have something different each time we visit. I have various food allergies but Ibleo are always happy to help with this and cook sauces without onions etc for me. Nothing is too much trouble for them. Delightful place and well worth a visit.

I went to this restaurant for my first and last time a couple of days ago.As soon as I came in the restaurant one guy told me to choose my seat and he completely ignore me for the rest of the time I was there. Nobody gave me a drink menu,the tables were not set up properly,no glasses at all. ive tried to get the attention of a waiter (after 10 minutes that I was waiting for somebody to come)but she told me to wait for her few minutes. Obviously the waiter never came back. I decided to leave the restaurant without having my meal. Nobody even noticed I was leaving. I work in hospitality and I know what does it mean taking care of customers.just I found this attitude very unpleasant and unprofessional. I will not visit again this place

The sushi was just....wrong. Overcooked rice and very poor ingredients, full of mayo and sauce. The fried dishes were terrible, soft and greasy, as if they had been cooked an hour ago. In general a very mediocre experience, with loud music and not great service.There's much better restaurants in Ealing, just go down the street to Kobe.

It wasn't clear why the waitress was asking if we wanted mozzarella di buffala or "ordinary" mozzarella or a combination of both. This became clear when the bill Arrived which exceeded what we expected to pay thanks, no doubt, to the fact that we opted for the mozzarella combo. Nowhere on the menu was there an explanation for this.

Looks nice, £20 a bottle of champagne is a steal and the wine list was pretty good. Unfortunately that's pretty much where the good ended. Much of the menu was unavailable (this at 7pm) and the service, whilst friendly, was perplexing. Apparently the cheese and meat platter for 4 was unavailable, but they could serve us 2 platters for 2 with identical components to the platter for 4. The components remained mysterious. Several of the items we ordered just never Arrived. No biscuits or bread with cheese/charcuterie, and the portion of bread that came with the rillettes was minute. Headaches the next day were outstanding!First bottle of fizz Arrived with 7 glasses, 5 filled, then the rest of the bottle whisked to the opposite side of the busy room and 2 glasses taken away empty. After several minutes of bemusement we had to ask for more glasses and help ourselves. On the second bottle, 6 glasses were filled, 2 twice, with one person left with nothing. This did prompt profuse apologies from the poor confused and somewhat stressed-looking waiter. The door policy seemed very strict, but the place was half empty. When we went upstairs for a cocktail, there were more empty tables than filled. Cocktails were tasty and packed a wallop though.All in all, a confusing night.

As there were 6 of us having a booth made this venue perfect for our anniversary celebrations with the family. The beef wellington was fantastic (although expensive) and the strawberry souffle amazingly light and fluffy. Staff were attentive but discreet enough to let us 'party' away. No pressure put on us to leave. Love the button for drink requests! Passion fruit cocktail particularly wonderful. Beautiful building. Excellent toilets. A huge success.
Good food, smiley and quick service. There are definitely better burgers in London however this is a decent place to have one

We dropped in here just off Trafalgar Square for breakfast. All the same price, 6 pounds so why not order the "Big Breakfast"? It did not disappoint! Two eggs, sausages, bacon, brown beans, grilled slice of mushroom, grilled slice of tomato, black sausage. I ordered the side of toast and of course the wonderful unlimited coffee, brewed cup by cup by the barissta. I couldn't quite finish it all, but it was great. The service was very good as well. Fun atmosphere. I would definitely recommend!
As someone who travels with a vegetarian it is often difficult to find quality meatless food. Pret is on nearly every corner so it was simple to grab a quick snack where ever we were.

Stumbled upon this place by accident How lucky were we ! Tried to go into one down the road where I was totally ignored by the staff You could never accuse this restaurant of having unprofessional staff like that !The young lady that served us could not do enough for us Added to that the food was excellent What a lucky find Totally deserving of 5 stars We will return

its so nice so nice amazing yummy yummy wow nice cutlerys. wow wow wow .. wow wow the toilet is confusing but still i manage to find it beautiful door step .. big fornt door push and pull outdoor tables and chairs aswell to many tils aswell waitress is always wearing skirt but its orayt . this sticky rice is so sticky well explained on the menu .. keep it up i recommend you on my other friends .. thank you and have a good food . arrivea arrivea boom boom boom !

Tasty wrap as expected and quick service.Extra payment for taking a seat. Ok! But then their service is getting less because the toilet is out of order! Thats not nice after drinking a bottle of water. (Pret a Manger, Bakerstreet)

Went with a client for a Thursday business lunch. Other reviews sum up the 'entering' quite well but the trip downstairs is pleasantly rewarded. The place was very busy and having booked (recommend you do this) we had a table in the corner.Service was attentive but not overly so.The menu is quite French as you would expect and we went for the set menu: Goose & mustard terrine and an English Onglet with triple cooked chips which amounted to 6 chips each. Food came quickly and was well cooked.Atmosphere was busy but not over noisy. With a bottle of wine and the set menu the bill for 2 was £92 including service. Perhaps a tad on the high side I felt for the food we ordered.Will return but may leave the wine off.
Had the Pad Thai chicken and it really tasted like something you would expect coming out of a jar... Service was okay, not good.

We were seated quickly and politely by a lovely young lady. Service was mediocre but quick and the food came quick as well! People are complaining about the noise from the street performers but if you ask me that's the best bit about convent garden!!! Not bad!!

Had good lunch there, great place to meet up. Yummy wrap toasted with goats cheese, rocket and chutney - fantastic quality and so reasonable for central London. On the edge of Covent Garden, not far from Trafalgar Square. Wish I'd had room for the home made Capuccino Cake but I was full - shame - looking forward to returning.

When in London we stay in the Paddington Station area near Hyde Park, and are on the lookout for good restaurants we can walk to. This trip we had a really good meal at Pere Michel and enjoyed the friendly, neighborhood atmosphere. My wife and I both had the Dover sole, which was cooked perfectly and accompanied by fresh vegetables. We will definitely return on our next trip to the UK.

We were walking around Covent Garden looking for somewhere to eat and came across this place. Many of the tables were reserved but we were there early so were lucky enough to have one of those as we would be off before they needed it. The food was lovely and the staff were very polite. We enjoyed voting for what music was to come on next. Happy hour is always a winner!

Absolutely stunning views showing London lit up at its best on a beautiful clear evening. Large lively bar and restaurant. Extensive cocktail menu, all the drinks are expensive but would expect that at such a Fabulous Location. Limited menu, my vension was delicous, we then enjoyed Monkfish and John Dory. Restaurant staff were professional and attentive. Would certainly go again prepare yourself for a hefty bill. Service charge is automatically added. Worth going for views alone!! We enjoyed a great evening.

Had a pie here with mash and gravy- it was delicious. This is a nice different addition to the high street which is already filled with great curry houses. Another aspect of Kennedys is their cleanliness in store and their hygiene. Recommended!

Lovely food, I had the beyta it was so good, really tasty, the meat is very good also in the mixed grill, to recommend, the service is very good also, only the room is a bit overcrowded... but prices are fine

We are staying in Tufnell Park and stopped for lunch having been there once before. The food is really well done. Way better than the majority of cafes in the world. Marvelous sandwiches with a fresh salad garnish. Try the humus sandwich. Went back for breakfast today also great.
We had a wonderful Sunday lunch at the Princess of Shoreditch - really delicious food, a broad range of beer and wine, a calm atmosphere and attentive, friendly service.

I had not previously thought of reviewing the Princess of Shoredtich because it is several months since I was there. But in the meanwhile, I have recommended people to the place who have subsequently thanked me for my tip.It is a true Princess, nestled away in a great part of London - a reasonably quiet yet somehow busy area, full of eclectic shops, interesting food choices etc. I had great food at a few places in my few days staying in Shoreditch but the Princess stands out.I remember that the restaurant offered a variety of fish, but not your everyday run-of-the-mill fish. I had mackerel, delicately prepared, accompanied by steamed vegetables and some creamy mash as a side. It was a business dinner and I recall that my business assocaiate had a very nice lamb roast or similar. He said that it was excellent. We shared an artisan cheese collection and for some reason when selecting I opted for a variety of English cheeses, something that I would normally never do. I would take French, Swiss or Italian chesse elsewhere, but how could I when we were in an English pub-style restaurant in an old, but gentrifying, part of London.I recall that the choice of beer was good. I do not recall, but no doubt I would have had a great pot of tea with my cheese.I do recall that the service was OK, nothing too flash and that the atmosphere was very good. People around us were all having fun.The Princess of Shoreditch is well worh a visit. I hope to return some time also.

We ate here the night after my finace completed the London marathon. Having booked online which was a really simple process, we had included in the notes that the meal was a marathon celebration. However, when we Arrived the service was disappointing to say the least. Our orders were taken and it seemed that there was nothing available that we asked for. Our drinks were eventually delivered and my drink was last (I had to asked for my drink). Our food order was then taken and again, a lot of the requests we made we were advised that there was none available. Really poor experience and really poor service. TGI's as a chain is usually a great restaurant, this one lets them down!
The food is always amazing here, I always come back.Never had a bad experience or not enjoyed my meal.

Authenticate London Fish and Chips. I stood in line with several Police Officers and cab drivers. That should tell you everything about this place. Luckily I had my Amex card, as they don't take any other, cash or Amex. It's take out only, but great.

Who ever says that you should not eat fish on mondays has obviously not been here. The fish was very fresh and tasted super. If the food is fresh then the interior is the exact opposite. It has probably looked like this for ever - which is rather charming. We sat at one of the long bar tables where you have your own waiter "stuck" to your table. I have never experienced that before so in the beginning it felt a bit strange. So maybe not the place for business discussions or other things that might be sensitive for other ears. A bit pricey but you are at least sure to get very good food. Sorry meat lovers, this is probably not a place for you.
i douldn't find variety andwiches, most of them are coming with cucumber and onion... not suitable for me and too expensive for the quality.

My family and I went out for a special evening. The food was absolutely stunning and a fun experience - each course was a new surprise! The crockery and general decor was stunning. Service was knowledgeable, friendly and welcoming. Looking forward to going back for another special celebration soon. Thank you everyone!
Totally rude, sat for good five minutes, staff completely ignored us , even though they saw us coming in, probably won't be coming in again and would not reccomend to anyone.
Venerdi never disappoints. Fantastic service and the food is always on point. Great seafood, pastas and pizza. Best Italian in The Hackney area by a long way.

We already had lower expectations for the restaurant given we were at a mall, but the food was really sub-par. The Jungle Chicken curry was very watery and not very flavorful. The strips of chicken inside were surrounded with skin/fat, just very low quality meat, and there weren't many veggies to make up for it. My friend had the Pat King Talay and was also unimpressed and only ate about half of it.The green papaya salad was delicious, though!

This is our favourite local. Great food, reasonably priced and Jesus and the other guys are always friendly and helpful...great service with a smile. We've never had a bad experience and will keep returning.

Visited this branch of Wagmama by default as were late out and it was the only place still serving and as we hadn't been to a Wagamama before it was a leap of faith! We were greeted politely at the door & given a choice of seating, the service was excellent and polite all the way through. Food was excellent...like some others have mentioned there can be a difference between times receiveing your food but it was okay, Food was lovely, Japanese beer excellent and the prices were good...all in all a great experience and we shall visit one of these again in the future for sure. Recommended.
Covent Garden It was a great idea to choose this restaurant and the waitress Beatrix was amazing and so very helpful *******

ULI achieved legendary status over the years in its original All Saints Road setting, and then one day in 2013, it closed. Since then, Notting Hill and the surrounding area has been all the worse for it, but now, finally, ULI is back (!), and in a new more visible position near Notting Hill tube station, just off Kensington Park Road (next to Portobello Pizza).And what a return!The owner, Michael Lim, is quite possibly the finest host in London, and I challenge anyone to find better Asian food at such reasonable prices. The resurrection of ULI is one of the best things to happen to NH in years, and there's now even a great outdoor area for the summer. Forget The Shed, Mazi, or any of the other local young pretenders. ULI is the original, and it's better than all of them.
Food fine and reasonably priced, Staff friendly and helpful. Reasonably priced wine list. Restaurant large but not intimidating.
nice venue, good food. cocktails were great, waiters could have been more attentive, waited ages for a drink refill and the bill.
Ordered eggs benedict which was seriously horrible. My husband ordered eggs on toast, plus a couple of coffees and it came to something like 37 quid!

I have been here twice, the first time it was great, second time put me off I will not be returning. I had to ask for cutlery twice, slow service, had to get up and start to walk out to get the bill. Starters and mains didn't come together for myself and my partner and was so cold we had to send two of the dishes back. Was sadly disappointing. First time was brilliant, what went so wrong?

We were surprised at how quickly the food came out, not even 20 minutes and how big the portions were. The prawn dumplings were very good and meaty. I originally chose beef ho fun but wanted chicken instead as my stomach cannot handle beef but I was informed it was not possible which maybe an indicator to how fresh the food is and explains the fast cooking time. I then chose singapore noodles, the only downside to my noodle dish was that all the meat, veg etc had failed to be mixed together so presentation was poor but it still tasted very nice especially the fish cake. The service is prompt and no waiting ages for someone to take your order etc.The price wasn't that bad either but we had chosen dishes that were selected 20% off.
Relatively new. Very good atmosphere and seemingly very popular. Food very good. Service also. Expensive but pretty much worth it.

Went to Sahara Grill in white chaple(new road ) with my family, we had a grilled chicken with chips & etc, food was good and waiter Jalal he served us it was wonderful service, thanks Jalal to looking after us. must recommend my friends.

Used to be a regular here but hadn't been since the new referbishment. Been three times now and I have to say it's great, everything looks so pretty and the staff are friendly and helpful. I'd definitely recommend the food; extremely tasty and good portion sizes! It's still pretty early on under the new management but Sam seems like he's leading this pub in the right direction!

My wife and I and two friends had lunch here on 1 November and it was excellent. We each shared the chicken which came with lovely vegetables and roast potatoes and a yorkshire pudding!! More than enough for two to share. All washed down with an excellent red wine recommended by our ver attentive and friendly waitress (Silva) A busy bustling place and better to have a table upstairs if you want a slightly less noisy environment. Will definitely go back
Tonkotsu Bar and Ramen was satisfactory in taste. It was nourishing and fresh, but slightly bland. An exemplar of the highest standard of service and cleanliness. Altogether a pleasant experience!!

My husband and I went for lunch just a quick bite as we only had an hour to spare. The receptionist gave us a lovely table but needed it back in one hour which suited us. I ordered two glasses of champagne whilst my husband went outside to make a phone call, I waited and waited my husband came back in still not a drink insight. We asked to order as we were short on time and that they needed the table back, we asked about the drinks which finally came a little warm and a bit flat but hey not the end of the world. We started to get slightly concerned when other tables were getting food and our starters still hadn't Arrived so much so the waiter had already gone to find out where our food was, we waited again, the starters Arrived, we now had 20 minutes before we had to be on our way and they wanted this table back, we were asked if we wanted our mains?which Arrived absolutely stone cold doesn't take Einstein to work out what had happened there so our mains were cooked again, we were now half an hour late for giveing back the table, the manager who was very apologetic told us not to worry they had given the customers another table? He's obviously a magician as well as a manager wow amazing find ivey restaurant.Unfortunately for us this is our second bad experience the first time we were a party of 8 for a birthday so we put the slow service down to the restaurant having teething problems but I guess this is just how this restaurant works,very slowly. On a positive note the food is of good quality and generally cooked really well.

This seemed a great place to visit for half term treat. On the board outside the entrance it states a children's menu/options available. When we asked for this, the waiter looked blank! We asked again and we're not offered a menu, but we're simply told we could get a cheese toastie with tomato or ham!!!!! This is not a children's menu! It would be better not to state you have options for children available.In the end we split an adult option for the children.The best part of the visit was the ice cream, you can create your own sundae or enjoy one of the elaborate creations from the menu. If we decide to visit again it will only be for ice cream.

We visited as an alternative to eating in the London Lancaster hotel across the road, which we were staying in for a conference on site.Bread, olives and crudities on the table immediately. Shortish but very interesting and varied menu, and the starters and mains were obviously from top quality ingredients, delicious and substantial. We did not have the room for dessert, much to our disappointment.We chatted to two other customers. One had been coming to the restaurant for special occasions and nights out in London (from Maidenhead) for over 20 years, which says a lot. Another had pooped round the corner for his evening meal. This is Sussex Gardens when all said and done!Outlook was villagey, the road is a cul de sac. The atmosphere inside is cosy and french.One of a very few restaurants clearly marked for a return journey.We thought that at £50 for two starters and mains, drinks and gratuity, it was excellent value.

We went in this this restaurant by checking TripAdvisor. And we really loved the Pizzas. You have the option for a 13" or for 3£ more the 18" version. We are from France and do not really have an idea about inches. So we were hungry but we remain reasonable and took the 13". It really sufficient for a good eater like me. I think a 18 inch would be sufficient for a "Normal" 4 people family ! It is not only a size question, the Pizzas are really tasty and the pasta very thin. You can go there with closed eyes. You want be dissappointed about the Pizzas.

Ate here on a sat lunch before taking my daughter to the theatre. Can't complain about the food, a little costly as always I think £15 for just a normal burger is a lot and you get no salad or coleslaw with that literally just thr burger and fries plus an extra pound to get sweet potato fries, which I don't understand either as they aren't any more expensive to buy. Anyway the food was nice the waiter was rude. He took the plates away for the starters while I was still eating and literally stood there and watched me finish mine before snatching the plate from under me. No break between that and the main either came out virtually straight away. My other gripe was the coke refills well because they had filled it with ice to the top it was more like coloured water by the time we finished our coke which didn't take more than a minute as must have been no more than an inch of it with the ice was still full to the brim with ice. No joke there must have been 20 Ice cubes in it. They obviously doing this to save money well not with me I just said no ice for the next one which the waiter seemed annoyed with. I didn't complain but had this not been a refill drink I would have done as they are trying to rip people off. Just appeared to be our table aswell, as other people with refills didn't appear to have anywhere near the amount of ice cubes we did. I will return as I always do but I hope the service is better next time!

My wife and I dined at The Good Ship Benefit (perhaps better known as the RS Hispaniola) on Sunday 21 August 2016 to celebrate our 34th wedding anniversary. I have pondered over which star rating to give this establishment because, whilst some areas of the ship deserve 4 stars, other areas fall short of this rating. I have therefore decided, that overall it should get 3 stars. Externally, the ship looks shaby and is in need of extensive renovation work. The Benefit cosmetic firm, who have taken over the ship for a short period have, I expect, made a good job of theming the interior, the decor of which is almost entirely pink and black. However, this does not appeal to me. There were quite a few young people on board who, I am sure, loved the decor! We were greeted by a very enthusiastic and friendly waitress who was lovely but, at times was irritatingly over enthusiastic and lovely! We had drinks on the open foredeck, which was lovely, and enjoyed commanding views of the South Bank. We were using a voucher, and a corresponding menu. This certainly represented good value for money, but I would not have the same view if I had to pay full price. The service, by our constantly enthusiastic waitress was good and efficient. The ambiance of the restaurant was fine and whilst the food was good, it was certainly not outstanding. Given the deal we had, the meal was good value for money - £28.00 per head for three courses plus a glass of bubbly each. I certainly wouldn't pay much more than that but not bad value for central London. The portions were somewhat frugal and just about adequate. My soup was tasty but not that hot. My wife's duck starter was well presented but the duck portion was inadequate. We both had sea bass for our main dish which, again was well presented but the good level of presentation was not reflected in the overall taste. The bass was well cooked - nice and flaky with a crisp skin. I had sorbet for dessert and my wife had a sort of brÌÈlee. They were OK. A hefty gratuity was automatically added to the bill. My wife enjoyed the beauty area, which sadly, was as good as empty. This should not be the case at the height of the tourist period! Clearly, the Benefit company took on this venture to hit the tourist period and the younger generation.I might return on a voucher basis but I would certainly not pay anywhere near full price for what you get. I cannot blame the Benefit organisation for the decor not being to our liking. That is a personal opinion. They are clearly targeting the younger generation who seemed to outweigh the oldies last Sunday. The quality of the food needs improving.We enjoyed the setting and service, although the latter was somewhat over the top. Overall, we had a lovely wedding anniversary.

I have to say the food was better and smaller than I though. However, everyone here is so nice, friendly and lovely, they looks enjoying their job and welcome everyone! It makes ppl want to visit again!

Pouring rain, needing some space to catch my breath and have a bite to eat, I came to the Reform and Social club purely by chance. Ideal for a single person, sat on table with lots of space, looking out in the dining room. Clubby feel to it and quite quiet for a midweek lunchtime. I also chose the £16 offer and had the lobster burger - not had it before and it was really tasty! Wine was of good quality good. The service was friendly without being over effusive, just right! The only thing that let it down (and so not five stars) was the poor side salad ordered as an extra which was purely leaves and some had gone brown - not good guysI'd still return though and value for money was excellent

My partner and I were looking for somewhere to eat before a show at Underbelly. We Arrived 80 minutes before the show and although the restaurant was busy, the staff assured us that they would be able to serve us in plenty of time.We were directed to a table on the side balcony and offered some water with ice and lemon to quench our thirst while waiting to order. For speed we ordered dough balls to start, followed by frutti di mare pasta. Both Arrived quickly, were extremely tasty and reasonably priced for central London. Staff were friendly and welcoming. Hope to visit again the next time we are in London.

We wanted a quality Fish and Chips experience. We asked "where do Londoners go for fish and chips?" and were directed here. It ain't fancy dining, but the fish was fresh, moist, the batter crisply fried and the beer (thankfully) cold.

I'm sure most people are familiar with pret - sandwiches and salads are of a good standard; not cheap, but not excessively priced and the toasted sandwich options are always good! lunch portion-size a little small, but coffee and drink selection very good.
Absolutely great place! Delicious food, very friendly and open host and owner of the pub, Tom. Best pies in London. Should definitely go in for a drink.

ive been a fan of this concept in the past but taking a friend to this branch this week I was dissatisfied. In the end it's very expensive and I was still a bit hungry when we left, despite a decent sized bill to pay, with only one alcoholic drink ordered. Music too loud to hear each other didn't help and the service was perfunctory and a bit dislocated with not much personality. Beware the £8 tiny Negroni and the 3 meatballs in a portion. Wouldn't go back...there are just lots of better places that offer better value.

At first glance, this looks like an authentic, quality tapas restaurant with friendly staff and an appealling menu. However, when the food Arrived, it soon became obvious it couldn't be further from the truth. Our order Arrived in less than 5 minutes and was the most bland tapas we've ever eaten. The spinach dish was just a blob of stringy spinach with a few chick peas thrown over it. The garlic muchrooms appeared to be straight out of a tin. We ended up leaving over half the food, it was either flavourless or disgusting. ive never felt the need to complain about a meal at a restaurant but when the waiter asked if everything was okay, I couldn't lie & politely explained our disatisfaction. Despite this, not a penny was knocked off the bill. Perhaps we should have insisted - but instead I'll vote with my feet and never go back.

Just Arrived home after an excellent dinner with three friends that are vegetarians...The chef came to our table to help us choose some great vegetarian dishes. The small menu is so imaginative. We ordered six dishes followed by three desserts.Dishes are beautifully presented.The tapenade is great so is the polenta and potato pancakes - the avocado and egg -not forgetting the lovely toasted bread. The plates are smallish. I suggest that you order them all just like you would in a tapas restaurant. Food is so fresh and delicious. I love the pistachio warm tart but want to eat them all again next week.If you have a glass of cava it will come in a very pretty old fashioned champagne coupe glass. So elegant !The waiter is extremely pleasant .All in all a great place !!

everything here is made fresh fresh fresh - i had their sandwiches 2x while here for a week and a muffin for breakfast at the airport.my favorite sandwich was the chicken and avacadothe banana bread/cake is amazing!don't forget to try the sparkling apple drink
Went there with 3 friends and I have to say the food and service was excellent. We had sunday roast.

We love Japanese food and my daughter is vegan, so after a long day of walking around London, we actually went out of our way to go to this restaurant. The menu warns that because the food is prepared from scratch it might take a bit longer, but we did not find this to be the case (perhaps they feel the need to warn people who are used to fast food, a sad commentary on our eating habits these days). The food is not the cheapest, but it was delicious. I also appreciated the nice selection of organic beers. The problem occurred after we had finished our meal, around 9:15 p.m. Normally in a restaurant, when it is obvious that the guests have finished eating, the waiter approaches after a couple of minutes to check if something else (e.g. desert or coffee) is wanted, or "just the bill". But here_nothing. There were several people working in the restaurant, and there was just another table of customers besides us, but still we were ignored for a good 10 minutes. I finally went up to a guy who was sitting at the cash register and was apparently busy reading post etc., and asked for the bill. He apparently could not be bothered to do it, so it took a further 5 minutes before a waiter appeared from the kitchen and was informed that we wanted the bill, which he then brought to us. This is really unacceptable behaviour in a restaurant that works out at a minimum of 20 GBP per person, and it was a sour ending to an otherwise pleasant dining experience.

A little baffled by the wide range of reviews, but apparently the staff must vary in quality and we lucked out. Service was a little brusk, but they seated us on a busy Saturday despite showing up without a reservation. We ordered the specials, including the dessert and were quite pleased. Waiter was content to allow us to finish our wine before ordering dessert, which isn't always the case elsewhere. We plan to go back.

Fabulous food! We had the starter of beef black label and goat cheese tagliatelle in soup - both were delicious. Lamb and Halibut for the main course, very tasty and the most beautiful desserts: limoncello souflee and raspberry flan .The service was excellent - well done ! First time over the past 5 years we have received a bill without already adding so called discretionary service charge therefore we left 20% tips. We will be back soon !

Does not allow reservations and the Thurs before Easter weekend it was heaving so even an early arriveal of 7.00 pm meant a half hour wait before we were seated. We were in the mood for plenty of Prosecco and lots of nibbly food to share. We wanted a place with good ambience where our conversation was our own - not overheard by others, or where the music was so loud we had to shout. Polpo gave us just what we were in the mood for. Food was plentiful and good quality, service was attentive but not saccharine. The meatballs and ham hock were particularly memorable and the chocolate salami much loved as well as laughed over. Booze not overtly expensive as the Prosecco is only £30 a bottle which is cheap by heart of London standards.

We recently visited this great fish and chip restaurant once again having been here many times before. The quality of the food was again superb, very nicely cooked cod and skate served with chips and mixed pickles. Absolutely brilliant - cannot fault the service and atmosphere. We shall certainly return on our next visit to London.

I ate her last April & was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the burgers available. I had the vegetarian mushroom burger with feta cheese-it was delicious. The service was friendly and efficient. I just couldn't fault it at all . I will definitely be returning when I'm in London soon.

Day trip to London and decided to enjoy the atmosphere by eating in the middle of Covent Garden. The greeter offered to seat us immediately in the basement area but as we wanted the atmosphere chose to wait the 10 minutes they quoted, which ennded up being less than that. Lovely lunch and great service.
Fantastic pub, god gave us his only son, and this little gem of a pub in the city. Cheers Eddie, great year and I will be back in Feb once my livers had a little rest. Great staff and excellent food.

Extremely simple yet extremely tasty and fresh. The creamed spinach was every bit as good as the steak, and the chips (more American than British) were flavorful, having been fried in the beef fat. Even the ice cream at the end was great.Service was extremely quick and friendly.

I recently hired the top floor to host my 40th birthday party. I booked the venue online with the manager Phil who made the process very easy and sent me a link to show my DJ's and Live PA act the equipment available (which made it so much easy for technical details). On the night, Paul the Bar Manager was very helpful as were the bar staff. The opening hours are great too, allowing me to have my party from 8pm-4am. I would definitely have a party here again.The only downfall is the top bar doesn't have its own set of toilets so it means going down to the basement.

We came here as our last night in the area looking for a restaurant that serves excellent traditional food and had excellent service. Unfortunately everything was just better than average. The location and view were great. The wait staff was very friendly and showed us to the restroom when asked, and even provided us with the internet password. Unfortunately as the dining room filled up they were too busy to give us attentive service. There were only two team members managing the whole dining room, which was full as our courses started coming out. As far as our dinner is concerned the appetizers were nice and the main course was also nice. The steak came with a very good sauce and the lamb was very tender. However, the lamb was served three ways and the rack was way over cooked. This restaurant has the potential to be great.

Booked in here for 8 people on a Friday lunchtime and after boarding the stationary ship it felt a bit like the Mary Celeste, which had me a little worried. However, I needn't have been as the food and service were both excellent and we all had an excellent experience. We had the set menu, so limited on choice but everything was cooked perfectly, also the website I booked through meant we got a free glass of prosecco each, which was a bonus. Would definitely recommend (unless you get sea sick, as you do feel the boat moving) for a very pleasant dining experience.

We'd all had bad weeks but all I can say is that the silky smooth and perfectly flavoured beef and guinness pie accompanied by a nice pint of Harvey's meant that we all cheered up pretty quickly.Even our veggie friend was happy.This place is a proper pub, in central London - a rare and wonderful thing.

Nice decor and music, passable service and food (thai beef salad) enjoyable. However, was shocked to receive bill with 'optional' 12.5% service charge on the bill. They charged an EXTRA £2.11 to bring me ONE PLATE of food. I went to pay at the bar and questioned the charge. Uninterested bar staff said 'you'll have to discuss it with the manager'. The manager? Seriously? I paid and left as was just off a flight and far too tired to argue a surcharge of £2 - but i won't be back and i don't recommend you visit either.

All very good ideas but terrible execution. Asparagus soup served in tea pots - such a mess to pour into your own bowl. They managed to serve raw uncooked fish fingers in kids menu - it could have been disastrous ...yes they changed it ...
Stopped here for a coronation chicken bap and coffee.Used to frequent this sandwich bar years ago when I worked in Covent Garden.Still excellent! The coffee is the best I have had in London.

Hot Mozzarella & Tomato with a very nice chipotle? Sauce baguette. Filled the gap before early morning flight!Complemented by a lovely cup of Cappuccino. I know where to go now for that early morning pick me up!
excellent service from Ramona, made us feel at home and was very polite. Any problems were dealt with straight away. We'll definitely go back again.
Cosy and intimate bistro with friendly staff and great tasting food. Will definitely be visiting again!

Absolute horrible experience. I came to have dinner by myself. Apparently this is looked down on in this restaurant. They treated me like I was unworthy of a table upstairs with everyone else and acted like they were pulling strings to "figure things out". Next thing you know I'm being brought downstairs in a small area of basement seating by MYSELF. I had to turn my feet on an angle to get down the stairs. It was completely empty and separated from the rest of the restaurant. No atmosphere. Just a hole in the wall. I told the waiter that I didn't want to sit down there by myself and that it was weird. It was weird they would put me down there when there were tables upstairs and especially put me down there by myself. He said he had to ask if they can do something else and to wait there. Ummm ok.... I decided it was crazy for me to stand in an empty basement, waiting to see if I can be treated like a worthy customer, so I just went upstairs. The original host told me "madam I'm sorry we have nothing for you". A few tables were empty. I couldn't even respond to that and just walked out. Mind you, I was very presentable and respectable looking. I was simply a female dining by myself. Dispicable. Michelin behavior? I don't think so.

I was referred to Park Terrace by one of the surrounding hotels, this was due to a Birthday celebration for my partner. Absolute superb meals and excellent service. Only slight minus point expect to pay 5 star hotel prices!Will be back again before Xmas with family!

Visited with my two daughters and husband for a roast dinner. It was pretty awful especially for the money very small portions and looked like it had just come out of the microwave. Such a shame as we were really looking forward to it.

We ate here prior to going to a live gig at Shepherds Bush Empire a few minutes walk away. We chose Phad Thai Jay noodles and a Ginger Beef with Jasmine Rice. Both dishes were served very quickly and were piping hot and delicious. The service was attentive and friendly. We also had a nice cold Singha beer, a glass of Merlot and a Chilean Sauvignon Blanc. The bill came to £37.51 including 10% service charge.

I ate here last night with a friend. We hadn't booked but were given a table which was booked one hour later and told we would have to vacate it at 8 PM. i was a little concerned given some of the comments about slow service, but in fact the service was very prompt and the waitress was really helpful. We both had onglet steak which came served with beetroot, crispy potato with garlic mayonnaise and a side salad. It was quite a simple meal, but every element of it was perfectly prepared and absolutely delicious. The steak was perfectly cooked and tender, the mayonnaise was rich and garlicy. We both thoroughly enjoyed it.The restaurant itself has a bright modern interior and is situated within Borough market, which was very busy. At £35 per head for one main course, some sourdough bread and one bottle of wine, I thought it was a little bit pricey but worth it for the quality of the food.

For my friends birthday a group of 6 of us was invited to have dinner and drinks at Groucho. Of course we were all very excited about going inside here and we did see a few relatively famous faces which was fun! I'm not sure what I had expected, but I was very pleased with the place overall. Upon entry the staff were friendly and we were shown upstairs to our table. It was so relaxed, relatively low key lighting but no so dark as you couldn't see - though it wasn't so much the light that made the crab in my crab salad difficult to spot, more that there wasn't that much of it (as expected). The food was nice, the burger and tuna steak my friends had looked very good indeed, as did the pulled pork. Our waitress was very friendly and put us all at ease right away. Unfortunately I didn't stay until the wee hours - if I had I'm sure this review would have been even more enthusiastic. As such a very nice, relaxed atmosphere. Nice food without stuffy service and very friendly waiting staff, a good birthday was had by all!!

Turned up towards the end of a Sunday lunch serving. They were already really busy and clearly a couple of staff down on the day, despite this we were promptly found a table and given great service. Excellent staff, delightful food and some very drinkable wines. Would

Booked a birthday party for me and some friends had great night, service great and cocktails lush, food did what it said on the tin, one of waiters went extra mile for us, that's the sort of place it is....:-)

The location and the views are amazing ....hence the rating.The wine was very nice and the staff friendly. We were a party of 10 and I am trying to be fair. We were a group of friends from all parts of the country enjoying a fabulous weekend in London to celebrate our friends 60th. Her husband had booked the Hispaniola as a climax to the whole weekend. Several things on the menu were not available and some were substituted. My husband ordered Rib eye and was told that it had been replaced by Top Side, which in my experience usually comes in slices. When it Arrived it was served like a thick steak , my friends son had the same and he was completely unable to cut his....at all. It was raw in the middle, which rather than making it tender , had the opposite effect. There was no gravy at all on the plate and just 2 enormous slices of carrot ( which would have been too big for a horse ) and a couple of pieces of brocolli. The lady who's birthday asked for more veg, as she had even less, when extra carrots and brocolli Arrived they were raw and she sent them back. 3 people had lamb and each piece was a different cut... again served like lumps of meat. The gravy was horrible, red wine not cooked out and the same whether you had chicken lamb or beef. To say we were disappointed is an understatement, we couldn't face a dessert, called for the bill and left. To be fair 2 of the steaks were removed from the bill but the point was, the day was ruined.

On board is a beauty bar (10% off all Benefit cosmetics), the Brow Lounge, and Lashitude restaurant with oodles of lounging space on deck and impressive views of London. The cocktail bar - THE VAULT - is open on Friday and Saturday. The cocktails are to die for. Honestly, the best Espresso Martini I have ever tasted. Even if you are not a drinker, it is worth a visit just for the decor (you could be forgiven for thinking that you have fallen into a James Bond film).

I go to Pret a Manger very regularly! Usually I don't like sandwiches in the UK but Pret a Manger is always good and tasteful! Wherever you see a Pret a Manger pop in and try the fresh made sandwiches! Once you have tried it you will never want another sandwich!

I visited Tootoomoo for a girly night of food and cocktails and it did not disappoint, in fact it exceeded my expectations. The staff were welcoming, attentive and friendly. The setting is fresh and fun - street art designs and funky furniture make for a relaxed atmosphere. But the food is the highlight of Tootoomoo- the best pan-asian food I have ever eaten! The waiter ordered a selection for us, and the choices were perfect, he recommended the salmon and the sushi - something I would have never tried before! The watermelon cocktail is so good and went down an absolute treat! We were last to leave and were not rushed, the bill was surprisingly reasonable and the service and atmosphere over the course of the evening was brilliant! I have already booked for my next evening in Tootoomooo and intend on bringing the kids this weekend after checking out the kids menu!

Awesome bar atmosphere, we didn't order any food but the cocktails were off the hook. Try the Pimms Cup!! Bar tenders were a little spicy but I think that's what they are shooting for. Worth the wait and the price.

My girlfriend and I visited for Sunday lunch. After waiting for 5 minutes for anyone to appear to take us to a table, we were served distinctly average tasting food. The pink beef was well done, the vegetables simply a pile of cabbage and all for £14 a piece. They then have the cheek of adding the optional 12.5% service to the bill. We were ready for a Sunday treat and left vowing never to go back. A real shame as its a local for us.

I have been there to have a lunch and I also ask for a turkish tea the reason I asked that is I love have tea in that little glass but unfortunately because they notice that I am not Turkish they give me turkish tea in ciaina cup i was very disappointed. Food was good. But didnt like the rasism.

We've found this restaurant with friends after having a drink in the area. It was definitely the best surprise ive ever found in London! French cuisine, original dishes with the finest melt of taste, and adorable staff, everything is fresh, absolutely fine, warm welcome! I'm sure I'll go again, and will recommend it to anyone!

Had a great meal here with family. Really good atmosphere, great waiter and good hot, fresh food. Kids knocked over my wife's wine and it was replaced at no charge with no fuss. One of our best Pizza Express experiences.
Paella burnt, tapas not good.Expensive for disappointing food....Won't come back even if nice place...
We walked in off the street and got a table at 5pm on sunday, very good. The food was very nice, the creme caramel was excellent, a nice meal

First visit to this venue, if you want great service this is the place to go, lots of cask beers and ciders and bar staff who will take the time to help you get the right beer / cider. Everyone coming in has a beer and a Scotch egg or sausage roll !! Really relaxed atmosphere, can imagine there is a great vibe in here when it gets busy - you just get that feeling, looking forward to coming back soon
We enjoy coming here for a dinner. And we have never had any problems. The service is always good and quick and the food is absolutely delicious

We found this place after our usual haunt turned us away for lack of space one weekend. The staff are friendly and approachable and happy to explain the dishes on offer. There is a casual, no pressure ambience to the place, which we prefer, and the freedom to choose as much or as little food as one wants. There is an open grill area where the chef prepares the food to order, so you can see exactly how it's being cooked.If you visit at lunchtime they have a special offer that includes free rice, miso soup and salad with any main dish over a certain price.

A great find and will certainly return.Beautiful setting, good menu choice, arguably above average pricing but definitely worth it, good value for money overall.High quality food, cooked and presented really well. Service was excellent, nice atmosphere, busy but not loud.Great location for West End.No hesitation in recommending it.

I kept coming back for more! Charming & friendly place with great staff. Good breakfast, brunch as you could hope from an Italian in London and tasty small dishes in the evenings. Vast drinks menu and top ambiance music. Look forward to next visit.
The food always marvelous and I love their new salads. Also their fruit salads are good too. ALways very tasty.
Have eaten on this boat several times now - moored on the Embankment. Food and service always good - a definite recommendation for something a bit different.
Popped in for a quick meal before rushing off for a show. Service was quick and polite, food was better than ive had in other F&Be too.
We stumbled upon this pub in search of lunch and cannot praise it enough. Though very small, it was well presented, interesting decor, decent beer on tap and incredible food.

We've visited 'Mondello' a few times over a 3 month period whilst we were in London and can say were satisfied with the food we ordered, some of the meals were a touch too olive oily. The entree's such as the sardines were a stand out as were the scaloppine's, osso bucco, liver and bacon, saltimbocca etc. The wine list was reasonable as were the desserts, especially the peeled orange in a lovely syrup. The service was very friendly and attentive, momma always making a point of greeting each customer on the way in and saying thankyou and good bye on the way out, appreciated. Nothing like old school restaurant manners! The costs? - very reasonable no rip offs here!

Lovely memories here, hanging with friends or choosing a wedding date! Which is what we did last time we were here! Great location, really bright and airy. A tad expensive, but you do get lots of food!

Today me and the family enjoyed an excellent Veggie brunch at Giraffe in Spitalfields. Staff were very welcoming, friendly and attentive. The atmosphere was relaxed and the restaurant was clean and comfortable for the four of us. There is plenty of Vegetarian choices and options and the portions for children are just right.
