Food came quickly and was hot and freshly cooked and the drinks were served straight away. We could relax and take our time with no pressure to pay up and leave. I would give 5 stars but the adult portions could have been a little more generous and yet another restaurant that charges gratuity as standard. But it was just what we needed to round off a busy afternoon at a local museum.

We were walking around Covent Garden when lunch time came by. After looking over two or three restaurants we settled for the Union Jacks, partly enticed by Jaimie Oliver's TV shows. As we had no reservation, we had to wait in line for some time. The tables are all Ïoutdoors, that is to say, in the open Covent Garden place. As the day was cool, IR heaters were aimed at the tables. I had to change my seat with my wife when I felt the heat wave was beginning to fry the back of my head. The seats were also heated and there was even a foot heating device. Quite nice, a bit excessive. Our waitress was a most helpful girl that went to every effort to see that we were comfortable. We first shared some fish fingers and then I had a rib-eye steak and my wife settled for a salad. The fish fingers were amazing: well fried and with a crispy batter, I never believed you could fry some fish and leave something so tasteless. The salad my wife had was OK, with goat's cheese and several greens. But my rib-eye steak was as unremarkable as the fish fingers. The cut was not well done, the steak was stringy and the overall impression was of a mediocre meat, at best. Summarizing, a run-of-the-mill restaurant.

stopped off on the off chance while visiting my daughter, though not a big pizza fan, had the pulled ox tail pizza. (think that's what it was called) with a fresh green bean salad.the base of the pizza was cooked perfectly, plenty of topping and ample for the two of us, the waiter, was very polite, and helpful, I had the pink cola and daughter had a glass of rose and we finished off with oh my goodness, the sublime ice creams

What a wonderful way to treat the wife for her birthday,From the moment we walked in the service we got was superb, my wife was given every help from the waiter with regards to which tea would best suit her, as she can be fussy,The amuse Bouche was a great way to start, followed by the selection of sandwiches, which we were then offered more once the first were finished,The scones came out warm with jam and cream, a little small in size but again was offered more, and taken,Then the pastry selection and which order to eat them in.The pianist then played happy birthday as my wife was presented with a cake n candle(which she didn't know was going to)A totally fantastic dining experience

We visited as guests of a member. This is a priveate club for people in the entertainment industry and the occasional famous face appeared during the evening.It's not quite what I'd expected from a priveate members club but then that is part of its charm. Downstairs it has the feel of a busy pub while upstairs the restaurant is quite informal and friendly. We had the Christmas dinner - and it's never fair to judge on that type of meal. However it was nice and we had a very enjoyable time.

Food is fine, but what shines most is service. I was served by very kind and polite waitress. She was helpfull and active, which made me feel like V.I.P. :) I got impression that staff there really cares about clients. My waitress name was Kate. If u get serviced by her, consider yourself lucky :)

This was my first visit and I'll definitely return. My friend and I ordered burgers which were served with fries and pickle. Some may think a little pricey at £14 and change but very good and beautifully presented. The fries could have been a little hotter but were still edible and because the waiter was so attentive we didn't want to make a fuss. We're already planning our next visit, so no harm done.

Very good selection of juices/cocktails as well as starters and good currys. Well worth a visit to this my local. Whenever I have friends from out of town I take them here. I especially like the spring rolls to start.

My daughter and I returned this mother's day as we had a very good meal there last year. I had steak with Robespierre sauce (balsamic vinegar, pink peppercorns and olive oil, also roasted peppers and potatoes. The steak was absolutely delicious and cooked perfectly, I couldn't even finish it, my daughter had veal in a sauce with mashed potatoes, she was very pleased with it.The owners remembered us from last year and came to chat, which gives a very welcoming feel, our waitstaff were all friendly and helpful. This splendor doesn't come cheaply how ever.

We visited The Ledbury for a special occasion with friends. Having wanted to eat here for a number of years, I can say with confidence that it delivered on every level. Excellent food, wine, service and atmosphere. We had the full 8 course tasting menu with paired drinks and were blown away by the creativeity and elegance of the food and stunning matching of wines from around the world. Would love to go again.

We were taken here by our relative who lives locally. We dined early in the evening as we were trying to beat jet lag having Arrived early that day after a flight from Australia. Very tasty Moroccan flavours and large servings. Reasonable prices. Ambience is a little loud and the tables are a little difficult to get in and out of but overall a lovely meal.
Good place in John Lewis store. Nice decor and good service. Food was also good. Nice place to drop in to have a short break from shopping and eat something nice.

Stayed at it's hotel (Rydges) overnight and thought we'd prepaid for a full English buffet (FEB) but discovered it was only Continental and FEB was £5 extra. Sadly, after eating our cereals and toast when our waiter came to take our order for this he advised us that we could only have omelettes or other egg dishes because there was a problem with the oven. Once we'd ordered two eggs benedict and a ham & egg omelette we were told that they couldn't make an omelette either but would we prefer a complimentary coffee! For me that's like offering a vegetarian a sausage - thanks but no! Anyhoo when the eggs benedict finally Arrived after an age..they were 2 eggs and muffins per person but sadly one set were cold and the muffins weren't cooked but warmed by the egg topping. We ate what we could out of hunger. To add insult to injury we were still asked for the £10 surcharge for a FEB they couldn't provide. If the waiter had said they could only provide Continental breakfast that morning, as he escorted us to our table we would have left and breakfasted elsewhere. Needless to say 2/3 of us will definitely not be returning but I could be swayed if only because of the service the night before, hence the ratings.

Restaurant was very busy Sunday lunch but the waiter found the 4 of us a spot at the high table. The menu is very simple making service quick although it did look a little chaotic at the service area. 2 pizzas , fish and chips and a burger with soft drinks coffees afterward for 22 pounds a head including the tip. Expensive but comparable to other restaurants in Covent Garden.

Used this for a meal before a matinee, we had allowed 1 1/2 hours before the show, but we started to check our watches, as following the main course which Arrived promptly, the kids ice cream took a good 20 mins to arrive and then the bill was an extra 15mins as there was a problem with the till. The waiter was not attentive following the arriveal of our main meal and it was difficult to find someone willing to help. There was a large queue of people waiting for a table, some of which left the queue, so we were surprised they didn't help get us out quicker.

Throw away your watch, your wallet and your doctor's advice on cholesterol. Just give in!Came here and pre-ordered the famed duck. It's a ritual. From being shown the dead bird on a plate to the last morsel of crackling. They take you through every step and show you the amount of sherry, wine and Cointreau they use. They show you there flaming pans. They let you turn the press to watch the juices flow. I think it was seven courses of rich and decadent duck, my favourite being the breast with an exceptional jus/gravy and the crackling and bacon. We got bits of jamon and tuna tartare whilst we waited, and Otto recommended two excellent bottles of Burgundy. It is not a meal you can have often, but certainly one of my most memorable lunches in London. Bravo Otto!! And thank you.

This place we found via the michelin BIB list ...and what a find !!! its urban, cool ,reasonable and serves really good food !!!!We booked for early sat night, the food is locally sourced and cooked simply to make the most of its quality .! The staff were friendly and attentive without being fussy ! ..simply loved it !

My first visit at Green Pea was unforgettable, I was greeted by friendly members of staff who served luscious food which was brilliant value. i would highly recommend this simply exceptional restaurant.

I totally loved this place. We ate there last night and everything was perfect. Well, the air-con had broken but that wasn't there fault. The staff were professional and welcoming (a rare combination).The food was perfect. Not just good or great but perfect.The wine list was also ideal. Let's face it, you're never going to go wrong with a restaurant that has a Solaia 2002 paired with lamb, are you?Modern, comfortable and sleek.Well worth the time.
Great service and delicious food served in a venue with an excellent view of the river. It may not seem like there is Much food on the plate but it is all very filling and very tasty!

I actually came across this place in the morning making my way to a new job in white city,purely by the wonderful presentation in the window , time being about 10.00am,poked my nose thru the door for a closer look,and pleasantly inhaled the aromas coming from the freshly cooked food on display,made a mental note to try it on the way back that evening from work.Finished work and made my way to the Capital Turkish Restaurant,just opposite Hammersmith's Piccadilly and district line underground station.As I entered I was warmly greeted,and ask where I would like to sit ,perfect so far,i sat down and ordered the chicken stew ,which I had seen earlier in the morning ,beautiful chunks of potatoes with mouthwatering pieces of chicken and vegetables swimming in a golden stew.while I was waiting for this I was presented with a refreshing salad ,which is standard here ,my meal Arrived on a huge plate ,followed by a plate of rice with pine nuts and Turkish bread (which stayed warm and moist thru-out my meal excellent)my waiter can cagan (can pronounced John) was brill at all times bringing me chilly peppers and helpful all the time.The manager Hassan is running a superb eating house here .but wait all of that came to the grand sum of£8.00Wow !!!!! Value for money , excellent food,great service ,and I did not finish it all , I did try for £8.00 great . I highly recommend the capital restaurant ,be you a tourist or resident 10 out of 10.
Went in here on a Thursday night after our Christmas lunch. Light and modern. It became very busy so popular but was noisy. Pleasant enough

From the minute you walk through the front door into the sumptuous interior with immaculately turned out friendly staff you get the feeling your going to have a good night. A glass of Champagne at the bar a perfect way to start the evening. Ok where to start with the food it is all so delicious. Stand out must haves are the sea bream cooked to perfection the scallops, soft shell crab, beef skewer even the salad and vegetables were gorgeous BUT the best was yet to come quite possibly the best dessert I have ever tasted was the platter three hot puddings, ice cream, sorbet and fresh fruit some of which I had never even eaten before just WOW. Thank you Cristian Roka's amazing chef for an unforgettable evening. I can't wait to come back. Take my advice book your table now!!

Have been here a few times now and always enjoyed my visit.They have a great selection of craft beers and the pizzas are great.Beer prices are also a bit better than other purveyors of craft ale that might be nearby ;-)This place is a great alternative to fighting for space on upper street

Came late afternoon (3pm) for a large lunch to set me up for the rest of the day. I ordered the pizza venerdi and wasn't disappointed. Lots of Parmasan and parma ham (no scrimping on toppings), base nice and thin, not undercooked or overcooked. Ok house white wine and did the job - no tea needed. Would return and recommend.

every Sunday I passed this pub to go to sainsburys. it's always full of people. I decided I really should give it a try.well, I couldn't have a beer or wine but food was really good!! first visit we had fish &chips and mussel, second visit, had a Sunday roast!! looked amazing and quality... I couldn't fault. if you are whitechapel local, you must know how difficult to find this kind of decent food. I'm glad I found this place!!

Food is lovely and lots of it. Try to go one lunchtime and have the fixed menu - two courses and a glass of house wine for less than £13 and the portions are large....seriously. Very relaxed atmosphere and their house wine is very tasty and very well priced for the area. Took some friends there one evening quite recently, including two children under 11 and they absolutely loved, yes loved the pizzas. In fact the little boy said it was the best pizza he had ever had and had too tell the chef so! Their pizzas are good and such a variety of toppings. I have tried several meals and I had the chicken Vulcano which was an escalope with lemon and garlic.....gorgeous. The staff are very friendly but not in your face and nothing is too much trouble. Do take the time to visit this gem!!

I don't like writing poor reviews when staff have tried hard and our waitress at Zizzi's was friendly and helpful. Disappointingly the food was woeful. We were out as a family group of eight adults for an early dinner on a Sunday evening and while I'm realistic that chain restaurants are not usually the place to go if you want an unusual or exotic menu, I had at least hoped for simple, good quality food. We went straight into main courses and I opted for the porcine tortelloni which was a tiny portion served in a big bowl. Sadly it was tepid, mushy and tasteless and the garlic bread we selected as an accompaniment was dry and hard. For dessert I ordered the lemon meringue sundae which sounded impressive but in fact was also small and uninspiring: it was basically just ice cream with some lemon curd and a few bits of meringue. The whipped mascarpone cream was in frozen lumps in the middle and although I looked all over I couldn't see any trace of a 'pink raspberry snap' that was supposed to come with it. All in all a let-down of a meal: I'd like to think that perhaps it was just a one -off bad day.

Sometimes only a cup of tea and some beige carbohydrate will fit the bill!The newly-opened Aylmer Pantry, in a largely residential part of Highgate that's almost East Finchley, has a comfortable, shabby-chic vibe (the owner also runs the Vintage Garden shop next door)and some superior bread and cakes .Tea is served on classy bone china, as was a roast beef sandwich which was fresh, zingy and very well put together with caramelised onion,salad leaves and mayonnaise.New on the block but could go far!
Went on a busy Saturday. Lovely fresh meal anazing value for money. Would go there again. Drinks really good value.

ive been to Pret a Manger twice when I was in London last week, and I loved it, I'm sure I'll return there !I'm an iced-latte lover, and the one I took there was the best ! Anyway, I thought it would be as good as a Starbucks, because I was told they sold the most amazing latte but no: it was even better ! Moreover, I also took a veggie wrap with kale, red pepper and mango and it was amazing !The waiters were really nice and I didn't wait at all.Furthermore, I went to 2 different Pret a manger, one in Camden and the other one in Oxford street and they were both super clean.To conclude, you definitely should go there if you have the chance !! Visiting Pret a Manger is a must-do in London !

came here to feed my two children along with my friend and her two kids as it is local. First when we was waiting by the bar my friend rested her baby on the bar, a woman from behind the bar came waving her hands saying '' off! off! no resting kids on the bar!''. We thought her approach was rude and insensitive, but we did not say anything and just done as she '' shouted''. She eventually came to take our order after serving some customers which came after us but again we did not bother to say anything and just waited patiently. When she started to take my order, I asked for a kids meal, in which I asked for cheesy pasta with an apple juice and a brownie, when prompted with the price she told me £5.94, I asked why this was the price when on the menu it states £4.25. She could not tell me why this was and seemed to be getting quite frustrated when I asked what this set price entails of. At this point her customer service was extremely poor as she was getting agitated because she could not tell me what she should know as a worker! She eventually managed to figure it out and explained the brownie was extra, in which I thought ok and said to take the brownie off. She then asked me what else I wanted, when I started to give the order for my younger child she was looking away and paying attention to the customers next to us, therefore did not hear what I said, so asked me again, at this point I repeated myself to which she responded out of the blue, '' your giveing me attitude I'm not serving you!'' Her reaction was so uncalled for that I wondered if she has some sort of split personality disorder! I have never been served by such terrible bar/ waiting staff! I asked to speak with the manager and she started shouting, '' I am the manager!''. I asked her what her name was and what the complaints procedure was to which she responded. '' I'm not telling you!''.She started waving at me saying ' Bye'. Either this woman has some underlining issues or she should just not be working in a customer service related environment. I felt discriminated, humiliated and spoken down to! She was rude, undermining, hysterical, childish and extremely unprofessional! I was there to feed my children and she REFUSED to serve them. As a regular customer I am appalled at her behaviour especially being the deputy manager! My 8 year old son has more manners and people skills than this woman! I will NOT be returning here nor will many mums I know that regularly come here. Wetherspoons should be ashamed at employing someone with her level of customer service and non existent people skills. I will be making a formal complaint against this woman as she clearly needs to be trained at doing her job.

I booked this restaurant for my birthday about four to five weeks in advance for a Saturday evening. As I didn't hear from the restaurant after the initial phone conversation to confirm the booking I rang them at around 6.00 pm on the day for confirmation. I spoke to a rude person who claimed to be the Manager who said he didn't have a record of the booking and the best he could do was offer me a 10.15 pm time for dinner! He wasn't apologetic in the slightest. You are not able to book by email but to book by telephone is no good either as the recipient proved to be totally incompetent!

I took two friends to tea here recently. The booking tool on the cafe's website was not working, so I phoned my reservation. When I Arrived, my reservation had not been recorded. The atmosphere in the cafe was quite pleasant, though the surrounding area of the gallery can get hectic at times. The food and beverages at teatime were adequate though not outstanding. Service was uneven: we were served by one charming waitress, and one waiter who was offhand. A typically mediocre London venue, in other words.

after several recommendations from friends we went to Rules this weekend with some friends. So glad we did, fantastic atmosphere, attentive service and amazing food. Recommend the beef fillet which was stunning, melt in the mouth perfection. Book early!!!!!
A nice little pub that you could esily walk past as the entrance is just off the main road. Friendly staff , decent prices for drinks in London

We booked this "special" restaurant to celebrate my son's birthday. Yes, the room is comfortable, the tables are well spread out, and you can carry on a conversation with your fellow diners. We have never seen so many staff hovering in one room. Unfortunately, nearly an hour elapsed before our order was taken. We even had to ask for some bread. That took even longer. I personally was disappointed with my food. The veal sweetbread was rather dry. My fillet of beef wasn't succulent, nor did it have the flavour good quality beef should have. It was lukewarm having waited for at least 5 minutes for the waiters to realise it had emerged from the kitchen. Indeed, my husband sent his cold dish back to the kitchen. I must say that other members of our party were happy with their choice. The desserts were outstanding and Chris dealt very tactfully and skilfully with our complaint. We did not have coffee, feeling exhausted as it had taken nearly 3 hours to have a 3 course meal.

This was a specially lovely day for my husband & I as we were celebrating our anniversary and on top of that, my husband managed to get a 50% discount on our meal/experience which made it more amazing. It would normally cost around £100 for a meal, drink each and a boat tour, we got it for half price :) The meal was lovely and as we don't drink, we got 2 soft drinks each instead of just 1 alcoholic drink each. We both opted for the trout meal which was tasty and satisfying too. A lovely way to just spend some quality time with your loved ones & friends :) The only thing I'd say is it can get a bit stuffy 'inside' the boat so, I meant to sit near the air conditioning in the the boat.

ive been to Polpo a couple of times and it never disappoints. Delicious food served tapas style, great for sharing with friends. I visited on a Friday night when the atmosphere was bustling but the food and drink orders still came swiftly and the staff were very pleasant. Not cheap but the food is good quality and very tasty!

I visited this restaurant with three business associates. The location was excellent and the service could not be faulted - polite, attentive and helpful. The food however left much to be desired. I had cod that was watery and had no taste whatsoever. My colleagues mage the same comments with their fish. Very disappointing.

kids friendly place as they offer high chairs and pencils to draw. We were sitted to the basement and it was really noisy. The service and the food was just ok. Nothing special to remember or recommend.

We were a table of 4 in the restaurant with only 2 other occupied tables. We were greeted with a long list of things that were unavailable on the menu (due to an issue with a delivery the day before). 3 of us decided to have the Yorkshire puddings and one had the warm garden salad. She was presented with perhaps 10 lettuce leaves on a plate with a couple of stems of asparagus. Clearly the wrong salad, we ask for the correct salad to be brought out. About 15 minutes later the same salad was brought out with some croutons and radishes added. She didn't want to eat and pay for this poor excuse for a salad, therefore asked for it to be taken back to the kitchen.The Yorkshires were nothing special. Dry with minimal filling.Then to the desserts! 2 decided on the sweet yorkshires, and one of us had the double chocolate sponge. She was given a dessert that looked suspiciously like the treacle pudding that was on the menu. When we mentioned this to the waitress, she said that it was a white chocolate sponge pudding with white chocolate sauce. After tasting the pudding it was obvious it was treacle pudding and we have no idea what possessed the waitress to make up this bizarre excuse?! Anyway we exchanged this for the correct dessert.I understand when things go wrong, but this ridiculous catalogue of errors was just too much. We were offered a discount off the bill which was the least they could do. Yet we also found that a 12.5% service charge had been added to the bill!

Eight of us had the very great pleasure of eating here on a Saturday afternoon. We came upon the place by accident and were made to feel very welcome by the owners and the waiter. The food was very good, tasty Italian fare without being "too fancy" and I thought it was incredible value for central London. We all enjoyed the friendly atmosphere and the sight of the elderly owner dancing and shaking his tamborine whilst celebrating the birthday of another diner was extremely entertaining! The owners seemed to take a great pride in their restaurant and a great interest in their customers, shaking all our hands as we left. I shall definitely return.

Really enjoyed our meal here - suits young and older alike without being too expensive. We had a great table in a quiet corner, the food was good and service was excellent. Asked the waiter to take the 12% service charge off the bill because the waiting staff probably wouldn't see any of it, and tipped the waiter directly for great service.We would visit again.

Uli is by now a Notting Hill institution. Consistently fantastic food and good service is something that we should all expect from restaurant's these days. However Michael and his team add just that something something extra - a truly personal service that comes with charm, elegance and a great knowledge of the food that they are serving. During the Summer the garden is enclosed with an awning and is a real haven in the middle of London. We have been coming to Uli for years and will do for many years to come I should think.

Went here after watching the fireworks display at Ally Pally. Did not disappoint. Service was very friendly and helped us choose our food. Food Arrived promptly and was delicious! Tried saki in here for the first time and I like it! Total bill was decent too!!!
One of the best restaurants' I have been to for indo Chinese cuisine. amazingly tasty and highly recommended!

Throughly enjoyed a recent outing to Tootoomoo while visiting friends in Crouch End. I would definitely say it was the most fun and yummy dining experience I have had in a long time! The restaurant itself is well laid out, decor is bright and colourful, I would say trendy, yet casual and fun! As the menu was so good, we couldn't decide what to get so ordered a selection of fish, meat and sushi and just shared it between the three of us. It was all diveine! There's a great selection of cocktails on the menu, I particularly enjoyed the watermelon and mint martini! For desert I had the dark chocolate and cookies frozen yogurt, which was refreshing and delicious. The service was very friendly and efficient. Thank you Tootoomoo for a great evening! I will be back!
Very welcoming, service is brilliant. Desserts are great, My compliments for such a busy place. Will come back
Nice pub, good food, good atmosfere every weekend. I love this place especially on Thursday and friday ( afterwork )

We went on a Friday evening just after 18.00 - quite empty but soon got busy and there was a really good atmosphere. Welcomed warmly and menu carefully explained after sensitively establishing whether this was our first visit! Interesting and enticing choice of food, which delivered on taste and quality, with the meatballs, both spicy pork and exceptional. Service unobtrusive throughout and clearly Polpo is striveing to keep its customers in an area where you are spoiled for choice for quality places to eat. We would certainly go back!

Went to dinner with friends, great atmosphere & service. Food Arrived really quickly and was tasty although the menu isn't as extensive as other places and no modifications could be made from the menu. All in all a good experience if you like Thai it's worth a visit!

My sister and kids were staying with us (in London) from the USA and wanted English fish and chips. I did not think we could get decent FnC in London but found Baileys on line. We ordered a large amount for the whole family and went with my sister to collect. The staff were brilliant. Good humoured and helpful. The food was delicious, fresh and really well cooked - reminding us all of seaside moments and everyone was happy! My sister and kids were delighted! To think such a gem was round the corner and I didn't know! Must go now to place another order......

We ordered a takeaway rather expensive the never put the curry sauce in for my biryani when we called they asked us did we need it. Said would deliver it 20 mins later still not Arrived. Will not order again

Have visited twice now. Initially for brunch, I ordered the blueberry pancakes which were lovely. I haven't ordered a coffee or smoothie as I think they are very expensive.MIL had the tomato soup, which came with a chickpea side. She loved her soup and when we returned recently I had hoped to try for myself. Unfortunately, the menu had changed and now cauliflower and truffle oil was on offer. I smelt it as soon and I entered and was so tempted but the lady next to me advised not the bother as hers was horrible! (The seating is so cosy you are practically on each others lap so would can't help but hear each other's conversations). I took her advise and ordered the beetroot salad, which was super fresh and light. Really yummy.ive given three stars because I have enjoyed my food but I find it very expensive , especially drinks. Wouldn't wait for a table as there is such a variety in Clapham Junction!
We went there with a group of students, excellent service, free pizza bread with dip even, lovely food, thank you!

My friends and I took advantage of an offer for afternoon tea with choice of unlimited Champagne or Prosecco and a cocktail. When we Arrived we could choose from two different food menus.The service was really good and the food was plentiful - savouries included sausage rolls, fish with mushy peas, steak and snail sandwiches, there were also a selection of cakes and scones with clotted cream and jam and a choice of tea from an extensive list.It is a little out of the way for me to go to regularly, but I'd highly recommend it. It would be a really good choice for hen parties as well given you really do get value for money on the alcohol front and enough food to fill you up!
We have been to this restaurat many,many times and are never, never disappointed. superb food and friendly staff.
I went there with friends. the menu is not great for vegetarians. the portions are big and the staff very friendly. lovely atmosphere!

Garfunkel's is one of my favourite in London this chain is very quick and easy food. There is something on the menu for everyone. I ate here on my own as I was away for business and it was quick service and good food.

had lunch here with my daughter this week. We waited an hour for our food, when it came it was ok, not very warm. If I had been on my own I would have walked out. They did give us a discount but half of what we had to pay would have been far too much.

We had a takeaway last Friday. Having eaten here before I went for the fishcakes, as last time I had them they were excellent and we also ordered cod and haddock. With hindsight I should have plumped for the fish, which came in light, well cooked batter and was utterly delicious. My fishcakes (two of and excellent value at £3.20) unfortunately weren't their best effort. There were quite a few bones and the batter was soggy. I am sure this was just a blip, as when I have had them previously they were excellent. We will return, but I will probab
Freshly cooked food - spicy and tasty. I had lamb and Wife had chicken. Very nice food and worthy of a good review. Ambience was great to.

Lovely location. We were able to book a table online for our party of nine in advance. The table was ready and waiting for us on arriveal. The staff were all friendly and very cheerful and helpful. We had a discount voucher and they accepted this with no quibbles. The food was good quality, tasty and Arrived quite quickly. Though they tried to charge us £9.99 for pasta and butter for one of the children which is obviously extortionate! All in all a good experience which suited our needs.

Booked a table near the bar for Friday after work, place is packed as usual, can't fault the atmosphere and was with a large group of friends. Unfortunately a few of us found that the bar staff were very selective about who they wanted to serve. It's a busy place so can't expect them to always remember who's first but it gets pretty obvious they are ignoring you and serving more familiar regular faces. Especially when some chap appears from nowhere at the side of the bar, shouts a long drinks order without queing and everyone focus on preparing drinks for him. Good for this chap but the 40 or 50 other people at the bar waiting don't deserve to be treated like this whether they realised or not. I certainly told the person who eventually bothered to serve me that I didn't care much for their apology. Waiting 25 mins for a round of drinks is not on.

I really got surprised while in covent garden walked in the apple market and found it! A jamie oliver's restaurant!!! Always been a huge fan of him and his struggle for redefine the fast food and teach us doesn't mean to be crap food!!!Simply delicious! Really better that i would ever imagine! To start a tomato a soup, and fish a chips! The best ever! For the chili lover, the chili freak pizza ummmm really awsome! And for dessert, chocolate lovers you should try the sticky toffee pudding!!! ‰_•ü‰_•ü‰_•ü‰_•üReally a dream come true! Standing ovation for you Jamie!!! I will come back! Thanks!!! It eas really a pleasure!!!!

By far one of the Persian restaurants I have been outside of Iran , modern and authentic at the same time ,as an Iranian I would personally remove Hummus from menu and add up to the quantity of the shirazi Salad ,,, I would definitely go back and I have recommend it to all people we spoke about Persian restaurants in London.Well done Hana team
Great atmosphere, food was good, limited menu (but that's what it's all about and I didn't do my research.) seem to suit tourist but overall worth the night out.
Good food and not expensive for london. The staff was very Friendly. The restaurant is suitable for children.

Went for dinner last week and really enjoyed it - excellent service by really nice staff. Menu was interesting making it hard to choose as everything sounded so good. Unfortunately my starter and main were both covered in breadcrumbs which wasn't mentioned on the menu and the descriptor didn't imply that that would be the case (I don't eat wheat). Didn't complain as was having too good a time. Would definitely recommend and return.
Delicious food, stunning place. Proper service. Really recommend and must try.What more can I say?!
Very nice French bistro - nonetheless one cannot escape the fact that it is one of a chain.

Pret is PrÌ»t. Ok quality food. A little selection of Gluten free bits and service is always very good and fast. Would be good if they had a gluten free bread option though as the choice of one soup isn't always that exciting

Visited with a couples of friends at the end of May for dinner and cocktails. Obviously, being young females into makeup, we loved that it had been taken over my Benefit cosmetics and the overall appearance was amazing. Each room was so different you forget you're on a boat. We all had the 3 course meal with a glass of Prosecco. The food was delicious and presentation was lovely. The staff were so nice and helpful. Being from a small village in the south west - it was on the pricey side (for us anyway) but you have to remember you are in London...opposite the London Eye, so you can't complain really. Overall had a lovely evening!

I stopped here for a pint after walking along the Thames on a lovely sunny afternoon. It does not have much of a river view compared to pubs further along the river but as a fan of William Hogarth I chose this establishment, as it features in one of his artworks. Needing to use the facilities I asked for the toilet. I was directed but with the 'toilets are for customers only' attitude. It was of course my intention to buy a pint following that pit stop. My £5.20 second choice pint was ruined by an argumentative exchange by a bar person, over my perceived lack of quality on my first choice. A previous bar person had informed me that the barrel was in need of change. The second then waded in with its 'just been changed' and then 'I changed it this morning'. I was then given the 'drink your beer and be off with you' type shunning by both persons, suddenly standing together in abrasive unison. Oh well, I just have to travel to the next pub, next time. Awful.

Wright Brothers, Borough Market is always good to visit. It is busy and buzzing. It is reassuringly located within Borough Food Market. Sitting outside, even during winter, is a good opportunity for people-watching.The menus change regularly, However, long-time favourites are always available. This place is first and foremost a fish restaurant, so do not come looking for steaks. Fish is fresh and expertly prepared and cooked. Oysters in particular are extremely good.The interior is small and hence tables are close together. That can be a problem in some restaurants, but this restaurant exudes a relaxed and spontaneous atmosphere so it seems entirely appropriate. We prefer to sit at the counter where we can watch the specialists at work.The wine list is good and affords a wide range of wines from different countries and regions. Service is efficient, friendly and unfussy. An excellent place for old and new friends to meet for a relaxed lunch or dinner.

Ate here with 3 colleagues on the evening before a trade show we were attending at the Park Plaza Victoria.All of us had whole lobster with fries and sides which was fabulous and very tasty.Can't fault it, with the exception of the service charge. I'd rather add a discretionary gratuity than be strong armed into leaving a 12.5% mandatory tip. For that reason it loses two stars. Shame.
Food was great, but the service is not as pleasant as it should be. I recon that it must be because of lack of staff.

Overall, i was disgusted at the experience that i had when me and my partner visited this restaurant for our anniversary dinner. After booking online and making a reservation for two, we Arrived on the night just before our booking time of 9 o'clock. upon arriveal we spoke to a waitress who acknowledged that we were early and kindly asked us to wait in the lobby area which was no problem. Come 9, we went up to the arriveal desk and said that we had a reservation from 9, only to be told that there was no table ready at the moment, and we were asked to wait 10-15 minutes while the member of staff went to ask a manager to "see if they can sort us something out", although we could clearly see that there were plenty of empty tables around, already set out. After accepting this fact we decided to get a drink while we waited to be seated. Once we had eventually been shown to a table, (which was poorly placed in the restaurant, right next to the cutlery draws which meant staff were constantly leaning over to get things out). We noticed that there was another table behind us of 8 people that had been clearly squashed on to a table only big enough for 6. As we sat waiting for our order to be taken, we could not help but notice a drunken, overly loud table of 10 in the middle of the restaurant who continually shouted and swore out loud gaining disgusted glares from all directions including our table, making for an uncomfortable time to start with. once our order had been taken, we waited for our food, and during this time, the table had become so loud that the waitress asked them to keep the noise down, to which one of the table members replied, "we spend a lot of money in here love". her request made no difference as they clearly became louder and nothing else was done to make the environment any more pleasant. After about 35 minutes the waiter returned to our table and asked us to give our order again as it had been missed, by this point, we had become so uncomfortable with the appalling behavior of the table of 10, that we could not enjoy the atmosphere for our special occasion dinner. The fact that our meal had been missed added to the disappointment as we were really looking forward to our surf and turf and we were both now starving. Seeing that nothing was clearly going to be done about the loud, disruptive table and the fact we now had to wait even longer for our food, we made the decision to leave and try to find somewhere else to eat, now an hour after our original booking time, all we were offered was the one drink we did have for free. I feel very disappointed with the service received and the quality was definitely not worth the price-tag. overall it felt as though the restaurant had been made out to be something it was not and was poorly managed. Clearly 'spending a lot of money' overrules a good customer experience. We Would not recommend this restaurant to anyone as we had a very poor and disappointing experience. We then had a much more pleasant experience when we found a place to eat in Angus steakhouse 10 minutes down the road, where they even gave us a drink for free on our special occasion.

The restaurant was close to the theater and the menu looked good so we thought we'd give it a try. Turned out to be fantastic!Everything sampled was excellent: the half chicken with frites; haddock; steak frites; veal scallop; asparagus risotto; onion soup. The bread, which we weren't going to order because they charged for it, turned out to be diveine and we had to try to stop eating it so as not to ruin our appetites. Despite the fact that the place was mobbed, the service was excellent and we had no trouble getting out in time for our curtain. The waiter was wonderful and kept everyone happy. We shall definitely return even when we don't have theater tickets!

Food (2 orders of fish and chips and a burger were in our order) was decent enough, although staff definitely ruined the experience--slow ad not very friendly at all. Best part was the AMAZING desert. All in all, we were expecting so much more. Left with the feeling that you were simply paying for the name and location.

After a busy weekend cooking (see the l'atelier des chefs review!) and Museuming and Kensington Palacing we were looking for somewhere to eat before going back to the provinces... so we had a look on the Gourmet Cards website and found this place not too far from where we were standing in Oxford St and gave them a call - and 15 minutes and a convoluted walk (more Cortina than Cortana)... we were there - here - at the Social and walking through the attractive bars and lounges we ended up in a VERY lively restaurant for a Saturday at 18:00! Bemused we sat and perused the menus and were told about the steak specials and talked through the tasting menu by our very personable and charming waiter! Difficult decisions that eventually resulted in us both going for the steak meal (which included half a bottle of wine - incredibly good value!) and asked if it was possible to mix and match off the taster menu which our waiter arranged for us - difficult customers that we are he sorted us out perfectly! We also noticed that the lively chaps and chapesses had suddenly disappeared and the a calm tranquillity suddenly appear across the restaurant.. it was like we had gone deaf all of a sudden! Was it something we had said? On asking the waiter he explained the free-flow champagne afternoon tea which had just finished its last sitting - suddenly all made sense (and a note in the diary to return for that one - just to test it out for research purposes!).. anyway the food and wine came and the starter of smoked tomato and duck egg (extracted off the taster menu for us special chaps!) was good but the steak deal superb (and the chips superber!) and this followed by a good upside down cake (with diveine coconut ice cream) and an excellent (possibly the best I have tasted) melting chocolate fondant!! All washed down with a great red (or 2!) and with perfect service from a very friendly and accommodating team! We will be back and next time may just be one of the lively chaps and chapesses on the other tables - we will return but we may not reform!!

This was our third visit. The first important thing to say is that the food is still great and great value for money. The kitchen team are still doing a great job.Front of house is a complete disaster:-¢ We weren't asked for drinks orders when we were given menus¢ Our starters didn't come.¢ Shellfish crackers and forks weren't put on the table¢ One main course was served. We asked about the starters.¢ Five minutes later three more main courses were served Ò still no starters¢ Ten minutes after that the last main course was served¢ A bit later shellfish crackers and forks appeared¢ Then the starters appeared¢ An air-conditioning unit was dripping on to the head of one of our party throughout.We will not return to or recommend this restaurant until we have seen several first-hand accounts of good experiences.
This restaurant is an amazing location, the steak is great quality and excellent service, highly recommended.
Great sandwiches, very tasty and the service was great too.

Popped into The Truscott Arms on Sunday evening ,good atmosphere and good table ( that bit is always important)Had the burger and found it perfectly acceptable.Good beer and wine selection. Good way to spend a couple of hours

We Arrived early on a beautiful sunny hot day. We walked from Charing Cross station through the bustling throng of tourists and business people and walked onto the boat via a gang way. Once on board the we were greeted with tranquility. I could not believe I was in the centre of London. We sat outside in the sun with a glass of bubbles and a pint of beer under the shadow of the London eye and Charing Cross railway bridge. At 1.30pm we sat at our table by the open doors. Two very attentive waiters looked after us. The food was excellent. We opted for the £27 fixed meal with a glass of bubbles. The standard was excellent...battered cod and belly pork. In all a great afternoon...only spoilt slightly by the swell of the Thames causing my wife to feel queasy.A superb venue for an excellent meal providing you have sea legs.

After a crazy shopping trip in Oxford street we found ourselves to be very hungry.so we visited the Angus steakhouse after a recommendation from family.so we went in with high hopes and I'm pleased to say this steakhouse didn't disappoint.everything from the starters,mains,deserts and service was excellent.we had a cheese garlic bread to start with bacon bacon potato skins which were both delicious.then for main we both had the 12 oz ribeye steaks medium to well.theses steaks were full of flavour tasty and cooked to perfection.then for dessert we opted for the strawberry and malteasers cheesecakes theses were both to die for.this was all washed down by two lovely ice cold pints of Stella.would highly recommend this Angus steakhouse 10 out of 10.if I'm back in oxford street we will most definitely be returning.

We went along last night,we choose from the a la carte menu,to be told sorry no rib eye only to be served tough thin sirloin,then for dessert I asked for orange souffle,what came out was a frozen chocolate she'll with runny cream in it and about half a cm of mousse,I don't think a chef had even been near it,it was something like you'd probably find in the chiller at Iceland,my partners crumble was ok,one waitress was really attentive the rest were arguing at the bar to which we were sat by,the view was stunning but marred by the meal sorry
A lovely warm welcome and easy going charm made this night out with friends extra special. The chicken was amazing and the salads and the aubergine.

We love this place. It has the best food. The squid in ginger and peppercorns is the best I have ever had. I try something different every time I go because I know I will enjoy it. The flavours are perfect not one overpowering the rest, they mingle nicely. And all this whilst sat on wooden benches! (I hardly notice). The restaurant has a really nice vibe about it.

Visited on Saturday 17th January, location is great, as close to the theatre, and we chose to come here before the 19:30 showing of Wicked.The decor was gorgeous.We ordered our drinks and prawn crackers for starters. Our drinks came within a reasonable time frame, however, our prawn crackers never came. My partner had to go up to the bar and request these, they were given to him to bring back to the table himself!Somebody then proceeded to take our order, and we waited around 20 mins for the food.The food came and did not look appetizing what so ever. The noodles we ordered were grey looking, and the sauces watery. I took one bite of the noodles. Stone cold. As were the other dishes we ordered.We mentioned this matter to the waitress who was extremely apologetic and took our food away and advised she would get this sorted for us straight away.Within 5 minutes the food appeared on our table again, hot this time, but had obviously been heated in the microwave and re-plated. We had sweet and sour chicken on which the batter had gone soggy from the microwave.We again mentioned to the waitress that the food wasn't up to scratch and that we wouldn't eat or pay for it. Again she was lovely and very apologetic.Safe to say we didn't have the greatest of experiences here, luckily we left enough time to grab a quick something else to eat before the show.

My partner & I had a great experience of eating here today - fab location right in the heart of things in Covent Garden with a great atmosphere, but still sheltered from the throng of shoppers and hectic goings-on. We were disappointed by the menu & food quality of a couple of nearby pubs and ended up here - we were looking for something fresh & tasty in a comfortable environment and this ticked all the boxes. Staff were very friendly & efficient, the food ('Margaret' pizza and fish & chips) very well cooked despite the onbiously very high footfall & customer numbers. Only constructive criticism was that the fish & chips was quite salty.

This place is a bit out of the way for Forest Hill being along the south circular from the station towards Honor Oak but is definitely pulling in the folks and it's a nice place to hang out for an hour or two. The building is lovely and the team are super friendly but they need to up their game a bit - blown light bulbs in the loo and half the lights in the pub not switched on and a projector screen rolled down with nothing on all make the place look like it hadn't quite been opened yet. The beer is good but the back bar is a bit sketchy and a premium spirit and mix served without a garnish is a miss for me. Don't get me wrong, it's a decent pub with a lovely garden and friendly faces behind the bar. Of course I'll come again.

Booked Awesome Thai for my partner's birthday. We've been here a few times and really enjoyed ourselves. We received a warm welcome upon arriveal and complementary sesame toast. The food and attentive service was great, as usual. When I made the reservation I mentioned it was for my partner's birthday. Tony ensured he had the correct spelling of her name and we were treated to a complementary tiramisu with her name on the plate. Everyone in the restaurant sang her happy birthday! I would definitely recommend this restaurant and will return.

It was our first visit to this local restaurant - the choice and quality of food was superb. The service could not have been better and the staff were always available but not overpowering like other places. The prawns to start were particularly good !!! As was the crab for main. We would recommend!!!

The New Moon Pub is a short walk from Monument Station. Attended for a priveate function in the basement. Very cozy relaxing Pub. The toilets were a let down and needed monitoring and attention as well as ventilation. A pint is over the £5 mark and they have a typical pub menu.
Our favourite Thai restaurant in London! Great customer service and lovely food. Specially the Pad Kwetio and the green curry, can't miss it!

This is the place to go for authentic Malaysian food! It's family owned by the nicest people, they always make the freshest meals and it's all halal which is great. Lots of locals eat here, we go regularly. The portions are big, but they have takeaway boxes if you can't finish. Would definitely recommend!

Visited here for a pre-theatre dinner the other night prior to a performance of Wicked at the Victoria Apollo. The restaurant is ideally situated for this theatre and offers a set pre-theatre dinner of 2 courses for £13.50 or 3 courses for £16.50. The restaurant itself is well laid out, bright, clean and welcoming and the service polite and fairly attentive. The choice on the set menu is fairly basic - it offers four starters then mains of four pasta dishes or a pizza or roast chicken breast or fish, with a choice of three deserts. I had a cocktail to start, which was really tasty, whilst my partner had a beer, both of which Arrived reasonably quickly. For our meal my partner had the meatballs starter, which was reasonably tasty and I had the calamari, which was OK but quite salty and very heavy on the chillis. For our mains we both had the roast chicken breast. The chicken itself was tender and moist, the potatoes nicely crisped and the accompanying lettuce leaves crisp and fresh. It was a little bland (although there was a pot of mayonnaise with it Ò but it was the same as I had with my calamari so did not really fancy eating more of it for my main - I would have preferred a little pot of mushroom sauce or some similar type sauce or gravy Ò but that's just my personal taste, and I only left it as it was exactly the same mayonnaise that they had served with my starter). For desert we had tiramisu, which was delicious. The food came swiftly, although we did have to ask for the bill and there was some delay in trying to pay, but not so long that it made us late for our show. All in all the meal was decent value for a London restaurant and pleasant enough, ideal for a quick, basic, non fussy, pre-theatre meal.

The quality of food is excellent. Wide selection ranging from Mongolian lamb (a must) to prawn and tasty soups. The personnel is nice but quite slow. Took a while to get the bill while our cab was waiting. Highly recommended. We will go back. soon!

I ordered a take away from this branch via Deliveroo. I had previously had very positive experiences with this chain at various London locations. I gave my feedback to Busaba following the meal . I began by saying that the food Arrived cold. However, the main emphasis of my feedback was about the quality, quantity & presentation of our meal for 3 people (which cost over £50) being seriously disappointing & not anything like the eat in experience.I then received a response from Busaba blaming the problem on Deliveroo & telling me that Deliveroo had fully refunded my bill. He said that he had passed my comments re the food on to the kitchen. The main focus of my feedback had been the poor value for money & the sub standard food.I then spoke to the manager Mike who had responded on behalf of Busaba. Once again he tried to blame Deliveroo. When I pointed out that most of the ingredients listed on the menu were visibly missing from my Satay salad, he told me that I must have seen an old version of that dish & the menu had changed 3 months ago. That is the version currently available to order. They had also decided to serve the Satay sauce on the side, so the chicken appeared as several grey, unappetising lumps of meat.The duck dish that we ordered was one of the most expensive on the menu, & consisted of a few small slices, which he informed me was one duck breast, with a small garnish, no accompanying rice or vegetables & is charged at more than £13.I shall not be visiting or recommending Busaba again. Not because of the disappointing experience, but purely as a result of the problem not being taken seriously & the blame being shifted to the delivery company. Very poor customer service!

My friends and I have visited Browns in Victoria for lunch for several years but we won't be doing it again after our recent visit. We were no longer allowed to lunch downstairs as we had done before so travelled upstairs in the shabby service lift. My friends are not very mobile and it is unacceptable to be treated like deliveries because of a change in restaurant policy. The waiter was delightful but there were not enough staff for all the covers so by the time the food Arrived it was dry, over cooked and cold. I had to send it back. My friend's pasta dish was dry and tasteless. The puddings were fine but the meal was such a disappointment all round. Not cheap either. We were celebrating a birthday. We'll celebrate the next one elsewhere. Not good enough - it used to be better. Can only hope the chef was having an off day.

A ÷local' Italian in Hampstead that actually feels Italian, though more upscale than a traditional taverna. A variety of dishes are available, though the veal in particular is good, but whatever you order coupled with the enthusiastic Italian staff, you'll enjoy your meal.

Looking for something in Fetter Lane, go no further. The food is simple, standard French bistrot fare, but the wine list is impressive. There's a basic list and then a more exotic one with some excellent numbers. Downstairs, deep in the bowels but the ambience is good, the servica attentive and the pricing reasonable for the offerings.

A great ambience, reminiscent of a posh coffee house. Quality of the cakes is good, though pricey (as is to be expected);service is mixed - some staff very friendly and professional; some obviously still learning; all said, overall a recommendable experience

I actually go to this place quite a lot, and have been for years, and I just love it. Cozy, friendly, and with a cool London crowd - there's always a real buzz about the place, plus the food is great and the wine fab. Get yourself there!
Had lunch here, quite busy but got a table. Staff friendly and helpful when I was undecided about which beer to order. Food was very tasty with decent portion size. I'll be back

Not a good dining experience. I am vegan and ordered the vegetarian salad without ricotta and part way through eating it I noticed that there was pancetta in it. A serious and negligent oversight from the kitchen. I also had to send back my side as I ordered it without mayonnaise and the kitchen without my asking, decided to substitute this with Parmesan. For any vegetarians and vegans, I recommend you be careful about eating here. There seemed to be a real lack of appreciation & understanding for a lifestyle where you don't eat certain foods.

First time I went in the end of August for dinner. I had the ittenbari ramen, and thought it was possibly the most authentic ramen in London! The soup base was especially flavourful, and the ramen had a nice texture. I really liked it and was surprised to see bad reviews here.Almost a month later I went again at lunch time and ordered the same ittenbari ramen. This time it was bad. The ramen tasted boring, the soup base was bland and just salty. It tasted like a complete different dish. (Actually when my ramen was served, I thought it was the wrong dish because the noodles and the soup just looked very different from what I had remembered.)So now I understand why the reviews here range from extremely good to extremely bad. I wonder if it's different chefs, or they use cheaper noodles/soup base at different days to lower the cost...I'm not sure if I want to give it a third chance. Such a pity as I thought I found the to-go place for ramen in London...

Visited here on a recent trip to London before going to see a show as we were running out of time for somewhere to eat. How we wish we hadn't.We were sat down at a table for 2, which was originally was a 4 which had been separated. Tables felt as if the person behind you or next to you was right on you as very little space between tables. Unlike most of the restaurants in this chain I have been in which are quite relaxed and quiet this was totally the opposite where you struggled to even hear yourself think. Drinks and food were duly ordered which then Arrived. This is where the service which can't be described as anything other than garbage started. Whilst my partner was still eating some of her garlic bread starter her plate was taken away. Whilst waiting for our main courses to arrive we were then asked by a member of staff to move table so they could make it back into a 4 and moved us to a 2, never in my life have I had this happen to me in a restaurant. This is where my chair and the person sitting behind me's chair were that close every time a member of staff walked between us my chair was just getting barged into by them without even an excuse me please. The main courses Arrived and were plain average and not as good as any other time we have previously visited an outlet of this chain. Dessert was then ordered and Arrived which was supposed to be a sharing sundae - it was only when we received the bill we noticed it wasn't. When someone cleared the table I requested the bill which after 10 mins never Arrived.At this point I was so annoyed with the lack of service and poor experience I spoke to someone in charge as they walked by. As I explained to him everything that happened he looked shocked and even more so when I pointed out we were even made to move tables. He was friendly and very apologetic and even gave us 20% off the bill.Unfortunately that would not be enough to ever get me to make a return visit to this particular restaurant. If you want a nice quiet meal with good service then I would be looking elsewhere.
Our waiter Bass was a boss. Literally nicest waiter in a long time! Very enjoyable. Had the crab and prawn linguine and it was delicious

Chose the restaurant as there was a very good offer on Travelzoo (£59 for3 course meal for two including a cocktail). Thought that the food might be 'tailored' to suit a discounted offer but not so, it was fantastic food and everything the deal offered. In fact it was so good we would go back on a special occasion and pay full price. The only possible downside was expensive wine at around £10 per glass but it was quality wine and I only wanted one glass having had a superb free cocktail. The staff were polite helpful and attentive and I would highly recommend this restaurant (apparently during the day you can see across the park from the dining room.
5p short of a fiver for one pint of beer (not lager...beer) from a very miserable bar staff, i drank quickly and left asap5.30 pm 16 Jun 2015
Franco Manca really do make the best pizzas. It's such amazing value (5-8 for a pizza), and they taste awesome

My wife and I paid a visit for our joint birthday. From entering the restaurant through to finishing the meal it was an excellent experience. The staff were amazing, friendly catered for your needs, staff was attentive but not overbearing which was great. The food was excellent and I would have been happy to taste every item on the menu. The complete experience at Oblix was second to none. My wife and I are planing to come back soon for our wedding anniversary. If you are reading this review, treat yourself and book you will not be disappointed. Great job well done.

My daughter and son in-law took my husband and myself to this restaurant for Mother's Day although we went the day before. It was friendly and attentive from the moment we walked in. There was a lovely buzzy atmosphere which made you feel very comfortable. The menu was lovely and the food and drink even better. We all had a wonderful time and I thoroughly enjoyed myself.

Had a meal here with a friend during the week and it was great. The welcome at the door was friendly and helpful. The menu is good, nothing spectacular, but tasty. Good value for the centre of London. The restaurant was quiet at 6pm but buzzing by 8pm.

We visited on a busy Saturday lunch time, with 8 of us in our group. The service was good and the food was the quality you'd expect from Pizza Express- good! I had a birthday voucher for a free bottle of presseco, which was a lovely treat (so worth signing up to their emails). Also worth noting that you can only use one type of voucher on any transaction.

Visited Rules with my other half to celebrate a big Oh birthday, after friends' recommendation. We were not disappointed. The opulent restaurant setting is pure theatre and the cocktail bar upstairs provided us with a romantic hideaway in which to enjoy our pre-dinner drinks. The Blossom cocktail was diveine. Once seated in the restaurant, I ordered the venison with roasties, my significant other the steak and kidney pud with oyster and mash. The food was delicious and portion sizes good. I even had a little room for dessert - bakewell tart and clotted cream. Scrummy! We couldn't fault the service either. What wasn't so agreeable though was the state of the ladies toilets when I visited them going up to 11pm. They were in a very sorry state (the door chart recorded that the last time they'd been checked was 4pm). Come on, Rules, you do the big flourishes so well, please don't sully the experience by taking your eye off the basics. This aside, I recommend Rules heartily. Save up and celebrate something special here, if only once.

ive always wanted to go because they have a famous burger. But after trying a few times I found out it's only at lunchtime and on weekdays. Not the easiest! Burger was totally average. I do not understand how it can be in the top 10 list. It can't be compared with meatlicquor or honest burger. My husband ordered the scallop. Yes, one scallop for £10. Summary: average food and extortionate prices. 12.5% charge and I spent quite a lot of the meal trying to get the waiters attention for more ketchup.
From the moment we stepped through the door, where we were greeted warmly, to moment we left nothing was too much trouble. Thank you Rules.
Good food and service at a reasonable price. Great bottle of Spanish red for £16 along with a varied pre theatre menu make it a n excellent choice for an affordable night out.
Food wasn't great tasting and poorly presented. The service wasn't good, rushed and plates taken before fellow diner finished, Give a miss, too many other eateries about the bother going here

Went for lunch,ordered and waited 45 minutes for first meal,then another 10 minutes for remaining food.When food came it was not up to usual standard that is usually served in this restaurant.Saw the manager who gave us our drinks on the house,still very disappointed with the experience,will not be going back in a hurry.

I was invited here by a guest of the club after a function at the Dorchester and it was a very nice place to escape the crowds and was pleasently surprised how welcoming the staff were.Great choice of drinks and a restaurant and casino as well if you want to do more.Well worth a visit.

Was looking forward to this restaurant --It is multi floored with an interesting layout --Staff was generally inattentive. The food just had one near miss after the other. The wine list for a high end joint was surprisingly mediocre

Went here for a November lunch. What a mistake. The bread to start was not fresh and was at least a day old stale. An uninspiring menu choice of mains. The steak ordered medium was completely ruined and overcooked, which was a crying shame as the fillet was generous for £22.95. In fact nothing seemed to be cooked that well at all. the fried potatoes, carrots and green (grey ) beans were basically ignored as they did not look very appetising.It was a Monday but I would still expect better food to be served up. The service was sloppy too. I wouldn't recommend going here. I can see the potential for a great night at Goya with the restaurant space downstairs and sharing tapas with a group of friends, but this was a very disappointing display of food and service.

Visited this restaurant before going to the theatre. All thoroughly enjoyed their meals - great choice but as always a little pricey. The service we received was exemplary - cheerful, efficient, drink refills topped up without asking, bill produced without any fuss. Shame we didn't note the waitress' name.

We dined here on a Tuesday evening and the food was excellent. I was surprised that we were the only people in the restaurant. The decor is a little antiquated and being so empty, there was no atmosphere. Recommend the food.

Having had extremely variable meals at other Marco restaurants, we hopeful of a good meal here.Have to say it was one of tehbest experiences e have had. Steak was superb. Also had teh duck which was nice. Good wines.Highly recomended.

Booked for 14:00 - Arrived to a very busy and buzzy restaurant. Elegant staff and a warm welcome. 3 us were dining and we ate from the set menu - well worth the money 2 had Chicken livers - said this was very nice, I had the Smoked haddock soup, excellent - also had bread and butter and mineral water. All 3 had the Pork with savoy cabbage abd Black pudding - this was DELICOUS along with aside order of chips. 3 puddings 1 sticky toffee ( J always has sticky toffee, FAB and 2 others had the lemon tart - delightful - lovely "Light " melt in the mouth lemon and butter pastry mmmm - views to die for along with a bottle of house white. Blessed with a lovely day. Attentive staff would I go back DEFINATELY - highly recommended.

this was an excellent recommendation from a priveate tour company. It was worth the drive to a residential area - off the main drag and so amazing. All fish types available for fish fry. if you dont like fried there is the option of panko or matzo crusted. Also can use butter or olive oil instead of the oil the choose. Very classy place - all patrons were well dressed (not fancy dress just tailored). Service was great and wonderful wine list. As one that lives on the Ontario border this was a nice treat than the typical Fish and Chips greasy spoon.
A pure example of a big chain that doesn't have to try. Rude staff. Waited 30 mins before offered a drink. We ended up walking out
Had the best bottomless prosecco brunch here served by the lovely Jas. If she doesn't win employee of the month I'll be devastated #teamjas #bestwaitress #thankyou
nice food for a chain cafe. better than costa or nero in my view but still overpriced for sandwiches and coffee compared with real italian delis

This place is disappointing. I'm a big fan of Thai food but the menu is limited and over priced. What we did get was reheated and not great and the set up poor and impersonal! Who wants to sit on a table for four with another couple they've never met?? We won't be returning.
We had Italian antipasto and then rump steak. It was very good, well cooked and tasted wonderful. The service was excellent, the wine was perfect and I highly recommend the place!

Aberdeen Steak House Argyll Street, London (near Oxford Street)...worst meal ever, Rib Eye for me and Sirloin for the wife, both overcooked and accompanied by terrible sides...my BBQ beans were basically normal baked beans but with a small amount of bbq sauce poured down the inside edge of the container (and not mixed), both had a lettuce garnish and this ppled like it had been sat around all day as the bottom cut edge of the lettuce was browner than the sole of my shoe...the chips were supposed to be steak house but made of all sorts of small bits and pieces, the wife's portion was full whilst mine the bowl wa only half full and the sauces were disgusting. They were congealed like custard that had been taken out of the fridge and reheated in a microwave in texture. I am not one to complain (normally I put up with poor service for an easy life, no doubt like the majority do) but for £60 for two meals it really was worse than anything I have ever experienced...I asked that both meals be re-done and 15 minutes later they came back to the table with two more plates with sides...nothing was really any better and the steak was certainly not done 'medium' Like I have seen another reviewer write, it was almost like it had been oven cooked and then flash fried on a griddle, it certainly hadn't been rested as there was no juice to it at all. I have never left a restaurant without eating before, this time we did, it was that bad....we obviously also declined to pay.
Booked for birthday drinks and had a great time. Good selection of drinks and food. Would definitely recommend x

This is, in my opinion, the best restaurant in London! The staff are warm friendly and have a well oiled team focused way of working. They are not intrusive, but their presence makes your evening complete. Food, well 'simply the best'! There are not enough words to praise highly enough both the food and the staff. I'm waffling now because this restaurant is just soooooooo fantastic! oh - just book it!Thanks you Vaivea, Igor, Odon and Salvatori for a most wonderful evening, again - see you all soon!

Anyone sane has been eating at Smokestack for the last 2 years, because they've been consistently selling the best beef ribs in London.The restaurant carries over extremely well. Service was fantastic. There are a few growing pains to be aware of, there are too many seats for the space, and it's the first time ive actually had the 1:30h per table rule enforced (you're moved down to a a very decent bar to finish drinks), but the service is so good that this is easily forgotten. Plates are the right size. We got 2 starters, 2 small plates, 2 sides and brisket and pork ribs between two and I'd say that was bang on. Everything was cooked extremely well and the flavours are all incredible.Ignore some of the negative reviews. It's not overpriced, it's exactly what you'd expect to pay for top quality BBQ food in London in 2017 and the atmosphere is fantastic. Of course it's loud and dimly lit, what else would you expect?Finally, top marks for taking reservations - even more reason to check this place out as soon as possible. We'll be back again!

Used to be a regular for dinner here, every week at least once. That changed about 4 months ago, something must have gone wrong in the kitchen - the food went from average to ..."I actually don't want it,thank you very much" kind of food. Such a shame! Got very excited when I saw a new thing on the menu (vegetarian option) and ordered straight away. What was meant to be an aubergine and butternut squash curry with basmati rice was a sloppy mix of peas , chickpeas and squash with some long grain overcooked rice - not basmati. Brought that up with the manager, he apologised ... nice guy. Paid the bill in full. On the bill there were 2x aubergine curries - no aubergine curry was served to me and my husband . Disappointed.... Will come back for drinks as it is our local and the staff are lovely . Will give food a miss .

The restaurant did not open punctually as advertised which is contradictory to the punctual efficiency inherent in Japanese culture. Despite being the first people to arrive, it still took more than 30mins for the food to arrive (two ramen bowls). The ramen broth was fine but the noodles were starchy and had a raw quality. My own past experience indicates that this was likely due to the liquid not being the correct temperature when cooking the noodles... Had I not been on a tight schedule I would sent them back but alas hunger and lack of time prevailed. Service-wise the servers were friendly and helpful however the manager or supervisor seemed cold to both customers and staff. Any customer who walked in, unaware that it was late to open, got a stern, sharp 'not open yet!' and no apology when the doors eventually opened. Overall a disappointed experience

We came her as part of our anniversary tour and we didn't regret it! The staff is very friendly and also peculiar at the same time.Portions were great size an very tasty!Just make sure you book if coming on a busy day/period to avoid disappointment!

We visited this place twice in one day. First time for pre-activeity drinks and second time for some grub. What I can say is this place is obviously very popular with the locals as whenever we have been here it is always busy. Drinks are as I would say London prices - so fairly pricey - happy hour doesn't exist here on a Saturday which is a shame as a lot of places have happy hour and it is always good value for money. Some of the bar staff are friendly and helpful otherwise just look miserable to be there on a Saturday but I suppose who can blame them when everyone is getting merry and they are working.The atmosphere in here is pumping, loud and lively - with a DJ downstairs blaring the music - which I love! We didn't make any reservation for dinner and just asked if we could be seated at 7:30pm and they were happy to accommodate for us. We were seated right underneath the air con which wasn't very nice but we had scarves we used as an extra layer. The waiter service on the tables in the restaurant was very slow but again being a Saturday evening and at peak dinner time they were rushed. Our waitress took our drinks order and food order at the same time - she was very pleasant. We asked for a small bottle of water and was given a large bottle but I blame this mishap on the loud music - we corrected her when it Arrived and got the small bottle we ordered. Food come out super quick and was mouth watering. My mum had the pie - which was a large portion with plenty of veg, cheesy mash & a red wine gravy...she was very happy. I went for traditional pub grub - a burger - although I didn't ask for a bacon & cheese burger just a cheese burger...I didn't want to correct her the second time so just ate it. Even though it wasn't what I ordered it was still just as nice. We enjoy coming here and will be back in the future.
Liveing locally, we visit Goya frequently and the food is consistently tasty, particularly the patatas bravas and chicken croquettes. In my opinion, the most authentic and tasty tapas in the area.

Been there for lunch on a week day, not busy at all but I found the service very slow and inattentive. Nothing to say about the food quality, definitely good, loved the options and dessert`s variety but still a bit too pricey if we consider the lack of attention from the staff....

What a creation, Mac and cheese melt with added chorizo! Prices are good but I did think it was a bit cheeky to add 50p to you bill if you choose to sit in. Seats are very limited but the service are good and the combos they offer are amazing. The quality is great and I can't wait to go again and try something new!
