Its a bit far from hampstead , but we had enjoyed Andys cooking at zafferano , read good reviews so although we knew it was a neighbourhood restaurant we wanted to try it .Very glad we did ,friendly welcome , led upstairs to a pleasant table at the back , very busy with a range of ages, it felt good to be there , excellent rossini cocktails , , watermelon salad and crab salad , both tasty then roast chicken and for me malfatti prawns , plenty on the plate and both a delight to eat , finishing with a very good tiramisu and panna cotta.Very jolly, friendly service , great atmosphere on this saturday evening - so this is stayer , lucky hammersmithonians !

My company booked our Christmas party here, aside from moving our booking back half an hour without telling us, being rude when we asked and not putting out enough seats for the number we'd pre-ordered it was overcrowded, extremely hot and took 30 minutes to get one of the drinks we'd also pre-ordered. To top it off, they hadn't put out our seating plan, otherwise they;d have probably realised there wasn't enough seats and served non-vegan food to a vegan in our party. I definitely think the staff were overworked and the room was way to crowded.I also thought the food was below the standard I'd expect, made on mass and with very little finish.

The restaurant manager THET and our waiter CSABA made everything possible so we could have a perfect dinner for our group of 15 people. The whole staff of this steakhouse was so friendly and professional. Thank you so much for making a great evening even greater! We'll come back for sure when we're in London again.

Arrived at 12 noon when they opened. Ordered 6 small Tapas dish between 2 of us. We had to keep asking when the next food was going to arrive. Final dish Arrived at 13.24. Food is good but the long waiting time is unacceptable

We came here on a date - at first i was alarmed as the entrance is in the bar section which was really noisy on a Thursday. But actually was lead downstairs to the restaurant part, which was really great. It was his first taste of dumplings: he loved them, and the price was really reasonable.

Food is really great but when we ordered a bottle of very good wine for cocktail at our table we got it after we had finished the starters and when we finally got it after many requests,the Sommelier Arrived and was so arrogant that this was awful. We had to request many times our bottle of water and when it Arrived they poured it in the glasses up to the top to finish immediately the bottle !! awful. We noticed that the waitresses were at least trying to do their job, but the people who seemed to be the supervisors, with a black suit, were really unpleasant to say the least.

I booked Fire and Stone for dinner before going to the theatre. I didn't bother with the pre-theatre booking as it didn't get good reviews so just went for an earlier time slot to give ourselves plenty of time.We were seated quite quickly (but it was only 5:15) but it then took 15 minutes for someone to take our drinks order, so we ordered food at the same time. Waiting times for the starter and main course were perfectly fine, though we did have to prompt for replacement cutlery.We ordered a side salad with the pizzas but that didn't arrive at all, and it wasn't added to the bill, so therefore was completely ignored by the waitress.The mixed starter was really good with hot and cold elements and warm flatbreads.The Peking pizza was very tasty with lots of duck and garnish, but my Tokyo was short on topping and was quite bland, even though it said it had wasabi. Avoid this if you like any flavour on your pizza.I do understand it was a week before Christmas and was therefore very busy but it isn't cheap and if you charge prices like that, you should expect better service.

Dine on the Thames, overlooking the London Eye, South Bank, Big Ben... it's bliss on a sunny London day. We always go here when we visit London. The food is delicious & beautifully presented. This time we only ordered chips.. but they were so good we ordered a 2nd bowl! They were perfect salted fries with morish dips. I will be back with my friends at Easter.

Four of us went here for a treat while visiting London. As it was restaurant week there was a 3 course meal for £25. The warm chicken starter contained bones and dubious looking chicken. The service was a disgrace, there were only 4 other tables occupied so you'd think the staff would have a bit of extra time to be attentive. This was not the case at all we were waiting at least 20 mins between courses. For mains I got a well done steak as I'm pregnant but it came out cremated, blackend and burnt. My sister asked for a medium rare & it came out raw (blue) she was eventually able to send it back after 15 minutes when we eventually got the waiters attention. I would not recommend eating here at all but the view was fantastic of the London eye. If I was to go back it'd only be to have a drink & soak up the sights.

We wanted quick food and went to friday's. The 4 of us got seated immediately and we enjoyed our food and drinks.Burgers were good,fries a bit so and so. A mate had the chicken and shrimp,tasted good but was heavily overpriced at about £ 17 for 2 shrimp and a little piece of chickenbreast with mash and veggies.Service was really good and and I would def return if I wanted Burger King food with beer and waiterservice.

We had a dinner with friends there. To tell the truth it has been a long time since I could enjoyed both the food and the service so much. Everything what we ordered was nice and fresh and really delicious.

Once again we had lunch here on Saturday but this time it was on of the worst dining experiences of my life. The restaurant was very busy. When my lobster spaghetti Arrived it was cold and parts of the fish still frozen.I attempted to taste a little but it was uneatable . I wasn't offered another lobster [ which I thought odd] but something different off the menu. I re ordered a simple grilled tuna but when this finally Arrived it was hard and tasteless with no seasoning, or rocket garnish. We had to demand that my partners pasta be served at the same time as this tuna [ why would we want to eat separately ?] but they didn't cook him a fresh pasta, just kept it warm until my fish was ready , therefore the pasta was hard and dried up. At no time was a proper apology given , nor did any staff check if we were happy or unhappy with our food. There was no offer of free drinks , desert or anything complimentary. What was supposed to be a special treat had become a nightmare and as we spent over £100 I do not think that either the food or the indifferent service was acceptable. We will not be coming back and shall seek out a new local.

What else is there to say? These guys know exactly what they are doing and they do it INCREDIBLY well! A great night and will definitely be returning when I am next in London. Thank you very much guys, awesome job!

This restaurant reminds many italian features: the name of the dishes, the nice outdoor table arrangements like in Rome, the unflexibility and arrogance of the Venetian waiters, the service of the students mensa in Milan (grilled lamb Arrived very cold), the bills of turistic restaurants in Florence. Not the quality. All what we have eaten (meat balls swimming in untasteful sauce, mackerei tartare, lamb, etc) was an Italian fake, "senza infamia nÌ¬ lode" (not wonderful, not terrible). The Affogato al caffÌ¬ and the grilled bread was very good!!!

Staff very slow...Told a member no toilet roll in men's still not replaced 2 hours later. Serve Guinness in any glass.Food portions small and with everything in London overpriced Wouldn't rate it at all.
Very welcoming and friendly staff, nice modern and clean restaurant. Food very good and adequate in quantity especially starters and dessert.

On our trip to Greenwich, we decided to have lunch here. It was almost 4 and the restaurant was closed so we went to the pub which was smelly and dingy. The bar man told us that the kitchen was closed. Just as we were about to leave, the owner came and told us that he wouldn't mind serving us in the pub. I am so glad we stayed inspite of the smell. There was no menu. Tom sat down and just explained what was available. He called me the "Bossy Queen" which has unfortunately stuck. Now my husband calls me that every time I ask him to do something. Lol. Food was excellent. The pies were the best. Portions too big. I was even told off for not finishing my food. Very jovial and fun service that made the experience better. If you are ever in Greenwich do not miss this place. Tom will take care of you.

Popping in here on a Saturday lunchtime, our cheese melt and mac and cheese were both so tasty. The garlic dip for an extra 50p was also very nice.We felt the music was a bit too loud and some slightly stronger cutlery in what is admittedly a 'no frills' place would have helped. Nonetheless the food was very good.

Took my 7 and 11 year old for their birthday and was very disappointed.The host couldn't of shown a worse couldn't care less attitude, once seated our waitress was friendly enough but also couldn't be bothered. They didn't have two drinks we requested in stock which was poor as they should of been stock lines. We ordered potato skins and jack daniel's chicken wings to start, the wings were ok but the skins were cold. The main courses didn't get much better the bbq rack of ribs came in three pieces and looked like they were cooked three weeks before and the chips were cold and very pale. on the plus side the monster burger was hot and tasty.We didn't stay for dessert as by that time were not only fed up with the food but all has headaches from the blaring music including my 11 year old who alwayS seems to be plugged into his ipod so that says it all.... AVOID

Disapointed by quality of the food, quite unlike anything I have experienced in last 9 years of travelling frequently to Thailand. Jungle curry very bland and entirely unimpressed. Som Tam was too sweet. Cod fillet was the best of a bad bunch. Do not recommend.

Went here with my other half before we went to see The Woman in Black at the Fortune Theatre. We Arrived at about 4.45pm on a Saturday and were seated straight away which we didn't expect. Our starters Arrived very quickly but as soon as our plates were taken our mains were plonked down within 1 minute so we weren't really given enough time for our starters to go down. Even so, our mains were really nice and the whole meal worked out at £20.00 a head which we thought was good value for a restaurant in Covent Garden. I don't usually like to eat in chain restaurants but this was a decent experience and i would definitely go back.
Cafe Rouge Kew is my favourite restaurant, not just because the food is great but also because it is fantastic service and atmosphere. Highly recommended

This converted cinema is now a pub. Original features have been retained. It is good value, serves hot (not cold/lukewarm) food and the staff are friendly and genuine.I travel from Central London especially for the food.

had a great dinner here with colleagues. Had to wait in the downstairs bar for twenty minutes for a table but that was no hassle. The tapas menu is great and the food was great - it Arrived two or three dishes at a time which worked well. Nice slurping wine and good service, great atmosphere. What more could you want?

Went there for a priveate dinner. Had a set meal in the dining room where both the service and food were disappointing. From a service perspective the kitchen didn't seem to be able to cope with a large group. The bhel and fish tikka were disappointing and unfortunately the mains didn't improve. I have eaten here before and wonder if the food quality was patchy as the kitchen couldn't cope?

The upstairs dining room provided a comfortable, quiet setting for spending a full, pleasant evening, even though it was a busy Saturday shortly before Christmas. The meal was ok, but the food fell a little short. My main was kid, but was so salty its flavour was not discernible. I asked for a side "such as potato, pasta or rice", and was told fries was all there was (I see now on their website they have crushed sweet potato, which sounds a more suitable option, but there was no mention on the evening). It didn't seem quite the refinement you would expect at £240 for three (excluding service).

Went for breakfast with my nephew. Lovely staff and good breakfast. However a child's small drink (cup of lemonade) at £2.50 is a joke. What are you thinking? You're running a family friendly eatery? I wouldn't go back again.
I don't want to give anything away...just go, enjoy the wonderful food and Jesse's great company. And then tell all your friends to go too!

Five of us had our annual Christmas lunch at this lovely french restaurant in Covent Garden. The food was of excellent quality we all thoroughly enjoyed the high standards that were set.The wine list had plenty of selection and we certainly weren't disappointed especially with the reds. A very long enjoyable lunch we will be back long before next Christmas
Very good quality and better taste, cheap prices and good service. If you like Thai restaurants is a good option
Amazing food polite staff all very welcoming meet the owner I belive and she was lovely she was very kind and gave us information on some other nights they have on the boat will be visiting again

The food was delicious, many items to choose from that are all healthy for you. Plus, at the end of the day, they donate the left over food for shelters. They are concerned about the environment too, have recycling and just plain good food!!!!

I wanted to be close to the theatre as it was lashing rain and I was already soaked when I Arrived at Cote. It's a good place to go as there's a range of dishes to choose from, even from the set pre-theatre 3 course meal for £13.95 which is extremely reasonable for this part of town.I ordered some French bread which Arrived with some butter which was fresh and springy. My pancetta and poached egg salad was light and savory. Followed by chicken with a thyme sauce served up with mash which hit the mark and was a decent portion. Finally I had an apple crumble with ice cream which was served in its own ramekin and was hot and cold.Despite being extremely busy for Easter Monday, the staff were quite quick in taking my order and serving it up. They seem to be in control and this was appreciated when you're stuck for time.

Not sure what the best thing about this place is.The pie was one of the best pies I have ever had, and Tom is a joy. He talked as though the menu (as they are not any) with a joke and a passion. He is a man that enjoys the food. I would definitely return here.

Long standing 24 hour greasy spoon cafe. Food is always good, however I have only ever had English Breakfast here. The coffee is excellent and the service is mostly good. Right by the station and easy to get too.

While not much in London is "cheap", you will find this chain all over London and it's a good option for a quick lunch on the run without spending to much. The food is generally good and the service is friendly and quick. Some locations can get very busy at lunch time.
Great little place in the heart of Wimbledon. The food and the service was excellent. I'll definitely go back. Highly recommend it to anyone.

Worked in London in another life (a lifetime ago) and had forgotten how great Pret food is until we washed up hungry in Bath looking for something quick but tasty and nutritious, cue: Pret a Manger in the city centre. I had the fresh vegetarian avocado/cucumber/herby wrap which was outstanding. Wish they would open one in Eastbourne...

A quick stop off for early evening nosh before a gig at Under the Bridge. Good food - 2 burgers, 1 F&C, and an unusual Black pud, chorizo, quails eggs and basil salad.Not enough in the salad for me, but companions had no complaints.Only downside was being unnecessarily sandbagged by a staff member ( manager?) pretending to be a customer outside and telling us what a wonderful place this was with great food. And then walking into the pub as we ate!

It offers a variety of sandwiches and salads which are fresh and full of taste. Unfortunately, they do not offer much range in Vegetarian selection. Though many suggestions had been forwarded to them for having some range available for pure vegetarians ,who do not consume eggs,fish or any other meat products, I do not see any new introduction to the range available. Must say that the food offered here is extremely of good quality.
we waited a very long time for food and there wasn't even a large variety too offer. No cider was being sold either and we weren't told about that until we went to order. However the food was good

This is an excellent Lebanese restaurant. We had dinner there on Saturday and inexplicably it was almost empty.The food was excellent. Mixed kebab and hallumi salad with some starters. We ordered labneh as a starter and despite it not being on the menu when we requested some zaatar they were happy to oblige. The food is very good but it's the service that really makes this place stand out. Will definitely visit again
My favourite burgers ever. I have only tried in iceland. But i imagine they are the same quality all over the world. Really nice service.

I'm very fond of the Samdan. ive been numerous times and found the quality and friendly service to be very consistent (not easy to find in so many restaurants). Personal faves: the always very succulent lamb shish,the dolma, the sigara boregi, the tagine. The falafel are perhaps the only thing I would say we're not too keen on, we find them rather dry. The desserts - particularly the baklava, sticky toffee pudding and chocolate cake are yummy. The dishes come across as very freshly prepared and are a good size. The restaurant is lovely and cosy but it is quite small so it's wise to book if you're going in the evening. Clean toilets too (many restaurateurs seem to overlook the importance of this) I would have given 4.5 stars if I could.
Great pub for Sunday roasts! Cosy and warm, I love it in the Winter months. Great for families and friends.

We had given up on finding a good local Indian restaurant, but spotted this on trip advisor and thought we would give it a whirl. I'm pleased I had read the previous reviews as from the outside I would not have been tempted in....even once inside the decor is very plain and not really like a restaurant. I took the advice of one of the previous reviewers and had the seafood popcorn.... I ordered this as a starter and it was huge definitely enough for two people to share.......not that I was giveing very much of it to my husband it was fantastic the slightly spicy batter and the chilli dip it was served with was totally delicious, I eat the lot and was really worried that I wasn't going to be able to manage my main course. My husband had the devilled chicken, which again was big enough for two to share....again full of so many flavours. For main I had the lamp chops from the grill... I was expecting them to be dry, but they were in a spicy sauce, which again was delicious my husband had the chicken nadan curry which he loved. The service was polite and attentive. We had a bottle of red with the meal, which was very reasonably priced at £12. We will definitely be going back, now we have found this little gem

This restaurant could easily be missed on the corner of Blackfriars and Cutts, and it would be a pity. It is a lovely surprise inside with a open bright restaurant that had jazz singing but still a quiet atmosphere. I had the Sunday set menu for £21 for two courses. Very good value and excellent food. I will be back and not a few weeks time, but this week. Yes that good. Staff very friendly.

I come here every few months to meet up with ex-work colleagues mid afternoon for a few beers. A nice big airy bar. Always a great select of ales although they can run out rather quickly at times. Food is the standard Weatherspoon menu and delivery is fairly quick. On busier nights the bar does feel rather small compared to the size of the pub and number of people it can hold and it can take a little while to be served. Will continue coming back.
I went here with a friend for dinner! We wanted to eat Asian food (we were mostly looking for sushi but didn't find any). Anyways, the food was really good, I enjoyed it a lot!

Beautiful decor and the sort of opulence no one should be used to. Champagne flowed and Kate Moss was in the powder room, but I couldn't help but think it was all wasted on this clientele. Outside some posh boy was peeing on the street in full view. Some of the staff were hilarious in their rehearsed manners, like that when the bar stopped serving they would simply ignore any approaches rather than just tell you "the bar is closed". Four stars for the amazing surroundings, but is it worth spending a second with these people...? That's for you to decide.
So the sandwiches are fine but they stay the same year in, year out. Could do with easing off the mayo in all of them too.

A very good location next to Borough Market for lunch. Fresh food from the market prepared in small tapas-style dishes to share with friends or family (full-sized indiveidual dishes are available).Some of the dishes do seem overpriced (considering the size of the servings), even for London but overall a good sit-down alternative to the market food. A good atmosphere and friendly service.
Great local pub, nice & cosy with good food, and friendly staff. Really handy for tube & Premier Inn hotel

I have been eating in this restaurant since 1986 . But have not been there for about 5 years or so. i had dinner with some friends last night there.wow same owner same lovely atmosphere and the food is to die for. One of my friends is Greek and he knows his greek food . he gave it 11/10 .If you are going book first because they are always full .
Was here for a business dinner and loved it!! The staff was very friendly and accommodating; could use a better beer selection however. Food=AMAZING. Lamb chops to die for.
We had the prix-fixe two course meal and it was just perfect. Nicely prepared moules and a chicken/roquefort salad, appetizers and a good viognier and it was 50 GBP for two. Service was spot-on

We discovered this little gem of a restaurant, hidden down a side street just off Leicester Square as a result of friends booking a table for dinner. The decor is spot on and makes for an authentic dining atmosphere. There are two set menus to choose from (we had the more expensive one at £20 per head). Their policy of free refills means you don't go hungry. We also asked to try a portion of one of the dishes that was on the other menu, which wasn't a problem at all. The staff were very friendly and attentive. We'd definitely go again.

I visited Rules with a friend and family for my friends 50th Birthday. The only disappointment was that we Arrived a little early so that we could have cocktails upstairs before our meal, when we got upstairs we were told that the cocktail bar was full and that we could not stay as they would not allow us to stand! So we had to go back downstairs and advise them that we could not have drinks. But from that point they were very apologetic and got us seated early and from being seated the whole evening was fantastic, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and our waiter was very pleasant, the food was the best I have ever had, I know it is expensive but worth every penny. I had the steak and kidney pie and can honestly say have never had a pie like it before, in fact all 5 of us enjoyed every course from starters to desert. I would say for a special treat then this is perfect.
I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone. I was served chicken that was still raw in places and the replacement meal was disgusting and had obviously been microwaved.

This was our second visit and we weren't disappointed. My husband had a pork chop with crackling and I had a lamb steak, we shared a bowl of chips which were crinkly and had their skin on, yum! Quirky ice cream for him and English cheese with a pear jam for me. The waiting staff were very pleasant and everything was hot and fresh. We will be visiting again.

I intended to have lunch at Rules on my own but having left it too late, and on the advice of the charming doorman, returned another day. Six of us came for lunch having just done a back-stage tour of the Royal Opera House Covent Garden. It was a bit unimaginative and unadventurous of us, but we all had the steak and kidney pie. It could not be faulted. The service was attentive and the whole atmosphere delightful. A must on your London visit. I can't wait to return.
Came there to have breakfast at 7 (official opening). The door was indeed opened at 7:03, but we were told they'd need half an hour before actually starting.
Great spot for nibbles and a drink, especially during the week as it's always nice and quick. The staff are always lovely too, especially meti who is always very helpful

Apologies to Thea Gilmore's song but it's a tad more specific than London and pubs don't get better than this in the capital. So don't get put off by the city types blocking up the doorway, barge in and go upstairs to the restaurant which is less hectic and have a pie and a pint of seafarers. Sadly you may need to book these days as the message has got out that this is a great place. Very cheery American trying to organise things single handedly when we went and mostly succeeded. Strange thing about this and other similar places in London is that by about 9pm it's deserted.

A group of us really wanted to eat at Wagamammas in Putney but we had one child with us who doesn't eat rice or noodles. Every child's meal has rice or noodles. Asked if we could substitute small portion of edamame beans for rice or noodles on child's plate. Told they would do this but would charge the full starter price which was about £4.50 plus the full child's meal price. The restaurant was empty on a Tuesday night and we were a big group so plenty of money being spent. I just think this is crazy for a big chain and was very disappointed. I would certainly not choose to eat here again.
Visited a few times whilst staying a adjacent premier inn.Great location near tube station.Friendly staff,good food at reasonable prices and great selection of beers.Well worth a visit.

I could return to Brasserie Zedel over, and over, and over again. I can't say enough nice things - the first time we went, we turned up at 8 pm on a Saturday night as a group of 4, and even though the place was packed the lovely gent on the front door still managed to find us a table for an hour later. We waited next door in Bar Americain (BEAUTIFUL cocktails) and they came to collect us when our seats were ready. The food was far too delicious to be as reasonably priced as it was, really genuinely lovely French food. Plus the band were positioned right next to us and playing wonderful jazz. Love, love, love this place.

We have been to this restaurant many times now and we have never had a bad meal. The food is always fantastic and the portions are huge. The fish dishes are exceptional. If you are ever in North Chingford you must go there. It's easy to find as it's next to Chingford station.

Absolutely appalling customer service! ive been going to this Pret since it has first opened in Stratford. I ordered a takeaway sandwich toastie and while it was being toasted, the staff superciliously stared at me as unexpectedly my card was declined. Feeling a bit weak, I sat down to rummage in my bag for change. The staff then proceeded to attend to the next customer. Upon finding sufficient change, I ordered a new identical version of the toastie sandwich. When we left to consume our food elsewhere and I opened my Pret bag imagine my shock to find out that that the sandwich was burnt beyond edibility, with its crusts blackened from every angle at one side of the bread. The waitress had toasted the sandwich twice, despite fetching her a new toastie! My anticipated meal dampened my growling hunger as the sandwich had been burnt beyond disfiguration. I did not pay 3.75 for a burnt sandwich regardless of how long it took me to find the change. To add an insult to the injury to the atrocious customer service there were no tissues provided. I know Pret often tends to be forgetful or is it miserliness when it comes to tissues but having none at all for a takeaway meal simply astonishing. Pret has been serving its takaway meals ever since its been serving its eat in meals. Would it not be understandable for them to provide tissues for all of their meals? Also paying full price for burnt food is a swindalous way to treat customers. Hopeless customer service.

Had a long lunch here recently as a group of 3. The restaurant and food traditional English. You can feel (and see) the history everywhere and the menu is filled with traditional dishes. We all had the pies where were all quite good, although my wold boar and mushroom pie was a bit too salty for my taste. My husband and our friend loved their steak and kidney pies. The next table shared the roast beef which looked very good and it came on a huge platter filled with all of the usual fixings...the desserts were also very good. Overall an excellent experience in terms of food, service and ambiance.
Was really looking forward to trying this as I heard it was a good place for a Burger. busy place that messed up our order twice and when we finally sat down to eat it was cold. Disappointed

Went to Hush tonight,what a lovely gem of a place.We ate in the outside area and had a cocktail or two,which were very nice!The food is sublime,cappuccino of beef for starter was really lovely and the crime brÌÈlee for dessert was the best I have ever tasted,we ordered a side of chips with our main which were £5 each and the drinls are expensive but you are in mayfair after all. I would really recommend this place and we would come again when in london,If you can get a deal as above I would say go try it.

I used to live in Whitechapel and I never went there. I celebrated a friends of mine birthday and we stopped by by chance. It has been a nice surprise. Food is good and there is a particular range of beers. We had a "salvation" beer. The atmosphere was enjoyable. I'll go again.

I got a takeaway from here as a friend recommended it after the pub.Lamb shish which was very tasty and cooked perfectly, pitta, and a delicious salad.The only thing that annoyed me was that i asked for a pot of yoghurt sauce and they charged me £4.00 for a tin of it which was completely unnecessary, my fault i should of checked before i left.I would definitely love to dine in next time as the food was really nice and it is a nice setting.It was quite expensive, £30 for lamb shish, bread(very nice) salad (very nice) and the tub of yoghurt and cucumber sauce and halloumi.
It's not the cheapest but definitely the tastiest burger I have ever eaten!!Sat at the bar - really nice atmosphere and helpful staff

We had a disastrous meal at Browns, left the restaurant and walked into the Cote Restaurant, St Martins Lane. The food was lovely, every one (4 of us) were extremely happy. The service and staff were amazing best we have ever had. We felt thoroughly looked after, nothing was too much trouble. The two waiters that served us were friendly, professional and very cheerful. One of the waiters had only been working at the restaurant for two days, he did a brilliant job. The whole experience was totally fantastic and more than made up for the rocky start we had had at Browns! I would highly recommend eating at this restaurant. Well done Cote at St Martins Lane!!!!
The food is fresh and you can choose to take away or eat in, which gives you the opportunity to choose between two different prices. We found everything clean and the staff is kind.

Big disappointment after being regular for more than 3 years,ive been there in July we ordered a platter to share after getting it we realise that was no lamb or chicken shish I asked the waiter why he answer with we don't put it in this platter so I called the manager he apologies and he said we've been so busy we dident hv enough meet left wich I found ridiculous and not fair it doesn't take much to be honest with you're customer's and let them know before they order,since then I didn't came back. Then I said maybe it was a mistake that I can forgive I went back with my friends we dident hv time to look at the menu the waiter was so pushy and he want us to order straight away, again I suggested to go for the XL extra large platter to share for 57 pound to be sure it will be enough and we were surprised again how small was it ,the same size as the small one just few lamb ribs one minced lamb extra ,so it was disappointing again and after giveing a feedback to the waiter that the portions are to small comparing to the prices he said I don't know it's been always like that.So my advice is if you wanna make more money try to keep your guests happy and build a good customer relation ,by cheating on them you will loose more money then making more.I will never go back there
We read that you could sometimes be rushed on service, not this time we could not fault the service.Food was what you would expect from a michelin star restaurant.Overall a very pleasant meal

This restaurant came recommended and I can see why. Atmosphere created by the decoration is very classic british and regal. We liked it very much. I had the dressed crab, followed by the rump steak and then the apple and quince crumble; all of the food was great. Presentation was very good and nothing disappointed. The only thing (as mentioned below) was that for a very British restaurant none of the staff were British. Would have been a nice touch if they were; it would have added to the atmosphere. would definitely return.
Fab food wth a extensive menu, brilliant and attentive staff and lovely atmosphere..be back soon :-)

Came here with some friends on a Saturday night. The service was pretty slow. We asked for water which we didn't get and some of our starters didn't turn up. We waited an hour for our main courses to come out. One of the steaks had to be sent back as it was not cooked as requested and poor quality, chewy and tasteless. my lasagne was nice but not very warm. Some of the dishes were nice. The skate and canelloni were tasty. By time we got to puddings most of us requested tirimisu but it had nearly run out and only 3 people got any. It wasn't the best tirimisu I have ever had. Bit too soggy. Price wise was good, about £25 a head including drinks. Though the service was slow the staff were very pleasant

Situated in a windowless cavern, first impressions aren't great as you walk down the steps past the toilets to get to the main dining area. Is this a restaurant or a wine bar? If it's the former there is no welcoming committee and given our reservation was for 5 ( and had been confirmed via phone a few hours earlier) it was disappointing to see the table set for 4. The food was decent quality but an inconsistency in its preparation was a let down. The wine list abundant enough to satiate most desires, and the dessert choices attractive as well. The service, whilst discreet, was lacking in polished professionalism with plenty of amateur-like serving mistakes made. Not really sure why in such a small enclosed environment the management feel it necessary to play music at such a high volume. I would've thought it would be a far more pleasant dining experience if they allowed the general chit-chat of its patrons to create the ambience. Of the 5 of us at the table 3 gave it a 7/10 , one of us gave it 6/10 and the outlier was one fellow diner scoring 8/10. That gives you an average of 7 . Which personally I think is about 1 point too much.

Love this franchise that is all over London and some other towns we have been too . The food is fresh organic made daily and really tasty . Great coffee as well . It really helps you to eat healthily while you travel and it's cheap eat in or take away .

We ate here for a team lunch and it was decent burger-style food. It was a bit too cramped for my liking, as the tables were rammed in very close together and this also made it tricky for the waiting staff to get around the tables. Food was good but it was a little too noisy for us to talk to colleagues along the table and the staff were quite stretched.

Went here on a whim attracted by the cute ambience and milkshakes and lobster - my Tyrone of combo The service was polite friends and efficient, the food was amazing !! Having been to their burger and lobster venues in central London this one will definitely give them some local competition. I'd highly recommend !!

We came across this whilst wandering through Covent Garden. Despite the sign on the bar saying "children running around will be given an espresso and a free puppy" (they were joking, by the way) we took our 5 and 2 daughters in. It is meant to be more Bistro than silver service, which is probably what some of the moaners on here were expecting. My wife and I had fresh fish which was lovely. The children enjoyed their fish fingers as well, the staff we found to be friendly and helpful, but best of all was the look on the girls faces when they ate the Sticky Toffee Pudding ice cream. Our 2 year old cried when she finished it. It is in a superb location and we enjoyed the visit.

What me and my partner love about this place is the fact the food is simple with some very nice twists. Try the burger at lunchtime, hands down the best burger ive eaten this side of the pond! Sooo juicy and I believe the pickles are made in house... deliscious!
Took 15mins to get our order and 1hr to serve our appetizers! As for the main dish i had pasta with chicken and the white sauce was not good.

This was the second time we ate at yo sushi, but first time in westfield, and it was extremely disappointing. The seats were filthy because nobody bothered to clean them so I had to do it, the belt was empty except from some sweets and some makis that looked like they were falling apart. The sushi was not good even when we ordered from the menu and the chicken teriyaki had a very bitter taste to it. We ordered soda but did not even get a glass or some ice! Would except much more at that price! Very disappointing.

Delicious meal with perfect presentation and service. My only gripe being the two foot wide centre leg on the tables. I can't sit splay legged all evening, so had to resort to a less than comfortable side saddle approach which was less than comfortable.However, I hope to soon return and enjoy another sublime meal there

Nice chain of fast food cafe with salads, sandwiches, fruit and beverages. Nice to have the option with just a small salad or a boiled egg. A spirit of religion dominates the places. Pretends to be serve healthy food and take care of environment. I just felt invaded by all the advertisements telling how fantastic they believe they are. Too religious in my opinion.
.... Said the couple next to us! Mum and I had pasta which was great. Good neighbourhood Italian, brilliant value for money, welcoming cheery staff and a real buzz to it!

We were visiting Greenwich on a day trip and stopped here to eat dinner-- boy am I glad we did! It wasn't very busy when we Arrived, so we had the owner come and sit with us for a while and give us some great suggestions. Very friendly and personable owner, amazing fresh, food made on the premises and great atmosphere--you can't go wrong. When the bill came, we also realized it was great value for your money! Would definitely suggest to anyone visiting the area!

The venue was chosen because it was something a bit different to celebrate two family birthdays. There were two small children in our party and the staff were very understanding about them and provided a high chair. They also offered the four year old fish and chips which he jumped at. The adults all said their food was very tasty, and the staff allowed a birthday cake to be brought in and they provided all the utensils needed. We had a great view across to the London Eye, and thought it made a nice change to be on the river and watch the different craft go by.
A bit pricey but very well cooked fish n chips. Regular queues outside and thoroughly recommend the haddock

We decided to try this restaurant for dinner on impulse from drifting through Internet pffers amd where tp eat in London reviews. What ww paod was a steal for London and must say from the start to the finish you couldn't falter the staff's attentiveness and the foods presentation. The menu suited everybody's taste amd cost with an extensive wine list to choose from and the steak we ordered was cooked to perfection and melted in the mouth with real hand cut chips "what a score"these tasted fantastic and weren't swimming on oil. I would definitely go back when in London next time just for the quality of the steak we had and the atmosphere

We came across great food, but it was a very poor experiences too. We had to wait a while for a table which could sit all five of us, but we felt we were looked after well at the start. Ordering was swift, and easy, and drinks Arrived quickly. We also ordered gyoza, but this never reached us. Our noodles did not arrive together, and my bland pork slices were cold, sitting on top of hot noodles. Surely it would've taken less than a minute to microwave it? Noodles themselves were fantastic in both texture and flavour, and the soup they came in (miso) was good. Portions were on the generous side, with plenty of toppings (an egg, spinach, fried mince and spring onion). I'd say it was fair value for what we paid. But the bowl was made of plastic, rather than china, giveing a lower quality feel to the dining experience. The biggest surprise was that they only accept cash payment. Lucky I was carrying a wad of cash that day, which I usually don't.It could have so easily been a fantastic meal out, but all in all I was far from impressed, and will not be returning there again.

I have visited Park Terrace Restaurant with a voucher from TravelZoo. It was 62 pound three course dinner, coctails and cheese plate. I have to say that food was not exceptional but staff was extra ordinary. So kind but not arrogant. I really had a great night and felt so special . Also just because i mentioned it is my friends birthday while making reservation they treated with a birthday cake which was very lovely of them. A great option for a celebration and making a good memory, do not hesitate. Go for it!

Ate in the first floor dining room. Very nice menu focussing on game. Attentive service. Food quality was excellent. Very unhurried, to the point where we ran out of time and had a hurried end to our meal! Something about the whole setup made me feel like they are trying too hard. A little more informal might work better.
popped in for a quick lunch, very clean comfy seating area and well stocked sandwich shelves, helpful friendly staff, not to expensive.

It's the best Japanese restaurant in London. I don't think you can find any better unless you fly to Japan. The sushi is so fresh and tasty that I don't want to swallow but keep them in my mouth forever.

We booked the HIspaniola for a drinks and canapes reception in October 2014. The space on the main deck was perfect for a networking event and the priveate bar and coatroom made it feel very exclusive. WE got very good feedback from our guests regarding the service and food. We will be rebooking for 2015.

Difficult to give a good review of this restaurant following the very poor service we received.We had initially walked down Munster road looking for a place for a quick evening meal for our family of 4 including our 2 young children. We were attracted in by the advertised 25% off the food bill on Monday evenings.It all started fine. We sat down and advised we wanted food. The waitress initially brought over the menus. This is where things started to go a bit south.The food was good - this is what drags the review up to a 2*. The service was not. The waitress didn't know what beers were available - she didn't go and check, she just advised us she didn't know. We asked about the desserts - she got them wrong - we found out when they Arrived that the daily cheesecake wasn't vanilla - it was passion fruit - it's not like they're even similar colours!Then the bill came - everything full price! I queried this. The waitress advised me that '6pm isn't evening'.Fulham Kitchen, if you don't want to give people money off then don't offer it - simple really.ive included a photo of the advertised discount. I also include the dictionary definition of 'evening' for the waitress' benefit:"eveningèöièv(ƒª)nƒ»Ü/noun1.the period of time at the end of the day, usually from about 6 p.m. to bedtime."

Went for lunch today with my work colleagues - it had been a good six months since we ate at the establishment and the service has gone downhil. Waitress did not take down order correctly and was over charged due to this error. As for the food - I ordered Avacado smoothie as part of the meal, which in previous visits were very good. However, it seems they got it wrong there too - the smoothie consisted of milk and ice with very little avacado which i had complained to them about. To their credit they remade it but the second batch was only marginally better. Also, the portion of the food was somewhat smaller than what i remembered it to be with a slight increase in price to boot. When it was time to pay - the person at the till was rather surly and rude. Utterly disappointed with the food and service and will not frequent there any time soon.

Visted the tabernacle in Notting Hill had squid starter definitely not fresh squid frozen then had Caribbean fish and chips the chips were not home-made cheap frozen fries the fish was not fresh can tell it had previously been frozen too should off just went to iceland
Very busy and noisy. customer service was very good and the food was served very quickly. It's one of the popular places in Putney.

Had dinner here for the first time the other night with friends. This is a very big room, however the atmosphere was first class with a very nice buzz about the place. My soup and fish were excellent, however my wife's steak was slightly over cooked and lacked and garnish. We finished off with tart tatin which was very good. The wine is expensive and at £175 overall per couple not cheap. But this is Covent Garden and therefore to be expected.

Came here for drinks after work with colleagues and though we didn't eat, we drank plenty.The atmosphere is good and the place gets busy. The bar staff are all very friendly and it's not a problem getting served quite quickly.After putting the drinks on tab though, when it came to paying, I was prompted by the card machine to add a discretionary tip - which is usually fine, but, annoyingly, Williams adds a 12.5% service charge as standard anyway.This is a disgraceful practice and should be outlawed. Why pay for service twice - and why pay for bar service for drinks only in any case?

Service was good, staff were polite and efficient. The food, surprisingly was good, served quickly, hot and very tasty. The restaurant was clean and had a good atmosphere. Have been to this restaurant on a few occasions and would definitely go back again. It is a great place to go for a pre theatre meal or indeed just to have a reasonable priced meal in the middle of London.
Callum is a great bartender! he served us courteously and graciously and added to the greatness of our evening.

Two for an early supper. We were greeted immediately and shown to a table by the window. Menus delivered drinks orders taken. My friend asked for a glass of sparkling water, but they brought a bottle.When we ordered the food, I asked for the Pane Bella (bread basket) as a starter and, as usual, asked for butter with it. The waiter said, "we don't have any butter"! Yeah, right, a restaurant with a huge kitchen, serving a range of dishes, but no butter on the premises? Who is he kidding? I smiled and said, "I always have butter with the breads at Bella Pasta." He made a face and said, "not possible." Nice one, now you're calling the customer a liar. I said that I would not then have the Pane Bella and he seemed surprised!The food was tasty, although my main course was warm rather than hot. I waited for the waiter to ask how the food was so I could ask for it to be heated a bit more, but we didn't see him again until we had finished eating and he came back to clear the table.When he did this he failed to offer desserts, so we didn't have any.We won't be rushing back. This should have been a four star review and it COULD even have got five stars.As the title says, "Good food, let down by a lack of sincerity".

Came in on New Years day whilst shopping in Westfield. Thai calamari was excellent, as was the massamun duck curry and prawn stir fry. Not the cheapest place but nice food. Service was slow to start but good at the end

Went to their monthly wine tasting plus meal (visiting each Italian county) with family. Great atmosphere, proprietor made a point of welcoming us. Wine tasting great fun with good tasting notes. Meal based on the region's cuisine excellent.
Its a solid place for having a snack or quick bite. The quality is absolutely fine and good value for money.

Came yesterday by myself, I have to say.. really nice food. The venue was really busy, however, Marco was very efficient and nice to me. Definitely calamari is the best dish, along with Mussaman duck. See ya

It might be a Jamie Oliver chain restaurant but the food was lovely, service was excellent and the whole experience was spot on. It's a favourite place of ours and we've been back a few times and it never dissappoints.

This newly opened Italian on the Chatsworth Rd deserves a visit and definitely delivers real Value For Money.I ate here on Saturday night with my family prior to the London Marathon and it ticks all the boxes for me when it comes to choice, taste, service and above all value.The menu offers enough choice of starters, pastas, pizzas and grills to satisfy even the most jaded of palates. The Pizzas are just as I like them, freshly made authentic thin crust with an excellent selection of fresh toppings, they are ample enough for anyone and at about £10 are a bargain too. The Pasta dishes are generous and made with great fresh ingredients which simply speak for themselves.The overall atmosphere of Venerdi is relaxed and friendly. The staff are efficient and very attentive, always smiling and going that extra mile to ensure your overall dining experience is one you will be happy to recommend. After all, great food without great service equals only average meal. Mediocre food with great service equals good meal. Venerdi delivers on both fronts so I'll definitely be back for more.Don't worry about your wallet taking a hit because the prices here are really reasonable. Don't just take my word for it, read the other reviews and get down to Chatsworth Rd while there's still a table to be booked.

Our second visit to the restaurant for dinner. Excellent service and the food is superb. It was hard to choose what to order as they all sounded great and we were not disappointed in any of our choices. Staff are very friendly, respectful and attentive, make you feel very comfortable. Will definitely be visiting gain very soon.
I have eaten there on several occasions, and the food is good service good, beer good, can get quite busy at peak times so if you can wait to eat at non peak times it would be worth it.
Great decor, nice atmosphere, not too busy whilst we were there, but can get busy. Very friendly bar staff, fab food. A little expensive, but thats London for you.

A friend introduced me to this coffee shop. It is light and airy inside with the usual reclaimed furniture scattered about. There is a lot of seating round the back in the form of benches that can be shared. The staff are friendly and attentive. The decaf coffee was a nice blend but the cakes were very average. We had a sponge cake and a brownie but I wasn't blown away by it.
I don't suggest this pub to anyone. Too expensive!!! We paid 11pounds for 2 pints!!!! Unbelievable!!!

My husband and I have always dined at Prezzo branches in Manchester and this was our fist time trying one of the branches in London. In brief, Prezzo never disappoints you. Staff were friendly. Service was nice and food was served quickly. Food was heavenly delicious. We both had Calzone Carne piccante - our favorite dish! We also enjoyed 25% discount via vouchercloud app. Prezzo has always generous offers which you can use via vouchercloud app.

Worth our trip for a good lunch. Nice ambience, good n helpful staff and awesome food. We might think the portions ordered below 10£ are smaller but hey, its really good and delicious. The only downside we thought was being served with a bill that included Staff gratuity amount (optional). Since it was our first visit and we chose to pay online to save few quids as per deal, it did not really help as it nullified the staff. We shall surely go again n yes, its a good place to take family and friends for sure.

I used to come to Goddards many years ago when it was in cramped premises and you could see the pies being made and they were VERY cheap. It moved to new premises and then closed and I thought it had gone forever. I was very pleasantly surprised to see it has been reborn on my visit to Greenwich some years later. If you are looking for a cheap and good quality meal then this is the place. It is not posh (self service) but it is a clean and spacious cafe with loads of seating upstairs. The pies are the thing to go for - they are great quality and filled to the brim and there is a huge choice of fillings. I usually have mashed potatoes and gravy though you can have liquor.If you do not want your plate swimming in Gravy then just ask for a small amount. I did see some eel - traditional but not for me.A pie and mash is about £4.50. Pies takeaway probably much cheaper.
Never been b4 lovely friendly staff great service! gorg. Burgers will be telling all can't wait to go again

The staff were very friendly, the decor was very grand with plush seating in a horseshoe shape around the table. The food was fantastic, and they even brought out a desert with a candle and happy birthday message for my husband, which was a lovely surprise

We occasionally go out for lunch at work and this isn't all that far away. We've tried several of the local burgers and they're generally pretty good so we thought we'd give this a go.I can't say it started off very well. We all ordered a cheese burger (medium well) and fries. What Arrived was much closer to rare/medium rare. We all sent out food back and this is where the experience improved dramatically. All the food was made fresh and piping hot when it Arrived. The burgers were all medium well and my god they were good. Juicy, tasty and not overly dense like some burger places. We were all in agreement that this is probably the best burger we've had in the area. My colleagues commented that it's in the quality range of BRGR and probably cheaper! For less than £15 you've got cheese burger, fries and a beer. I'm certainly not going to complain at that!We got chatting to the manager and he even offered to hand deliver to us if we wanted!We'll be back. We will be back.
Great friendly service. Good menu and prices and great tasting and quality food. No need to book. Went here by mistake and pleased we did.
We came here on a voucher from a family member where two can dine for £60. The food was exquisite and the service was superb. We had a lovely evening and can't recommend this venue enough.
Great food and service very attentive staff . Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that it is quite pricey for pizza and chips

I met an old friend here for afternoon tea on Saturday. The sandwiches were uninspiring and rather soggy, the cakes were uninteresting. The scones were OK I suppose but somewhat commercial and bland. To top it off, the tea selection was interesting and the best bit but I asked to try a second flavour and was charged extra for this. In this day and age when you get free refills in coffee shops , I was very disappointed. I am looking elsewhere for afternoon tea when we meet up next year.

This is my local and it's not let me down. Philip, the Irish owner, is a master of customer service and always makes you feel very welcome. The menu isn't huge but what they do - they do very well. My favourite dish is the Szechuan chilli chicken and the duck and watermelon salad. Everything is freshly made and without MSG so you don't get that post-Chinese food salt hangover. The decor is cute, the waiting staff are nice and the beer is always ice cold. A winner.
You get what you pay for... very nice tapas, & a good atmosphere. On the flip side, it is expensive and the queue for a table for 4 was long, maybe an hour or so.I'll still be back, I'm sure!

Went here for brunch on a Saturday and will definitely go back. I had a great Eggs Benedict which came with some tasty hash browns - the eggs were cooked perfectly. My partner had scrambled egg and chorizo (can't quite remember the name of the dish) - he loved it.

This used to be great. I mean great. If you wanted quality fish n chips you came here. Then they had fire and they did the place up and now, well, now it's shell of it's former self. It's not bad, it's just not good.

On a recent trip to London we decided to dine in here one evening as we knew the brand and were comfortable with the quality we were expecting. We were greeted at the restaurant by the host who certainly didn't have the most interpersonal skills and were quickly hurried onto a side table. The food and cocktails that we ordered were great and the only complaint I had with the food was that my vegetables that came along with my steak were cold. I would have sent them back if our waiter had came back to check on us! That was what was missing - the human service element which is crucially important in any restaurant especially this American style diner. Wouldn't rush back.

First off if you're vegetarian or vegan...not the biggest selection for dinner. I ate broccoli with cheese and hummus. The plates are meant to be shared but since everything else had meat I stuck to my plates. Now if you can get past the fact you don't have much to choose from that doesn't seem like you're eating "sides" or you eat meat the food itself is DELICIOUS!!! The hummus was my favorite. My partner got two meat dishes and also really enjoyed them. With wine for me and a beer for him and a shared slice of chocolate cake the check came out to around £60. So it's not the cheapest of spots but the food quality makes your wallet less sore and in London you can definitely pay way more! The dim lighting makes it cozy and the place is small so you will be sitting really close to other guests but I didn't mind that too much. The staff were friendly. Food didn't take too long to come out. Overall I would say give this place a try. It's a cute date night out sort of spot !
It was a good bar with friendly staff however it wasn't anything special and the surrounding area seemed to be dangerous.
Been there 2-3 times and the food always delivers to my expectations. would recommended to anyone who wants a casual yet gastronomic lunch.

Been several times since it opened and the Comedor never disappoints. Bit of a staff and menu change since my last visit, and though my favourite starter and dessert have disappeared, the star is always the steak, and that remains great. A fillet, ribeye and churrasco all hit the spot, add some great double cooked chips and it's job done. Plenty of other interesting choices too, good service, hard to fault..Very enjoyable
Having Manzes Pie and Mash was part of growing up in the east end of London.Now,50 years on,it's as spectacular as ever. Go there!!!!

A cosy intimate little restaurant; on the street there's a soft glow from the restaurant lights that almost invite you in, and once inside its warm and welcoming - we immediately knew that it was a good choice. The staff were lovely; attentive and helpful without intruding on your evening. The food was delicious; we chose six small-ish plates that we shared - the concept is much like tapas but with Venetian / Italian food. For dessert we had a flour-less hazelnut chocolate cake and a tiramisu pot - these were the nicest desserts ive tasted in a very long-time.It was a really lovely evening, I couldn't fault it. Highly recommend and value for money.

Honest and up front re waiting time to be seated, especially as Summer Hols, 6 pm. Kids menu was spot on for variety and price ; fishfingers £6. Hubby had steak, I had salmon super salad , desert, drinks all £57. Really good value, venue was buzzing and staff were welcoming, friendly, busy and efficient. We will return next visit to Covent Garden.

My daughter and I went to TGI's Covent Garden for lunch. We have been taking her to this restaurant since she was a wee girl. Beth, the young woman served us was the best waitress ever. Attentive without intrusion. She instinctively brought me another glass of water without my asking. My meal Arrived cold but Beth was quick to correct it, apologised and a new meal plus a fresh new salad Arrived promptly. Then the manager came and apologised too. Happens... and when it Arrived this time it was perfect. Toilets clean. Great atmosphere, fun, fabulous cocktails and the best BBQ ribs ever. My daughter says the Jack Daniels burger is the best. Will continue to be 'our' place Thank you TGI Covent Garden for many years of creating a great food experience for my family.

I have been here several times and I am simply in love with this place.The menu at 35 pounds featuring 3 courses and a glass of champagne is really a great deal. Service is very careful and waiters are prepared and kind. Bread selection is diveine and each dish is presented in a scenographic way. Bravo, continue this way and maybe introduce a late dinner set menu.
Mickey and Andre served us and we're absolutely amazing!! So friendly and they joined in our fun. Fun atmosphere and great night out!
Don't order the fish and chips. It's microwaved and rubbery! I had to leave the batter as it was just soggy. The worst fish and chips I have ever had. And the size of the fish wasnt that great either

Really looking forward to a nice meal before going to see Les Miserables, visiting London for weekend so difficult to know where to eat. Have eaten in other Wildwood restaurants and enjoyed the meals. Ordered a couple of starters to share, meatballs and mushrooms. Meatballs were tasteless and meat quite chewy, I think just reheated. Mushrooms we're ok but needed lots of seasoning. Main courses carbonara and a Lasagne, neither were nice. Again meat tasted processed perhaps and reheated rather than fresh. Staff seemed more interested in getting us to buy more drinks than whether we like the food!! Rose wine not good either. Really disappointed.

Really enjoyed a late night post theatre visit. Not looking for fine dining just a nice drink and some good food. Excellent pizzas, lovely wine and good attentive service from the very friendly Mikey. A good choice, filled a gap and after this experience would go again.

Marco's at Stamford Bridge is somewhat enigmatic. On the surface it appears to be a top-class London restaurant, however the fixed, printed menus are more reminiscient of a chain eaterie. None the less, the quality of the food was excellent throughout. Fois Gras with fried duck egg on brioche was rich without being too heavy, while the scallop starter was nicely fresh and very delicately flavoured. Mains of duck breast and tuna were equally enjoyable, the duck in particular being cooked to absolute perfection. The cheese board was plentiful and contained some interesting choices, and a vanilla pannacotta with prosecco and strawberry sauce somehow managed to be both incredibly rich and creamy, and also very light and delicate.The wine list was very resonable and contained plenty of tempting bottles for under £50 - in the end we opted for a delicious St Emillion at £49 and then an excellent Italian dessert wine for £51.Service was good - attentive without being overbearing and dishes Arrived in good time.The bill was £220 including service, which might sound a lot for a meal for two but I would judge it worth every penny - and we did have £100 worth of wine after all.

Very neat cafe/restaurant near Greenwhich village, with a great Christmas dinner menu, food is good, only thing that bothered us was the noise. Very loud dishes noises, mostly coming from staff piling plates and coffee cups.Right by Ibis hotel. Definitely a good place to eat.

We visited this great fish resturant for a pre theatre meal and we were not disappointed.We chose the special ..Hake on crab risotto with sea veg which was delicious, the service was also excellent. Our seat outside was comfortable and a great way to people watch on a busy warm London evening.Dinner for two for under £50.00......Would highly recommend and we will return.
Had a lovely lunch, nachos to share and also a delicious Texan Ice Tea (or two). The staff were very good and friendly. Good atmosphere and great choice.

We had my husbands birthday dinner on a Saturday with 10 of our friends!we had the set menu which was just perfect considering the size of our party,the food was absolutely delicious, Seabass that was cooked beautifully and the salmon starter which was perfectly seasoned!!The staff are attentive,nice and friendly and they were always smiling with a great attitude!The cocktails are just high on the list and the handsome and sweet bar supervisor just made it so much more special!Overall great experience and we can't wait to go back there!

Stopped for lunch before heading to the airport after a few fantastic days in London. Not in any hurry, but hang on - 25 minutes from order to delivery on a weekday?? The food was good when it finally Arrived, but nothing to write home about. Then the wait to get the bill and pay. Well... ended up going to the desk myself to avoid spending the entire afternoon waiting for service.Avoid the restrooms if you can, they stink. Could do with a thorough cleaning.

Really good proper pub with great atmosphere. Excellent beer with its own brewery below, attentive staff. We did not eat but food looked good with generous portions. Nice friendly mix with locals and visitors alike. Well worth a visit. We will return. A great afternoon was had

Gorgeous place, hidden in the heart of Pimlico. Such a homely feel. Never had a bad experience here. My Dad comes from the North and requests we go there when he visits. There's a million amazing restaurants in London, but he chooses this one.

We went to Cahoots for a team Christmas party on 14 December. None of us have been there before. It was an absolutely grand surprise in terms of how fun and cool and delightful place this is! Drinks, food, service, music - everything was perfect. And a lot of fun! :-)))

I looked online for an okay priced afternoon tea to do something nice and different for my sisters borthday, i booked online for 4 of us a week ahead! The deal was £25 each for the afternoon tea menu shown on their website.. Which included a glass of champagne! Ended up with cales that were stale and not very tasty and tea jug that had tea dirt marks which was not very nice to see... And eventhough we made an alright day event the waiters themselves seemed to not care too much about us, no menu was given to us so no1 new what they were eating! And noone got told what drinks were available, really poor service on their afternoon tea.. And to kill it ... We did not receive our glass of champagne... And by da way.. They could really use a little cleannn atleast the windowsss as its all you seee...!! Thanks but dont think ill return!
We went here with a party of eighteen and we're looked after excellently.The food freshly cooked and enormous portions.Service great,food fantastic definitely returning.

Staff were very friendly and attentive. It was late Monday pm so not very busy which was nice as I am sure it is very busy over the weekend. Food from starters to dessert was all good and yummy! Toilets in the restaurant zone/3rd floor in John Lewis were very clean too which is always good as when visiting toilets in restaurants and they are clean is just kinda reassuring! Anyway, enough about the toilets/restrooms would recommend and would visit again when next in London looking around John Lewis!

This is one of Jamie's restaurants right in the heart of the indoor Covent Garden Market. He must have paid a fortune for the pitch and it is reflected in the silly prices. Nearly £14 for an average pizza? Great service but average quality meals. Won't make the same tourist mistake again, best to find somewhere off the beaten track near Covent Garden.

Well started off with forgetting all our starters and mains arriveing without any acknowledgement of our missing starters. I did gave to say to the waitress, "please take the starters off the bill" at which point she realised they had never Arrived.Onto the mains, hmm, mediocre would be generous. The chefs special was ceaser salad. £16.50 for a small portion of grilled chicken on a bed of just about there salad leaves with tiny (teeny) grated amounts of Parmesan, grated so small that the flavour was just lost. I had 6 crumbs of croutons, and by crumbs, i would describe them as six petit pois size croutons that if we had not joked about, I would have missed. I have had a better salad in a premier inn! Onto desserts, yet another disappointment. Having ordered the Bakewell tart warm with warm vanilla custard, what Arrived was cold Bakewell tart with a cup of very cold single cream. The waitress did not tell us that there was no vanilla custard, so upon pouring it on and expecting a warm dessert with custard, we had cold pudding with even colder single cream. All n all this was the worst £93 I have ever spent on lunch. I would never eat there again and would advise anyone with any sense not to either. Overpriced, pretentious and uninspiring. Wish I could turn the clock back and never have wasted my hard earned money there.

Ordered Sunday lunch in between sessions at the snooker final. Fair enough the kitchen were busy but they hadn't taken into account the fact 2 big events were taking place at Alexandra Palace. When I pointed this out to the Bar manager he completely lost it at me. Rude, aggressive and repeatedly coming back to our table for another argument. Good food though!?

Love coming TGI's. Just cannot beat the Chicken Strips with the Jack Daniels sauce. Went for lunch today, and was pleased with everything. Our Waiter Sam was very friendly and very good. Food was really hot when Arrived and the whole experience was superb.Already planning the next trip. As long as you keep selling the Chicken Strips with Jack Daniels sauce, we will keep coming.

The family run Indian restaurant, well located, cozy and reasonably priced. The dishes were all tasty especially my chicken. The only disappointment was a vegetarian starter for a friend of mine - breaded potato.
Has anyone else noted that the size of the baguettes has decreased over the last year or so. This means less bread and less fillings so I try not to go here anymore!

Went to the Reform last night after seeing on the board by the restaurant "Steak or Lobster and chips and half bottle of wine for £14'. Great deal, right? Went in and staff was very attentive and polite, the decor is modern and romantic, and everything was excellent. However, only after we sat down and had some bread we realised that the offer was for a 'Lobster burger' which was made of some lobster but also other seafood like crayfish, etc... I was a bit frustrated as wasn't in the mood for a burger, but for a proper lobster. So I really suggest they fix their board and tagline for the promotion, as it's very misleading. The food and service was great though, and the deal very much worth it. My husband had the steak and he said it was great. You can also pick 1/2 bottle of red or white wine, so you don't have to drink the same wine your party is drinking. I had a great experience beside the disappointment with the misleading advertising of the 'lobster'. But i still recommend the restaurant.

Used tesco clubcard vouchers to pay for our meal, so only had to pay for drinks. Had main course and pudding, both very nice. Service excellent and very quick, (we went at 6 pm) which is good if you want to see show. Looks a small restaurant from outside , but big seating area downstairs. Well worth a visit and handy location for theatres.

Jamie's was busy but food Arrived quickly after ordering. Its cooked in front of you in central open kitchen.Nothing fancy fishnchips or pizza I had the coldbeef salad which was excellent.Plenty going with jugglers and magicians in viewWe thought it good value for London
I was expecting something special. I found eating a soup.Nice place. Tasty food but not great. Reasonable prices.Staff so/so

Just off Trafalgar Square and handy for lunch, but I'm not sure I'd come here again. The staff were efficient enough, but the place is nothing out of the ordinary. Food is ok, although nothing special. All in all, it was all just rather bland.
Lovely gin and tonic to take away while walking around that area! I would also recommend negroni that they do there! It's lovely!

I used to work locally and have been here on several occasions both for business and pleasure - delicious italian tapas served in a warm and lively environment. The quality of the food is always consistent and there is an excellent wine menu.I believe this restaurant should really have an even better reputation that what it does already - a lot of this is probably due to the fact it is in Victoria which isn't necessarily the most obvious location for entertainment.

For London happy hour-- great drink prices. Food was classic pub fare-- lots of fried stuff. Overall, it's a fun place to sit and have a pint with mostly locals. Just remember-- order at the bar, pay at the bar, they'll bring your drinks/ food to you. And don't tip. I tried to leave the bartender a pound per round, but she was having none of it!

We went for lunch; menu was ok but food that came was mediocre. Plus, when ordering curry we had to order rice extra (charged extra), and also were served half litre bottles of still water each at £3 a bottle (vs offering one for two to begin with). I have had better pad Thai and curry itself needed a healthy dose of fish sauce to bring out some flavour.
The lamb chops are incredible, you can't go wrong with the menu here though. The staff are generally nice but are very busy.

We had dinner at Jamie's Italian up the road a few days earlier, and it was great. During a wander through Covent Garden Markets around dinner time, Jamie's Union Jacks English menu restaurant is right in the middle - almost to the point that you eat a meal food-court style surrounded by shoppers. The menu looked like quality pizzas and fish, so why not ? We were seated quickly and welcomed. But it sort of went downhill from there. Our server was a young lady who really seemed like she wanted to be someplace else. Drinks were slow and not presented well. Food (pizza and 'super salads') were average at best, chips were cold. Pretty pricey for what it was, too. There was a problem at the adjacent table that involved the server and the manager, and the whole issue played out (including the manager chastising the staff member) right beside us. Not too professional. It's a pity, because the idea and using Jamie Oliver's name could,have worked well. Oh well - been there, done that, not again ..... Mind you, the deserts looked good.

I raved about this place and food is lovely great friendly staff and lovely atmosphere but it as got incredibly over priced. Was £13 for the rib - where you get 6 of them, and about £9 for six prawns. Both very tasty and well made but expensive for what you get, ends up being over £20 per person, essentially for 1 course as it's tapas style food. I'm hoping they don't keep increasing prices as this is a great place to take friends when visiting and show off our lovely area.

If like me you only eat a full English once in a while, you really want it to be a good one. At Balans you will not be disappointed. Our Scandinavian friend chose smoked salmon and scrambled eggs, our American ate eggs benedict with lobster and avocado, and the Australian (me) went traditional British. All of us were very happy with the great ingredients, well-cooked and presented beautifully. Juice and coffee also good quality. Good value at £20 per head, especially compared to local hotels, with all the extras.

After a few weeks of traveling the English countryside and dining in some very upscale restaurants, we had a yearning for a simple lunch experience. We stumbled across the Gourmet Burger Kitchen in Notting Hill and it turned out to be a wonderful experience. This casual dining spot featured some of the best burgers we have had anywhere in the world. The Blue Cheese burger was very flavorful and served piping hot. Add the Skinny Fries and Chocolate Shake and we were in heaven!If you want to relax, enjoy great food, made with fresh ingredients and served hot, stop in the GBK. You will not be disappointed.

We booked 2 tables of 6, the staff were clearly upset about this and did not hold back in showing us. We had 2 groups, 1 boys and 1 of girls who were sitting at either end of the bar at a table. We stayed for one drink, and were prepared to spednd the entire evening there for a friends birthday. I hasten to add that we were not being disruptive, loud or rowdy in the slightest. But the disdain and attitude of the staff made all of us feel very uncomfortable and we felt pressured to leave. I am not one to easily be made to feel awkward but the staff there managed it. I had one cocktail and it tasted alright.

We have been coming here for years....Such a beautiful place to eat. The food is always nice, The staff are quite friendly. I can honestly say ive never had a bad meal here. It does get busy evening / weekends So best to book just incase!
The food here is delicious and the staff wonderfully warm and welcoming. Particularly recommend the prawns, mussels and the 'fabada asturina'!

Really attentive host upstairs in the cocktail bar - we had booked a table for drinks on a Friday night, but were 30 minutes late and it wasn't a problem at all. Because we were late, the table wasn't ready yet and the host just handed us 2 glasses of prosecco to apologise for the wait. Brilliant.Cocktails were a tad pricey (starting at £9ish, but £14 for a cocktail is a bit steep!), but great atmosphere, attentive staff and nice surroundings. Great place.

Had lunch here on a hot sunny day. At noon the place was already nearly full and noisy. My wife ordered the chicken soup with noodles and tofu. I had the rice noodles with chilli and beef. We ordered spring rolls for an appetizer. First miss....the mains came before the appetizer. Second miss.....the soup had a funny taste to it, unlike any Thai soup I have ever tasted.
