The broccoli in the soup looked less than fresh. There was also a large piece of ginger in it that my wife bit into by mistake. My noodles were very good with a tasty sauce, lots of beef and chilies. When we were well into our mains, the spring rolls Arrived. The dipping sauce was good, but could have used more of it. Ask for some chilli sauce to pump up the flavour. With all the great places to eat in London, I will try another Thai restaurant the next time I crave Thai food.

I had the Shoyu Ramen with extra pork slices and an extra half egg. Didn't need the extras.The noodles were fine but the broth didn't have enough depth.The atmosphere is cramped and the toilets are grim. Don't come here on a date.I would try a different ramen bar next time - there are enough of them around now.

Went to see a friends band play in the basement of this venue, it was only 9pm and the door staff were already out, I had a large bag with my laptop etc and I knew this would hold up the queue. I kindly mentioned to them that my bag is quite large a few times because I could see the queue getting larger. It's was full of clothes, my laptop, chargers etc, the curt door woman then told me she didn't care and that she wasn't touching it. I was then made to empty it outside the venue by the dirty street, and then referred to my clothes as 'those things', it was all quite uncalled for hostility. Finally I got my ID out to go in and they said 'we didn't ask for that' and then pushed me in without even checking. Once inside I went to get some whisky that I saw on the menu from the bar, and the barman firstly had never heard of it, and then after going to get it, told me that they didn't stock it?! Total confusion. The rest of the evening was okay, just a normal bar with loud music that you couldn't really talk over, nothing special, and worsened by the rude doormen who ruined my evening.

On recommendation we went for dinner there last Thursday evening. We had bought a Travelzoo voucher which gave us a three course meal, cheese and biscuits and a cocktail. There was an interesting menu and all the food was delicious and beautifully presented. The cocktails were lovely and all the waiters could not have been more helpful. This is very good value for the money - well worth a visit!

While on a five mile walk about we happened to be near Trafalgar Square and hungry when we saw Little Frankies so in we went. My wife had the Spaghetti Bolognese and I had the Spaghetti Oceana which had lots of yummy shrimp in it. We washed it all down with a couple of diet Pepsis. The decor is fun with lots of old pictures to check out while dining. All things considered the food was good, the service was great and the location is very good so gets a recommendation from me!

We went to the White Hart for a Sunday lunch to celebrate my husband's 30th birthday. The setting is absolutely beautiful and the restaurant itself is not overcrowded at all so it was easy for everyone to move around and mingle. As we were a table of 12, we needed to preorder so opted for a rib of beef that served 8-10 people, with the remaining guests going for other options. The beef was an absolute monster - it honestly could have served 15. It was so delicious and cooked to perfection. The fact that all the sides etc were served family style, also made the meal that much more social. The staff (especially Sam) couldn't have been more helpful. Service was just attentive enough without being annoying or overbearing. I had brought in a cake from Hummingbird Bakery that went a bit lopsided in transit and the head chef managed to salvage it by serving it up with ice cream and strawberries to cover up the dodgy bits! We were also presented with a massive doggy bag of our leftover meat that has been very well received. The wine selection was excellent and the price point was comparative to most pubs. All in all a great experience - a huge thank you to the staff for making it such a special day!
One of best value meals had for a while, not cheap of course but lovely menu, perfectly cooked fish and very helpful, knowledgeable and professional staff. Earl grey tea ice cream amazing!

Always pop into the Courtfield when visting London and staying in the Earls Court area.It s a nice relaxing and friendly pub and a good place to enjoy a pint whiclst watching sport on the TV.This time though we were in early and ate breakfast.Very good start to the day. Full english breakfast was very good. Service was friendly and the food was served quickly. Our coffee was also topped-up, which was a nice touch.See you next time Courtfield.
I love this place. I love the no preservatives and healthy food the provide. They are extremely reasonable considering the quality of the food. Can you franchise these?

We popped int o this restaurant whilst passing through Putney. We love noodles and have been through a few of this and other chain restaurants, but the customer service here was by far the best we have experienced.The staff were very attentive, without hanging over your shoulder. We had a great meal which was enjoyed by everyone. We did have a very small issue with a dessert, it did not spoil the serving or the meal. The staff were excellent and could not be more apologetic and did everything swiftly to resolve the very small matter.When we received the bill, the manager had refunded the cost of the dessert which was not requested or required and would not have affected the Tip!We would be happy to recommend this restaurant, for the service, food, value and general ambiance in the restaurant.

I was taken here yesterday for lunch in a really buzzy part of the City of London minutes from Liverpool Street and the heart of the city . Modern decor , nice staff with a good manner and a good selection of food and wines at sensible prices , yes you can go over the top but you can also stay in a good mid range of price, will happily go back

Great food but service needs to be reviewed to keep steady all the way through. I thought there is a lack of management training to make a plus in this place where it does not much to make the client feel being looked after. Music drove me and friends insane, although I was told by French manager that in Paris, some places (cheap ones not to name them), are the same which I did not agree

I went here for lunch with a friend, booked through bookatable.com. We had the 3 course meal with a glass of prosecco & coffee menu for £25. The restaurant is just off the King's road, so it's set in the lovely streets of Chelsea. Its a very nice little restaurant, however you are sat very close to other diners! The menu choice for the £25 was quite a bit limited from their usual menu, but there was still 3 choices for each course. I chose a cod starter, guinness and steak casserole & a winter fruit crumble to finish. When the cod starter came, I didn't realise that it wasn't a cooked dish, and the cod was still quite raw. I thought it was my own fault for not reading the menu properly so ate the salad and left the bits of fish on the plate. A very observant waitress spotted this and came over to ask if everything was alright. I explained I didn't realise it would have been raw so she offered me to have another choice instead, so I had a cheese and bread starter which was lovely. The Guinness casserole was lovely, came with swede and carrot mash but was a little small. We'd ordered a side of triple cooked chips and cabbage (both £4 each) to plump it up a bit so in the end it was just about enough. The biggest portion though was the crumble at the end. They allowed us to switch the clotted cream with vanilla ice cream, which made it just perfect. I love a hot dessert with cold ice cream. The meal was finished off with a nice coffee and the total bill came to £32 each - which isn't too bad for a 3 course lunch in Chelsea. I would definitely recommend this place to go for a meal - the service alone was brilliant.

Sorry for all the customers who praised this restaurant, but to me - a lover of real Italian food - it was horrible canteen tuck that had nothing to do with Italy. The antipasti plate contained cheap pink salami with a chemical taste, chorizo ( very Italian !!! ), salty ham slices, 7 olives of poor quality, some toasted bread and 2 tiny pieces of watery burrata dressed on a bed of rocket leaves and a dip of olive oil with the balsamico already in it. Actually the rocket was the best part of the dish! On ordering the penne al arrabiatta I insisted on adding lots of garlic but I got no garlic at all though it was mentioned on the list of ingredients. When the plate appeared on the table I already sensed I would be facing a real disaster because it smelled of nothing and looked like penne in a thick red broth. As for the taste, you can easily guess... a ketchup-like red sweet sauce with savourless chillies, no aromatic herbs, no garlic, no parsley, no olive oil. I didn't mention it to the friendly waiter who had to take away my for 90% unfinished dish because after all it wasn't his fault and I didn't want to embarrass him. Prezzo ? What a fraud !

A lot of reviews here saying the food is average. I don't necessarily agree. We've been here twice and really enjoyed it both times. Their meats are really well cooked and seasoned. This time both of us left feeling a bit disappointed about the veg however which was not seasoned and bland. My partner had the roast with Yorkshire pudding. He said the Yorkshire was dry-possibly over cooked. I think they are great with the meats but need to work on the rest. Still we had a lovely afternoon so overall ive rated them very good. The atmosphere is beautiful with St. Paul's in all it's glory and the wait staff are incredibly friendly and helpful.

Organised my nephews 21st birthday party. We had about 75 guests and were seated to the rear of the boat below deck. We did have to share some of the seating as there was another party of about 20 people. Wasn't too intrusive but if you can, I'd advise you to try and fill the whole room for a party. Lovely venue and very pleasant and courteous staff. We had a standard set menu which was lovely. Starter was standard but main and pudding made up for it. Although the boat did not sail it did sway every now and then, from the frequent passing of other boats. So if you get sea sick, maybe you should opt for an alternative venue. My 16 year old son said he felt sickly with the swaying. Drinks were reasonable at £4 for a lovely non alcoholic cocktail. My only gripe was the parking. Because I had a lot of gear to drop off to decorate the venue I was allowed 20 minutes in the embankment for loading ( could have been a nightmare without help, running up and down the gangway with a heavy load) and then had to drive for ages in busy one way traffic to find a parking space. That said, I discovered that you can park on the opposite side of the road , for free, on the red line after 7:30. Or 7pm, (not 100% sure) overall, had a lovely time and would definitely do it again.
Worth a visit to one of the several branches of Paul in London just for the hot chocolate. Indulge further in a pastry while reading your newspaper and your day is complete.
Amazing atmosphere and excellent service. Great food and drinks deals. Outstanding service and delicious food. Well recommended!!!
Watch out for the large portions, so you may like to consider sharing especially if you order starters. Atmosphere at night is quite lively and loud. Food is great and it is centrally located.

This is another place from the Corbin & King stable (as in The Wolseley etc.). This one is French themed and I believe pulls the food off better than say The Delaunay which tries to be middle-European. Decor is very nicely put together and service generally good, if not great. The tables are too close together so choose wisely!

We had the lunch/evening menu for 7.95. The starters were good: samosa and Chicken Tikka. I ordered chicken korma and naan bread and my husband ordered the curry and rice pilau. The curry was ok, though some way too colld. The korma and pilau and naan bread was disgusting! They added to much sugar to all of the food. Nobody asked me if we enjoyed our meal so I write it here!

COTE is a chain of restaurants which do super meals for a super value. Go for their set meals 2 or 3 courses (3 course £13.95) up until 7pm so ideal for pre-theatre dinner/lunch. I normally go to the Covent Garden COTE but decided to try St Martins Lane as it was closer to where I was going. The COTE in St Martins Lane is ideally situated just a short walk from Leicester Square and Piccadilly circus. I had the 3 course set meal, a glass of wine and a coffee all for about £20.78 which actually included the discretionary tip which was about £2.80.

Went twice on a recent visit to london. Particularly like that they will fry in matzo meal which is really good for a crispy outside. Good selection of fish. Also had the grilled dover sole which yes was quite expensive but really good. Their desserts are a throw back - treacle tart and spotted dick with cream was rather scrumptious.i did try someone elses chips and was not hugely impressed but that is good as I don't really want to eat those anyway.Service was both friendly and efficient. The fish was very fresh and in huge portions. Had a great time on both occasions.

Truly enjoyed a magnificent meal at Rules. I chose the duck breast which was one of the top twenty meals of my life. The environment is a bit cramped but not uncomfortable. The service good and reasonably attentive. The true star of the show was the food. I look forward to a return trip at my next opportunity.

There are lots of places to eat in Covent Garden and we're really happy having chosen here. A lively place set inside the piazza (undercover and out of the rain) which allows you to enjoy the music, magicians and other entertainment whilst tucking into the best of British - at least that's what we had, Jamie's twist on fish and chips. Good quality, tasty and washed down with some ace British wine and beer. Whilst v. busy, the staff were good and the service quick. Worth the short wait in the queue.
The macaroni to start was delicious as well as the Bloody Caesar but we found the Sunday roast average enough. However the atmosphere was great and I will be back outside of Sunday lunch.
Great tapas in a relaxed atmosphere. The large prawn and the octopus were really amazing! In summer sitting outside is just perfect

We went here Aug 4th 2014. Could say a lot about the service but I think this little restaurant in a boat should have comments on their food and ambience.Quite simply great food starters, mains and sweets. Hiccup on service which was dealt with by a very competent member of staff who gave us a discount which was very appreciated.I would recommend this restaurant and bar to anyone and as we stated at the time we will return when next in London.Don't forget this is in easy walking distance from the South Bank and outshines any restaurant there.Thanks

Big portions, great for a value. Home made fresh prepared polish food. Much much better than "Mamuska" on the Elephant and Castle!I would like to recommend this restaurant to all people, you can have there really tasty, quite big and not expensive great meal! One minus is that is not too much space inside but that's doesn't matter :)

When we noticed this was a Jamie run restaurant we thought we couldn't go wrong. Ordered mushroom soup which was very nice. Thought we would try the special of the day - beer battered fish and chips and mushy peas, also ordered roasted beets with ricotta and seeds. The fish came in 4 small bits, the batter was light but the fish inside (the little there was of it) still had skin on so was just horrible and soggy. As for the roasted beets, someone opened a jar of pickled beetroot, put 2 on a plate, plus a spoon of ricotta type cheese and scattered some seeds on it, all for a fiver!!! I noticed that all the cakes were left uncovered and would be pretty dry but late afternoon. It is about time Jamie went down and had a look. Staff were nice but it did not feel like there was anyone in charge. Would not recommend.

Visited on the back of some good TA reviews and they were right...lovely, small and cozy restaurant. A group of us tried a variety of dishes and all were well executed and tasty. Wine list is also reasonably priced. Patrick played his 'Mein Host' role very well and was both attentive and amusing. Loved his quote..."how would you like your lamb, pink or overcooked...?..." Hilarious! Will visit again if in the area.

After loving Jamie's Italian I was really looking forward to experiencing Union Jacks. But, it was horrific. £15 for a glorified bit of pizza bread. Terrible. Food overall was thoroughly average - it's obvious this restaurant is on the tourist track and the staff must have gotten used to shoddy standards. If that wasn't bad enough, our waiter had such bad customer service skills. He was huffy when it tooks us more than 2 minutes to decided what we wanted, I could almost hear him huffing in the corner. Then after a discrepancy with the bill, he proceeded to raise his voice at me and generally be rather unpleasant. When I complained about him to the manageress, her retort was "well that's funny because he receives the most positive feedback out of all our staff here". Gee, how professional of you! No "sorry you feel this way" etc. Really terrible staff. Terrible service and terrible food. Avoid and choose a restaurant that treats you like a customer rather than a body at a cattlemarket.

My six friends and I went to the Itadaki Zen restaurant for a rare, special, meal out. What is not to love? The quaint decor, ideal location; not to mention the great selection of vegan foods to choose from. In fact the menu was like a vegan's wet dream...the whole reason we choose to go there in the first place. To our dismay, there was no wet dream; only the dampness of our tears, as we handed over our hard earned money.The waitress first took our drinks order. It was all going rather well to start with, despite the steep prices. To give you an idea, a Wyld Wood Cider cost us three times the recommended retail price in Itadaki Zen. I have never paid so much money for a bit of wood in all my life. Regardless though, we decided to enjoy ourselves and stop being such an Ebenezer Scrooges. Now for the menu...Most of us opted for the £28 Tempura meal because we were determined to leave bursting at seams and well and truly *satisfied*. The following pictures say it all really. Even a pigeon would have left hungry that night.The Tempura was bland and tasteless. It resembled something like a bowl of anemic 'snack a jacks' but without the seasoning. The tofu tasted like it was taken straight out of the dumpster and decorated with a few slithers of spring onions and peanuts, as an afterthought. The sushi was predominantly glutinous rice with a sorry excuse for a vegetable or two. Between seven of us, we used a whole bottle of soy sauce just to add some flavour to our meal. The worst part however, was the service. Our meals didn't arrive all at the same time; they came in dribs and drabs over the course of about two hours. A few of my friends had eaten their entire meal before the rest of us were given ours. Us vegans are hungry enough, without being starved and forced to watch our peers tuck into their dolly sized portions! We were fading away to practically nothing. I could understand it if the food was hot but it was cold, like the waitress' smile.I was looking forward to the pudding but yet again, it was tasteless and bland. I ate it in one mouthful. I paid £50 for my dinner that night, in total. Itadaki Zen? Never againzen!
Eat here quite often when we visit London. It's near a hotel we stay in. I am beginning to get tired of it although I don't have many negatives. It's just a bit routine if at least reliable
Fresh, imaginative, reliable food and quick service. Infinitely preferable to many airlines' fare so the airport branches are particularly to be recommeneded.
My son and I had a wonderful visit. So attentive and food was amazing. Menu available from the bold to the brave. The seafood mishmash?!? Was best mix ive had. Would recommend to anyone.

The food was really good, the staff were very nice. The deal i got with travelzoo was excellent and I was given a voucher for the same deal for 8 people to use on another visit. Excellent value for money!!

we happened to stumble across this restaurant as we were looking for somewhere for tea. It was tiny but waited to be seated in the porch area and staff were prompt to seat us but then did not come back for 20 mins to take any order for drinks or food. The food came it was good but then again we had to wait for the waitress to clear the table and bring the children's desserts included in the children's menu. We were in a rush and although some reviews have said they were rushed in this restaurant we were in there for an hour and a half! We had only had a main course and the children had had 2 courses.

Ate there for lunch in early August - good food, pleasant atmosphere, great service, good value considering the location. And having left my notebook there by mistake, they very kindly posted it back to my home address free of charge. 5 stars!

Bit disappointing. The food is good but they have taken away the really nice restaurant and made it into a place to just have a drink and some tables to dine. It used to be so nice as a restaurant. Lacks atmosphere!

It's a bit tourist but they do a pretty good job with the food. Nothing exceptional but overall pretty good. The beet salad was terrific. We took a chance on the pepper laden pizza and it was far too spicy for even a fairly accustomed taster. The staff was great...very friendly even for a busy place.

Staying nearby and ventured out for lunch.The service was excellent as was the food. I had the Thai Red Curry with Egg fried rice. My wife had the Chicken Katsu Curry and said it was the BEST Asian dish she has ever had! Would highly recommend.

I went there with a group of clients and everybody had a great time. The potted crab wasn't the presentation I expected, but was delicious. Two of the group had the double dipped chips and had to defend them by poking their forks. My hake was just what I wanted--tasty and filling, but I didn't have to be rolled out of the restaurant.
Extremely good bento boxes for take away, which I regularly take the eel. Never been at all disappointed.
Food was fab. Staff where fab.... I left my lipstick behind and a young chap ran down the road to give it to me! I was really impressed, would go back to this place... chicken was amazing!

My boyfriend and I visited this week on our trip to London and were extremely disappointed. We had a voucher deal that entitled us to two courses and a glass of fizz each. On arriveal we were fairly impressed with the decor on the boat (although slightly strange as the room is based on a mascara) the view was beautiful and we were shown to our table quickly. The food however was extremely disappointing and the service was too. I opted for the duck starter which was pretty pathetic in its portion size and extremely tough. My boyfriend went for the carrot soup which lacked any real flavour. His chicken main course was okay but once again very small and my fish although well cooked was accompanied by one Charlotte potato cut into 4 pieces. It became clear that the waiting staff were paying much more attention to the full price paying customers that those with a wowcher deal. We were not asked if we would like more drinks after our prosecco was finished and were left to sit for 15 minutes waiting for the bill. Thankfully we did not pay full price for this as it would've been a complete rip off!

Always enjoy a visit to GBK. Tasty good quality burgers cooked to order and with delicious millkshakes to drink. Recommend the new 'Don' burger on brioche bun, very yummy. It's a safe bet if you're meeting friends for lunch/dinner.

Absolutely fabulous trip to this restaurant. The food was fantastic and the cocktails were brilliant. Will definitely go back as we had a really pleasant evening for a friends birthday. Most of all our waiter Daniel was great! He really enjoyed his job and this really came across as he was attentive and charming. Even after we paid the bill he found out that it was my friend's birthday and he asked to wait and he came back with a birthday cake. Will definitely go back!
This franchise is everywhere and the pizza is very good. We got take away a couple times for the kids.

Stumbled upon this on our way back to hotel after an awful experience at Kolossi further down the road, so as a last resort decided to grab a bag of chips.However the friendly greeting tempted us to sit in.We were served by a lovely young man. Please, easing, helpful and happy. He was a breath of fresh air after our previous experience!Food was perfect. Fresh, well presented. And good value for money.Would highly recommend.

After my last experience of an Italian meal in Central London (at Fratelli La Bufala) I was a bit paranoid about visiting another one. Thankfully my fear of Italian restaurants in London was conquered after my amazing experience here.I decided to visit here with a friend and on entry the 2 cashiers greeted us and gave us our tabs without any problem. When I say 'tabs' they were cards given to use to order whatever we liked and pay for it on our way out which I thought was an excellent system.Once we found a place to sit we decided to take a look at the menu and ordered a couple of drinks along with a couple of pizzas. The pizza I ordered was the Tonno (that had tuna, onions and something else on it) and I thought it was excellent.Easily that the best pizza I had eaten in London and would most happily come here again. Also the pricing was very reasonable considering it is Central London. So basically what I am gonna say is if you want to eat Italian food in Central London, please go to Vapianos. Cause they are genuinely known for their good food and service and are not marketed in any way.

Stopped by while exploring Covent Garden. Great spot to sit and relax. Have a glass of wine, rest from shopping and watch the people. Great live entertainment by way of the street performers in the market. Even on a chilly February afternoon it was very lovely. Margarita pizza was awesome. Wine was as well. Outdoor dinning under the glass roofed market hall. Definitely recommend.
Very good and tasty breakfast with excellent service, especially from Iulia. All the best from Pia and Anders from Sweden.
We just love that place! The food is always fresh and delicious . The staff most of the time is nice but some of them a bit grumpy. Anyway we will be back there soon

I visited this restaurant with a good friend of mine for a treat. The staff appeared to be Korean and very very efficient and welcoming indeed. The small touches made this restaurant appealing to me. The wall mounted bells and Japanese art with sliding rear doors added to the atmosphere. The waitress was able to make good suggestions from the menu and the staff were all very friendly and welcoming indeed.

I'd say this hidden gem of a cafe is more of a bar - we visited on a Friday lunchtime and they weren't serving food, only cocktails, however the cocktails are AMAZING! There is a huge variety to choose from, new combinations and flavours ive never seen before, AND they are reasonably priced! It does however become very popular the later you go in the evening so visit earlier in the day if you want a more relaxing vibe and to be able to hear conversation!
Service was quick and to the point, the burgers were very good and the milkshakes were splendid. A place I will probably visit again :)

Visited the Savoy Grill on Thursday ahead of Dreamgirls.The pre theatre menu had a good choice and they offer a la carte alongside it too. The food was amazing, as were all the staff who spoke to us.The style is art deco and is just a beautiful atmosphere if dining with friends, family or as a couple.I'd recommed this restaraunt any day of the week and would happily return.
Overrated and overpriced sandwiches. Fillings too calorific and too 'fancy'.

We ate here early one evening. The fish and chips were all that you could want - crispy on the outside and hot on the inside. We had a pint, onion rings, mushy peas and the grilled veggies (courgettes, rerd pepper, mushrooms, eggplant and onions). Sides could serve. 1-2. Cost with service was about £25. Unlimited chips were available - don't know if this was a special or regular offer. Convenient to Marylebone Rail this has been my favorite stop for more than a dozen years. I have never been disappointed.

First time in any of this chain and I have to say it was a very limp experience. Warm white wine, shockingly awful lukewarm and spiceless beef massaman, standard 'out of freezer' dim sum (available at any Asian supermarket near you) and over sweet, lukewarm coconut rice. My friend's crispy chicken was.....flaccid and my other friend's chicken on top of her salad was so hard it bounced. To be scrupulously fair, the manageress changed the flaccid chicken without a murmur (and in fact she was the star of the place - professional, courteous, smiley, happy and charming) but to have complained about eveyrthing would have meant no dinner for any of use. I used the ladies whilst I was there - and was horrified at the state of the cubicle I went in which, given the low grade food experience we'd had, just summed the whole evening up. A real shame as I was excited to be 'out' for the night in the villagey atmosphere of Pimlico - just wish I'd gone to another restaurant.

The prix fixe at Cote is amazing value. If you love French food, you've probably already discovered this chain. For £15 - including tip - you get three courses of delicious food.It was late afternoon and my stomach was growling and my feet hurt. I stopped at St Martin's Lane and chose a window table, so I could read. The starter of mackerel rillettes - upmarket fish pate - was so tasty, I was tempted to use my finger to reach the last bits. But I was in public. I used the knife, delicately, to extract the last bit. It's served with a perfect bit of salad (superb dressing) and sourdough toast. And it looks pretty as the mackerel is served in a cute glass jar, next to the salad and the toast.For my main course, I chose the steak. It was gorgeous, cooked exactly medium-rare as I had requested and covered in a super sauce. It came with superb chips.Normally, I hate tiny chips. I like them - very occasionally - from the fish shop, big and full of flavour. But, in general, I don't much like potatoes. I will make an exception for Cote's frites. Just yummy. The creme caramel is the perfect treat. I have no idea why it taste's as good as any I have had in France, but it just ticks every "perfect pudding" box. (And this from a woman who normally discounts and dessert that doesn't include chocolate as being pointless).Service, from Fred, was wonderful. I felt attended to, but allowed to read, in peace.Lovely venue, lovely staff and lovely food at a lovely price. I left feeling pampered, well-fed and pleasantly full. I will be back there, as soon as I can.

We went in a large group, about 10 people. The restaurant is really nice, the setup is good and the environment is nice. The food was a bit salty but overall great, however, the service disappointing. They would forget our drinks and take a long time to bring our orders, which honestly ended up being a little annoying.

Birthday tea at Reform was a good choice .We loved the afternoon tea plus a very special passion fruit mimosa. Friendly and professional service, great food in smart surroundings - will definitely be back

I had to write a review as the food at Warda is fantastic. The nicest, tastiest grilled meats I have had locally. We dined here last week and also had a takeaway this evening and neither disappointed. The takeaway was as nice and plentiful as the restaurant food. Portions are big too so no need to order too many extras. The only reason I have given a 4 over a 5 was that the restaurant was pretty empty and lacked atmosphere the Saturday evening that we visited. It's a real shame , I hope it is usually busier, people need to go here, the food really is good. My new favourite local takeaway, I just hope they get enough visitors to remain open!

My husband and I ate here last night and I had got a deal through wowcher so we ate ÌÊ la carte.I had ham hock terrine which was delicious and my husband had carrot and coriander soup which he didn't like but he's a very fussy eater.For mains I had the haddock and home made chips which was really tasty and there was a lot, in fact I couldn't finish it! My husband had the steak which he said was the best he'd had for a while (and remember I said he was fussy). We both had the crumble which unfortunately was packed full of nuts to which I am allergic so neither of us could eat it! When the waiter saw we hadn't eaten it he offered us complimentary drinks but I was having a panic attack from nearly eating nuts and just wanted to go but I am aware this wasn't their fault I usually ask but didn't expect it in a crumble.While we were there the service was great and the atmosphere was very friendly and the view was fantastic, I just wish it had been a sunny day so that we could have gone onto the sun deck (also that there had been no nuts in my dessert!)

We went there on a windy evening for a dinner........The place is right in the middle of a complex with lot of street performers around and and and, a excellent menu to choose from. There are some very nice persons waiting the tables as well. Go for it.......

Myself and my boyfriend loved this place so much we went back 3 times on our 4 day trip! Food is delicious for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Staff are great and the atmosphere is amazing. It's a really fun place to be, you'll never get bored of looking around and finding the funny pictures and phrases on the walls! Make sure if you go at night that you ask about the Smeg fridge. Expensive but worth it.

The food and service were good but our table was awful. When we Arrived we were given the impression that the only table available for two was the one near the door...which turned out not to be true. This table was draughty, cold and most uncomfortable. We requested that the outside door was closed which made it a little better. We then requested to see the manager and suggested that there really should not be a table so close to the door....but he said that the people on this table acted as a windbreak for the rest of the restaurant!...we will be very reluctant to return to this restaurant

From the top deck of a stationery No.38 we saw a £12.50 menu advertised here and thought we'd rather be there than endlessly waiting on the bus in the jam.In the event the offer was no longer on offer but hey, we were comfortable now so lets have a main and a side from the menu.We're not familiar with thai food, I think we ordered a curry and noodlish dish each, but we all really enjoyed it. Inevitably there is an obligatory 12.5% surcharge on the bill so a casual 'bite' was more expensive than initially expected but not out of step with London prices. Perhaps we'll come back and explore the menu some more.Smart restaurant, good ambiance and polite staff.

This pub has recently had a makeover, which is bright and airy. Good selection of background music. TVs to watch sporting events etc, great dining facilities.Good selection of wines and drinks - unfortunately no longer sells draught Guinness.Good menu selection probably eaten all the mains on the menu therefore have ventured onto other pubs to try other dishes.One recommendation would be to rotate the menus more frequently. Friendly staff non-intrusive staff.

We have a family riddled with allergies and they were brilliant at TGIF after ordering the manager came out to speak to our teenager about his peanut/tree nut allergies and went through the list of what he wanted to order. He also took note of the babies allergies for dairy and milk, put us all at ease. Our teenager was even allowed to have dessert which is not possible at most places. BRILLIANT service and even went out of his way to bring the baby a Oreo biscuit which is one of the few she can have for her milk and egg allergy. WELL DONE GUYS!

Villa Bianca has to be one of the best family restaurants for miles around. It is not a pasta boiling and pizza spinning Italian restaurant. It is a real Italian restaurant will real home made Italian food and a Tiramisu to die for. Would visit again and again and again...

We took advantage of a sparkling wine and nibbles deal on groupon..expectations low...reality fabulous. The staff are first class, service super and the British nibbles really tasty. We ordered extra items as the menu tempted us, all well cooked and well presented.Really nice vibe in the bar and we will certainly return. This is my new London hidden gem.

Saturday night, fairly busy area and restaurant full, oddly two different couples left after sitting down and reading the menu without ordering as we looked at the menu.We had the pork gyoza (very salty) the salt and pepper squid (tasty but small portion), king prawn katsu (3 prawns) and the cucumber pickle (excellent) and a couple of beers.£30, service included.Nothing wrong about it, good atmosphere and it is the same sort of price anywhere in Soho really, but nothing that would make me want to go back there for more.

Overall I found this good value for money particularly in light of the location. It is pretty comfortable and relaxed even though it is in quite a dark downstairs space.I visited leading up to Xmas and there was a very boisterous table in, the staff managed to get them to mostly behave themselves so as not to impact on other diners which I was quite impressed by. The wine was very reasonably priced, the food was priced ok,and was of a simple uncomplicated satisfying style, but if you have a huge appetite it could easily become quite costly. I would rate overall 3.5 but in saying that I will no doubt return there as my office is nearby and it has been one of my more successful local dinners out. .
Not expensive Fast serviceGood foodNice staffSimple practical and efficient as we like. Also it has a very nice location (near Trafalgar square)

It was our first time in London, and I wanted to make the most of it by hitting some cool spots. After being extremely disappointed with Jamie Oliver's Fifteen we weren't sure what to expect from Berners.Upon entering, we were both blown away by the photo-worthy dining room. My husband started with the crab salad and I had the lamb breast Ò both outstanding. Our server (I believe his name was Stuart) recommended the pork chop (cooked perfectly with a nice bit of char) and the sea bass (also cooked perfectly with a nice crisp skin but the accompanying sauce was bit on the sweet side). We were thoroughly satisfied with our meal but were too full for dessert so we asked if we could move to the bar for some cocktails. Stuart was very accommodating and had us seated right away. He even came by later on to make sure were enjoying ourselves. My husband and I are always in search of a good cocktail. We had just gone to Milk & Honey and the Covent Garden Cocktail Club, both known for their cocktails. I can honestly say Berners is on par with both of those establishments. The drinks were great! We each had three cocktails from the bar menu and would have stayed for more if we didn't have a flight to Canada to catch the next morning.This dining experience was a great way to cap off a first time visit to an amazing city! If I were a local, I would definitely be a regular at Berners. I will definitely be back one day! Cheers!
if you are a romantic italian food passionated this is a corner wher to grab a piece of italy.easy to take away and fine taste.

An amazing dinning room, so beautiful, great atmosphere. Kir Royals to start, Fabulous beef, Jmazing starters. Fabulous food, & leave space for the desserts, all made in house by Roger. Flavours, combinations Presentation. How lucky, fortunate & spoilt are we. Def will be back Merci Thank you x

I went with a few friends on Monday evening, the food was delicious and healthy and supper nice an quick service and cheap (ish) I'd eat there everyday if I could :) lovely interior and fun feel. Good for friends or a date :)

Wonderful location. Had the oxtail and brisket pizza which was very nice. Also ordered coleslaw, which was also good.The mulled wine was good even though I thought it could be a little warmer. Will come back and try different things, but it is worth a visit if you«re in the area.

Once seated at our table there was a long wait order drinks and had to ask to see the food menu. Our mains came before our starters, we pointed out that mistake as they didnt notice and started to place the main meals on the table. One of the mains we ordered was a lobster, when it did arrive at the correct time it was chewy, presumably from being reheated while we eat our starters. There was no table service, we had to order from the bar to get a drink which took well over 10 minutes wait to get receive the drinks. Because of this poor service we did not pay the service charge of around £30, a waitress then came over to the table to query why the bill had not been paid in full; which by any stretch is nothing short of awful. The restaurant was shut down around us, lights turned and the bar closed around us, it was not late in terms of restaurant standards just past 11 o'clock. When we left the staff were very rude and did not reply when we said goodbye. We have had many take always from here and really enjoyed so it was very disappointing to have such a bad evening here, will NEVER return!

I have only ever been here for their oysters and their oyster happy hour, and my review is limited to that only. When my friend first recommended this restaurant a healthy jaunt from the Tube and Overground, I have to admit that I was skeptical. I am glad to say that it is well worth the trip for their wonderfully fresh oysters, especially at the unbeatable price of £1/oyster. The Richmond also has a good wine menu. What lets this place down a bit is the ambience, which is (extremely) dark to the point of being oppressive. I have often commented how a change in lighting and paint colour would really help the place out. I will also admit that there were two slight service missteps, which I hope they can correct. First, we were asked to take our pick of any table in the restaurant (it was totally empty), but then asked to move almost the moment we had unburdened ourselves of our jackets. Second, they miscounted the number of oysters. However, these errors were quickly corrected and the staff were warm and helpful otherwise. A great address to keep in mind for those evenings where you need some oysters to cheer you up.

I have been to Elliot's a number of times and every time the food is incredible! The constantly changing specials are great and the waiting staff always give good recommendations on which dishes to have and which wines have with them. The venue is small, but this gives the restaurant a great atmosphere.

Great food, great location, awful service. Let others push ahead in the queue, got shoulder-barged / nudged by the staff three times whilst walking to the bathroom and back, asked for "no toast" and still got the toast and then was made to look like I had made the mistake. A friend was finally curious about something on the bill and got an aggressive "errrrrr" in response. On the other hand, the food was great - not much egg in the scrambled egg but plenty of smoked salmon (which was pretty good quality to boot).

Very nice south indian / srilankan food. i think the new owners are doing a great job. Very nice and tasty food. nice ambience, but difficult to get a parking space and is not in a high street. So its nice and peaceful. I think this is one of the oldest south indian restaurant in Eastham
Something in my subconscious told me to go there for lunch.The food was surprisingly good - erotogenic perhaps?Honestly though a very nice meal with a great atmosphere.

Darwin is an absolute must go for anyone visitig (or liveing in) London.The food is fine, the wine list is fine, you are not coming here for the gourmet experience; you come here because you experience something like nowhere else, and the pricing is appropriate.Make sure you choose a bright day, you want blue sky and maybe a glorious sunset falling over the river Thames to the west!

Unable to fault cooking. Pity there were not more customers but it was a foul weather. Service attentive. Ambience is hotel chic but tables are far enough apart to make conversation easy. A cooking gem hidden in a somewhat overpowering hotel atmosphere.

Many might compete for title of the best "chippie," but Sea Shell gets better all the time. Their new policy is unlimited chips, and they are the best, although I could not finish even the first helping. The plaice was the best I have ever had anywhere. And the mushy peas were perfect. Reasonable price and good service. Every order of fish is cooked to order. Matza Meal is always available on request. Lots of places in London serve fish n'chips, but none are up to Sea Shell's standard.
The breakfast was excellent with loads of choice and well cooked produce. The only thing we didn't like was the Mojito which was in too tall a glass and too much ice so very little actual drink.

Visited here for lunch. It had two staff on duty but we had to fend for ourselves to find a table. We ordered and one it on the menus was a Chorizo pie which when it Arrived did not have apparent Chorizo meat inside and the manager explained that the Chorizo was ground down to form the ingredients. The chorizo taste wasnt apparent. The manager said the meals come prepared for heating so consider this pub grub as opposed to restaurant.Other food was Ok.

Very quiet on a Thursday lunch time & they seem to be pushing the set menu which we weren't really interested in.For us the beef & chicken sliders are undoubtedly the best thing. And the beef bimibap is also very good.Had a green ice dessert between us - which I actually loved - green tea ice cream, fruit, marshmallow - had a moreish junk food quality to it - which we really liked.We still like it - but on today's showing - it's days may be numbered - which doesn't reflect on it at all - tough market around here.

Gurkhas Diner is a pleasant place to eat; light and airy with clean crisp white tablecloths.The Nepalese cuisine would probably be enjoyed by those who like Indian or Asian food and makes a pleasant change.The dishes I have tried on a couple of visits have been mildly spicy without being absurdly hot, with interesting tastes and pleasing aromas. That being said, I can't quite stretch to an excellent rating in terms of the food quality; I felt that some of the ingredients like meats could have been of higher quality. Perhaps I was just less lucky than other reviewers.On one occasion we visited as a couple and were asked to change table to accomodate a larger party, which wasn't especially well managed and slightly marred the overall experience.Overall though, definitely worth a visit.

I found myself craving for Wiener Schnitzel ( a classic Austrian veal dish), Strudels and Wurtschen (sausages) so I checked out this place along Marylebone High Street called Fischers. The place looks promising with well presented interior. For starter, a complimentary bread was served - sourdough and rye and caraway seeds with paprika butter. I enjoyed more the sourdough bread bec of the quality of the crust - it was crisp while the quality of the crumb was very tender and good flavor. The other one was rather bland. Paprika butter didnt taste anything. My Schnitzel was ok. It was a bit dry. But the apple and cinnamon with vanilla sauce was unerring! Costumer service is definitely unrivealled.

After a second visit to the Park Terrace. [The first being a year ago!] It has maintained the same excellent standard. Lunch was excellent with a good menu choice. The restaurant was quiet other than a pianist playing listenable music. When looking for a venue to entertain friends or just to dine alone. This is the place to visit.

When heading to the Theater in the West End, I love stopping here to get a quick but delicious meal. Their small fish and rice pockets wrapped in seaweed are inventive and absolutely delicious. I keep trying different choices and specials and have never gone wrong. Service is prompt and friendly just as you need it to get to the show.

I booked this for the evening of the queens jubilee flotilla, we had an amazing day in London and our meal in Strada completed a fantastic day.The restaurant was packed, everyone had booked.I must admit bearing in mind the amount of people my expectations wasnt to high. I was proved wrong, the service was excellent, a very efficient waitress and the food was hot, fresh and well cooked. A very good meal all four of us had different meals and we all enjoyed them.No hesitations in returning.

Four of us were on a three day trip exploring London and one day looking for an inexpensive place for lunch. Walking by yet another PrÌ»t a Manger, we decided to check it out. They are located all over London in many shapes and sizes so they must be good, right? Plus a rain shower was passing over, so why not.PrÌ»t a Manger is French for "Ready to eat".... how clever is that? ive seen them in Paris, but not nearly as many as London. Seriously, in London they are everywhere, like Starbucks in Seattle. They offer a large variety of fresh salads, sandwiches, soups, desserts and sides all packaged for take away. On appearance alone, the prepared foods looked fresh and yummy. Faced with so many fresh choices, we took way too long perusing the selections. Im sure we stood out as confused and wet tourists rather than the four complexly simple guys with discerning palates, that we really are. Clearly, PrÌ»t a Manger has a large loyal following eagerly focused to get in, grab and get out. Its so easy to grab the goods for a takeaway or to eat there. We enjoyed the food as it was fresh, tasty and priced right for our budget. Perfect, since Americans take a big hit on the currency exchange rate for the British Pound. After returning home, I did some research and loved their concept: All PrÌ»t's food is prepared daily from fresh ingredients, right there in their very own kitchen. Whatever remains at the end of the day is donated to food charities. Early the next morning, they start all over again making fresh food for the day. Although the largest concentration of locations is in London, more can be found in other European cities. I was surprised to learn they are also located in Chicago, New York City and Washington DC. Who knew! Im anxious to try the American version to see if its as good as it was in London.

We discovered The White Hart during a weekend in London a few years ago. Now whenever we are in London we always make time to go there. The staff are friendly, the pub grub tasty and the atmosphere great!

We recently visited this restaurant after a wine tasting at nearby Vinopolis, looking for a substantial meal of quality straightforward food. I had been to the Piccadilly Gaucho twice before but this was the first visit to the Tower Bridge branch.We were very pleased with our choice - the service was excellent from the moment we entered the establishment, and waiters and waitresses were very attentive and efficient. Needless to say, the steaks were really excellent, absolutely delicious, and the accompaniments matched the quality and taste of the steaks.A very enjoyable meal, enhanced further by the view of Tower Bridge in all its glory.
Great fish and chips and hamburgers, had luch with some friends and it was awesome! The place is perfectly decorated and just few minutes from Covent Garden.

My wife and I popped in here for a glass of beer and a sandwich the other day and found it quite pleasant and charming too.The staff were friendly and the prices were fare.Would certainly call in again when in London.

We generally like pizza express. But this episode was not one of the best. After being seated (in a cramped location) the initial service to get drinks was slow, very slow (and the restaurant was not busy). The starters were good and my pizza was good but my wife's base was underdone and barely edible The wait for the bill was way too long as well.

Wanting a light lunch in-store I decided, on looking at the menu outside, that this was the place to order a main course salad. The radicchio, beetroot & mozzarella version was beautifully prepared & arranged from really fresh ingredients & was enough "food". It was also delicious. Dress it yourself from the nice condiments offered. Americano came with its hot milk in a baby jug - refined! A seasonal 20% offer made this super value and it was all very friendly and competent.

30 anniversary diner, that did not disappoint , in fact the best meal this year , warm welcome and taken to a fantastic table , water and bread brought to the table, food oh my god , I cant rate this high enough, starters 1/2 dozen oysters superb . and a shellfish platter (huge and I mean huge ) this had everything with a shell , everything , fantastic , mains one lobster thermidor & one monk fish again both excellent , in fact best monk fish ive ever had, deserts chocolate velvet & a crÌ¬me brulee again spot on, great wine great coffee , some of the best fish and freshest ive tasted in years, wonderful service throughout , cant rate this meal or restaurant high enough, a fantastic eating experience . many many thanks

We visited Union Jack's for lunch during a trip to London. Food was different from the usual menu when you are looking for somewhere to go for lunch on holiday. Good atmosphere and the food was very fresh and tasty. Great location too.

Wonderful meal - smoked haddock soup / potted shrimp to start, beef cheek / plaice&mussels for mains, and a shared baked alaska - flambeed with rum and served with hot chocolate sauce - for dessert. All excellent, but the beef cheek will live in the memory - just a gorgeously tender, flavoursome cut.The ambience is great - although the window seats are a little cool on a mid-November evening. Service very professional - we had a wonderful waiter who took time to explain about the dishes, how the beef cheek was cooked, and had a good chat about game (he makes his own boar sauasage - a man with a passion for food).With a glass of champagne and an excellent pint of London Pride in a tankard to start, wine and coffee approx £65 / head incl. service. As an out of towner (actually live closer to their game estate in the pennines), I'd definitely go back. Was looking forward to it and not disappointed.

First visit to Cote and I was delighted I had made the choice!We had a fantastic evening meal a few weeks ago to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The food and service was 5 star. We had a wonderful time and were presented with a free glass of bubbles!The food was of the highest quality, I had the roast belly of pork while the wife had the chicken. Both cooked and seasoned very well along with well seasoned sides. Only wished I had the rack of lamb - it looked AMAZING!!!!We will visit again - Top notch food, 3 courses, drinks and service for under £70. Well worth every penny!

Headed here last week with a group of 6 of us. The restaurant seemed relatively quiet initially and we were really pleased to be slotted in without a reservation. Very helpful staff to order our food (4 children and 2 adults) so we went for the set menus. The children were given a nice booklet with colours to keep them busy. Starter was very prompt but after that the experience went down hill unfortunately.The restaurant quickly filled and I think there were just not enough staff. We waited over an hour for our main meal and had to ask staff to check when we seemed to wait for so long. When it did arrive, 1 of the meals was wrong so had to taken back. There was no apology for delay. No-one came to serve our table at all, we had to ask each time for service. The bill was also wrong so had to have that amended.The food itself was okay, risotto was disappointing, just luke warm, but everything else was eaten well by the rest of the group. Overall, the staff were pleasant enough but certainly think our experience would have been far better had there been more staff.

Happiness Forgets is an amazing cocktail bar with a great atmosphere and great drinks, with a great location in Hoxton Square. Lovely place to go for drinks with friends and great place to take a date

My dad and I were on vacation in London and decided to try this place out. That was a year ago, and Tangia is one of the top things we remember from our trip. The food- lamb tangier and seafood tagine- was so flavorful and uniquely presented. It's a must-go. The restaurant itself has a moroccan vibe for sure, with a sophisticated appeal.

We have just spent a night here and the stay was faultless; our room was excellent, the location was so central, and the breakfast was great! The staff could not have been more accommodating. We shall definitely be going there again.

My husband and I are regulars of this quaint Italian restaurant tucked away on Boundary road but I had to write another review.I cannot say enough about the fresh, perfectly prepared dishes here. There is always a wonderful soup of the day and my all time favorite is the linguine with lobster. My husband always enjoys the bresaola salad and the pasta with walnut pesto.Besides the wonderful dishes, the service is excellent-- you will not find better service anywhere in London. The owner is exceptionally warm and welcoming and you feel like there isn't anything they wouldn't do for you.Highly recommend making a trip!

Not only the food was outstanding but also the service in the restaurant is world class. We were greeted very kindly and taken care of as VIP guests:) Before staring the orders you enjoy fresh bread (hot and crispy) with olives and your meals are accompanied by extras like homemade french fries or spinach and potatoes that are a compliment from the chief. I would definitely return again on my next visit to London.

Very friendly staff. Simple menu and very authentic dishes. Ordered a banana button and Char Kway Teow. Both were, i would say average. The banana button would be better if there were more real bananas instead of banana extract. The Char Kway Teow was not bad at first but the oiliness became a put off and we were struggling to finish it off.
We had an amazing time at this chic pub hosting live music, DJs and comedy nights. Show was fantabulous!

Booked this hotel on a whim but what a pleasant surpriseits location is great for all Greenwich sights . The room was great. Best shower I have ever had and really comfy bedcontinental breakfast was again the best ive had lovely spread and when booking a hotel and they ask any special requests i added soya milk I never get it but here I did yey You can have cooked food if you request it but that's extra . They have an outside area front and back staff really friendlynight staff really nice William especially food here is great and very reasonabledefinately returning

We came here for dinner at the end of a day in London. We waited about 15 minutes to be seated and when we got there the room was about 20% full. The waiter was attentive but spoke very poor English. The fact room was 20% full meant there was the atmosphere was flat. Only great thing was the signs to tell the waiter you were ready to order or wanted something else - that really worked.

It was a lovely setting and the atmosphere was super. We were a large party celebrating a big birthday and had chosen Dandelyn as an alternative "Tea" experience. I really do think though that spending close to a £1000 should have ensured a lot more than the very LIte food experience. I was terribly disappointed with the meagre food portions, and do think that the management should rework the menu. The cocktails were great and had I known that the food would be so insubstantial, I would have warned our guests to breakfast heavily beforehand. Also, do check your bill. I was charged for an extra person and although this was corrected, ive now realised that they've still overcharged even with the correction. Although the staff were lovely and nothing was too much trouble, perhaps a notepad for writing down orders would help, particularly with a big party to serve!

I had the roasted cauliflower and the suckling pig. Exquisite. My husband had the lamb-also out of this world. The mushroom ice cream closed the deal beautifully. The service was excellent, the waiter very knowledgable of his menu and wines. Very friendly.Make a reservation.Worth. Every. Penny.
I love the quality of their pizzas. It is a safe bet if you are struggling to choose where to get your pizza but for the best pizza in London go to homeslice.
good food and attentive service.If you have a problem, they work hard to resolve.Nice environment and atmosphere.
We stumbled upon tis little gem almost by accident, as it's kind of hidden. The fish is fresh every day and the batter on my piece of haddock was just about the best ive tasted. Worth a visit.
This restaurant was a very good discovery during my short stay in Shepherd Bush. We ate there twice. Price and taste are reasonable.

Had the salmon teriyaki bento. For under £9, you get tasty hot food (a bowl of rice, 2 pieces of grilled salmon and some salad). Passable but not authentic Japanese fare. I suppose by London standards, it is good value for money because the outlet on High Street Kensington is always packed when I walk past it every day for a week during my stay in London.

I was quite excited at the prospect of a take-away pan Asian restaurant so close by. We ordered a comprehensive meal and felt it was reasonable and the portions a good size. However, both myself and my partner were up all night with a thirst that could not be slaked .... mmm - I wonder if this was excessive salt or MSG? I thought it was msg because of the characteristic feelings in the face and head, although they denied any culpability. Because of their denial, we were brave enough to order again - this time different items, and once again we experienced this problem, although not quite so severe, enough to put us off for good. Shame - one day there will be a local Asian worth visiting or getting take-away from!
I liked most the fish because I love eating fish. But also the service was extremely nice. Nothing to complain about.

A friendly 'front of house' greeted us and ran through the various options and sharing plates - all explained very well and service was good. The food was ok, quite tasty but not brilliant and perhaps because I was comparing it to a recent visit to Italy where dishes of this nature were exceptional. We had Arancini, Chicken Liver Crostini, Classic and Lamb Meatballs, Zucchini Salad and Pork Belly. We sat outside as the weather was warm - outside dining on the pavement was a little cramped and uncomforatble and rubbish left in the gutter was not appealing (perhaps not the fault of the restaurant). I would go back but not in a hurry.

This pub is in a very old building on a corner of two roads, and the corner of the pub is made of large windows which create a lovely light and warm seating area. There are plenty of seats in the pub as it is, and the restaurant area sells good quality food, albeit at slightly high prices (for the area). They have a good selection of wines to choose from, as well as fairly standard beers, ciders, etc. Although they do have some speciality beers on tab which change occasionally.

Okay so this restaurant is in London's Soho, and not Tokyo; but you won't know the difference. Saw a review in PR Week and tried the restaurant out yesterday. It's all its cracked up to be and more. The Tokyo Ramen was excellent and my wife said 'it melted on her tongue'. No reservations are taken but space will always be made available and the staff were really polite and helpful. Good wine list and great local and Japanese beers but we stuck to the o-cha. And we didn't break the bank, too boot. Yes, we'll be going backj. Can there be nay other better recommendation?

Went with friends and lovely the up beat vibe and funky setting. Cool bar area and darker restaurant, maybe a little too dim. Service was fab and the guy who saw to our table was happy to recommend some dishes to go after our first round.Food is incredibly tasty and the portions are quite expensive but it's worth it for a fun night out, good music, food and wine.

Just got a portion of chips in a small container near enough thrown at me and when one fell on the counter rude women behind the counter picked it up with her hands and put it back on my portion bad! Chips I think were yesterday's at £2 expected more also £7.40 for a tiny piece of cod is disgusting, definitely give this chip shop a miss never going back there again.
Was doing some shopping with few of friends and stopped by for a steak i had sirloin medium, it was tender happy overall fair price, definitely would visit again for other steaks off the menu

We went as a party of 7 on a busy Friday. First off, the acoustics seem designed for volume. The space is large & open & the volume reverberates. So, not for people who want a quiet romantic dinner. The service was friendly and laid back, at times a bit slow. The food was good, but not amazing. A bit of a trade on the Gordon Ramsay name. Still, we had fun time.
Quality pre-packaged sandwiches, salads, soups and organic coffee. They are everywhere in London, train stations, airport. Eat there or take away.
Outstanding food. Going back ASAP. Had gyoza, steamed sea bass, black cod (as good as Nobu's), steamed crab dumpling things, tempura. Get in there!!
Need a Malaysian to bring you there. Good authentic Malay food for canteen price, "eat and go"

We stopped here for brunch, I had the 'All Day Brunch' as I love American Style breakfasts and this was probably as close as ive got to the real thing. Home fries, pancakes, the choice of what bread you want and how you want your eggs cooked. Win!

I had Fattet moussaka which is a baked aubergine dish with lashings of warm yogourt and tahini sauce topped off with pomegranate seeds - delicious. Partner's chicken wrap a little dry but still yummy. The decor is fun - bright and stylish - prices reasonable and service good
Adjoining the Sackler gallery in Hyde Park...Forget the gallery! This is the place to head for. Lovely building with equally lovely staff and lovely food.
I will definitely visit the Fox and Anchor again. Food brilliant, ambience nice and staff just so helpful and friendly.

Makan's has so much choice. It has food ready prepared for those who want a quick plate. You can also order off the menu, which I always do as it is then freshly cooked. I love the chicken satay, roti canai and noodle dishes. Everything is so tasty. Makan's is in the heart of Portobello Road so is ideal for a quick lunch break if you make a trip to the market.
Good food, served fast. Not too spicy but very tasty. Friendly staff and good portion size. Handy for the Westfield Centre

I have seen a book with delicious receipts from Otto Lenghi and finally found his restaurant in Soho. The plates are different from everywhere with a good selection of salads and small portion plates good for sharing.

Who would have thought that you could get fast sushi that was fresh??? Love this concept. You choose from ready made boxes or make your own. Lots of selection. The lines move fast. You can also order hit food as well. The downfall is limited seating! I sat at a table a man had just left then invited a young man to sit with me as there was no more room. If you don't mind sitting with a stranger it could be fun!
Really tasty authentic Italian food even the staff..really feels like a slice of authentic Italy...Food is fresh, tasty and generous..will definately come again

I chose Strada on my last night in London mainly because it was right next to my hotel. How I wish I had gone earlier in my visit so I could have gone back to try more of their wonderful dishes.I only had one dish, the Orecchiette Pugliese with Luganega Sausage, Pancetta, Broccolini, and Chilies. It was fantastic! Not too spicy, but definitely not bland...and a good amount of lovely garlic. I also like that it wasn't swimming in sauce. The flavors and textures of the ingredients complimented each other perfectly. I did spy a pizza being delivered to another table and it looked delicious. The service was excellent, too, with helpful, friendly, and professional staff and the food Arrived promptly. If you're going to be near St Katherine's Way (near the Tower of London), give Strada a try...you won't be disappointed.

I went for dinner tonight with my girlfriend at Chez Patrick. We have been very pleased, and we will be coming back. The food is excellent, a special mention to the snails in garlic butter, the prawns and the chateaubriand, that we had this time. The service is very good as well, Patrick is a most urbane gentleman. A pleasure through and through !

After reading reviews booked a table for early supper on Saturday evening - greeted with a smile and service was good to a point. We were not offered steak that seemed to be offered to the table next to ours however we ordered the mutton chops - shan't be eating these again. Little meat, very fatty and tough and weird sauce to accompany. The portion of triple cook chips was very small nor was it suggested to have vegetables. The desserts we were hopeful but it was deconstructed puds normally for Michelin star restuarants and it was not nice banana and walnut cake?!! Very small and not nice at all. The wine was okay - English sparkling wine. £100 for two little steep but it was London shan't return.

Lunch at Carlucci's should be a positive experience - the brand is good and the food is usually of the same high standard. I ordered a goats cheese and beetroot salad (nearly £10) and it was absolutely dire. The plate was almost entirely composed of green leaves of the worst kind of lettuce, four thin slices of beetroot and a one ring of a hard cold goats cheese. There were no beetroot pieces in the salad and the whole thing looked a tasteless, thoughtless mess. The chef obviously has no idea how to present or make a decent meal out of fresh simple ingredients. It was truly awful. Nice waiter did not make up for such a poor experience.

A couple of friends and I went here after arriveing in London for some business. We had just had dinner in a restaurant and this was the only place open where we could get a nightcap. We also thought it would be good to get some shisha, since I had never tried it, and it seemed everyone else there was doing it. The wine and shisha Arrived and although the wine was pretty run-of-the-mill, we were having a good time - until the bill came... £22 each for the shisha pipes! And when they were brought out, they didn't give us hygienic mouthpieces, so we had to ask specifically for them. These apparently cost £3.50 each!! They didn't show us a menu when we first Arrived and they didn't tell us how much the mouthpieces would cost (something they should provide anyway, if they don't want to be shut down for hygiene violations!). Then, when challenged about the price, the manager told us that we'd run the risk of it being so expensive (so it was our fault we'd been ripped off!!) and that we shouldn't come back there again! Absolutely gobsmacked! We were looking forward to a nice evening, but were sorely disappointed and quite seriously offended. Do NOT go here, for shisha or for anything!

Spent a few hours at this pub in an evening, and have to say quite enjoyed it. Had a DJ in playing a mix of new and old classics. decent clientele and even the door man was strutting his stuff to the old motown classics! Didn't eat, but looked nice!

If, like me, you are not too keen on queuing for food in the Great Court of the British Museum, you will be relieved to find the Gallery Cafe. You will probably be feeling quite triumphant, too, because finding the route is by no means easy - the most obvious way is presently blocked off. But having negotiated highways and byways of Greece and Egypt, you will arrive in a far corner of the ground floor at an oasis of calm where you may enjoy delicious soup (mushroom, last Sunday) and sandwiches (hot smoked salmon and avocado on rye, for instance) before heading off once more in earnest pursuit of art and culture.

I went on the Hispaniola restaurant today with my friend. The welcome and service was excellent.We had the smoked salmon starter fantastic, Fish, chips and minted mashy pies, delicious.the fruit crumble was delicious too. We had a white German wine.We came away very satisfied and happy. The views from the Hispaniola included the London Eye, Big Ben and it was very pleasant watching the other cruise boats going along the river, the trains from the bridge close by and the London Buses.My Sister also went for a meal last week with her young niece, they had steak, enjoyed everything and the little girl now "wants to travel the world".. x
We spent Xmas day here last year. Also some friends had a 60 wedding anniversary here in a priveate room in May. The food,at isotherm,impeccable service makes the Ritz a very special place.

I have been going to this restaurant for 18 years and it never fails to be one of the best eating experiences in London. Despite all the change happening around it, in this fast moving city, it remains true to the traditions of west Africa and the food, warmth, hospitality, good humour and service are really very hard to beat. I cannot recommend it too highly.

My first visit here with 5 friends. We all had burgers, each one of us having specific requirements.. No salad.. Only onion etc but each meal was delivered 100% on spec and all plates were clear of food within minutes!! Delicious. Washed down with a cocktail wish was also very tasty .Staff friendly and attentive, atmosphere relaxed and comfortable. Will definitely go back when next in the area.

I made this chain my food and coffee place while in London, the sandwiches are good and inspired, the combinations are very different, but work perfectly, sveral options of cold and hot food, good salads and excelent price for the quality offered. The coffee is also good, not so many options available, but good ones, I am addicted to the Hazelnut latte! The service is good, it is easier that you can help yourself and pay for most f the items, it is fast and easy.The free wi-fi is a bonus in a good place like this.
We reserved a table and took clients here for drinks after work. Some great cocktails, table service, good beers/wines, happy hour and good atmosphere.

Great location, really close to Farringdon Station. The room was a great size and beautifully decorated. At times it was quite noisy outside, but that's just London.The bar food was nice, with quick service. Really helpful staff and nice atmosphere.

Andy Hayler (Food Critic) had given the venue a 15/20 score which for a restaurant without a michelin star is high praise indeed. Quote "The food here is better than many lauded central London restaurants, and is a bargain to boot". The meal was for my wife's birthday. Staff were helpful and attentive, the atmosphere is trendy local but sorry the food was quite average and we were a bit disappointed. Sorry.
Drop by, try the cuisine and make up your own mind. The only downside is the queues to pay. The atmosphere is imperialistic.

Jamie's Union Jacks provided us with a perfect restaurant experience after a few lousy ones in and around Covent Garden. At first the queue outside Union Jack's looked like we'd never fit in this time, but we were shown to a table in 5 minutes! Even if the tables are really close to each other, the atmosphere is really relaxed and friendly. Looking from the outside you might imagine the glass-walled terraced restaurant to be awfully noisy, but it's actually a wonderful oasis where you get to drink in the different performances taking place in the North Hall while you lunch/dine and do some people watching. Drinks were brought to table really fast even though the place was brimming with customers and the waiter knew the dishes and their ingredients by heart, just as you'd expect. The homemade cloudy lemonade at UJ is simply diveine, a perfect refreshing drink! The Empire-spiced chicken will forever be a dish I'll compare all other chicken dishes at restaurants - it's plate-licking good! The pizzas are fabulous, simple but sinfully tasty. No matter how stuffed you feel, share a dessert if you can't manage one by yourself, they are diveine. I cannot praise the rhubarb & custard pavlova enough, it's a piece of heaven for a rhubarb-lover! And, it's also one of the most generously sized desserts ive come across with. There's absolutely nothing I could complain about Union Jacks and can't wait for my next meal there! Special thanks to the short Italian waiter who made us feel like we were the only customers in the restaurant, even if he was rushed off his feet! Grazie mille!

Dropped in here to have breakfast before a meeting in Gresham Street.Ordered the Anthologist fully loaded breakfast with two fried eggs.It Arrived in a pretentious frying pan.The sausage was OK, as was the mushroom, tomato and black pudding. Toast was fair, but the two fried eggs were dreadful, dried up, curling and brown at the edges, very flat, tiny eggs. They must therefore have been old.The so called sweet cured bacon was one tiny piece of streaky bacon, about 2 inches long and, in reality, just one bite.For £8.95 this was not good enough.I could not help noticing, and overhearing my neighbour complaining about his poached eggs being overcooked and asking for replacements, which to be fair did come. I would have done the same but was short of time. In any case, why should one have to do this.The decor was good and it is a pleasant place to have a meal and the service was attentive. The cooking facilities were all there but not used to any great effect.Will not go again.

Took 16 family members for a celebration dinner. Guess what? Every single one of them will be coming back!!Quality of food is genuinely so very good. My fiance would eat here every single day as he always says "you are not getting better lamb anywhere else!".Eating here is a treat in comparison with other local eateries who charge central London prices for bland plates of food and equally lame service.Excellent menu and wonderful staff.
Tried several branches and different bento (Katsu , Katsu curry, tofu...) and the rice ratio vs the actual meat (or tofu or veggie) is ridicously high !

Where to start. The beef in the beef satay was tough as boots, the satay had an inch of oil over the actual satay. Vegetable rolls had no vegetables, just old pastry deep fried. Next the chicken and cashew nuts, horrible. Chicken was tough, and the tasted like the chicken had been sitting out for a while. Seafood noodles - what seafood, bits of rubber. Food not hot, lacked taste and when I told the waitress she just laughed. Don't waste your money at this place
