The downstairs pub is a local of some character in this little known area somewhat off the normal tourist track. This encouraged me to book a table for lunch in the upstairs dining room for a small party of friends. The upstairs room is bright and welcoming but we were off to a bad start in finding that our booking had somehow been logged for the day earlier than our visit. However, this was quickly resolved as there were only two other tables occupied and we were soon shown to our table. The menu prices are cheap for central London and consists of classic pub favourites. Things did not improve when we were told that the only draft beer available was the premium bitter, in spite of the fact that the menu was offering at least three options. Two of us ordered chicken and ham pies, the others steak and kidney puddings but the latter were delivered to table as steak pies. The fillings of all pies were tasty but the pastry was challenging to eat to say the least. Pastry does not re-heat well in a microwave. The only bright spot was the nicely cooked side dishes of chips and fresh seasonal vegetables, curiously something on which so many other establishments fail. Finally, a full 30 minutes before the restaurant was to close at 3pm, to follow our meal we ordered coffee only to be told this was not possible as they had no milk or sugar! As none of us take milk or sugar we did manage to coax our coffees out of our waitress.One almost had the impression that our presence here was a bit of an inconvenience; maybe eating in the downstairs bar would have been a better experience.On the basis of our visit I feel that I am being generous in giveing The Yorkshire Grey an Average rating, but reading others' comments maybe we just caught them on a bad day.
As always, Rules delivers great food and service in traditional surroundings. My recent visit was my 3rd time at Rules with the same colleagues and we all agreed how great it still is!
even if you don«t like fish, you«ll like it.. go for it if you want to try good fish and chips, I loved it

I went a couple of weeks ago with my wife and daughter to celebrate her birthday at 8 p.m. Can't fault the place. When booking, my wife asked for a window seat. A few hours before the meal, Gauchos called my wife and asked if she was definitely going - to which she replied 'yes'. And on arriveal the place was very busy, but we were taken upstairs and placed with a terrific view of Tower Bridge - so they had obviously taken the trouble to seat us with a view and then called to ensure it wasn't wasted! So when you book, ask for a window set upstairs and you won't be disappointed. Service throughout was excellent. We aren't foodies - I drink real ale and like burgers and my wife likes a glass of Pinot, so I stuck to the beer - but our waiter made a real effort to point out a decent - relatively - cheaply priced wine for my wife and daughter and then showed us and explained the various cuts of beef that were for sale and even suggested how we might like them cooked. I appreciated that and followed his advice and had a very, very good cut of beef. My wife had the burger and my daughter the sea bass with thin and chunky fries between us. We all thouroughly enjoyed the meal. One tip is that the thin fries are like chips in a chippie and the chunky fries are more like roast potatoes - and they're all very, very good, but we all preferred the thin fries! - and you get a lot! Prices weren't too bad for a place like this and service was very, very good without being too obvious. I recommend this place without reservation.

We booked a table for 6pm on Saturday night, since we were going to the Adelphi Theatre right across the road for a 7:30pm show. The restaurant has a very large downstairs area, which was not full when we Arrived - they didn't seem to even check that we had a reservation. We sat down at around 6:05pm and were done by 6:40pm! The food Arrived so quickly, and was delicious. I had the salmon, and asked to have it with roast mediterranean vegetables instead of the standard accompaniments, which was done with no issues. My companions both had the Pollo Siciliana, which they said was excellent.

The decor was very appealing as to was the atmosphere and greeting so decided to try this restaurant.Noticed that the prices were on the steeper side then the rest of the surrounding restaurants but thought it would be due to the size of the portions and the quality of the ingredients. There was the four of us - so ordered 4 starters, 2 jasmine teas and 2 cocktails. The 2 prawns in the Satay was very over cooked but the chicken was good, the 5 pork/prawn dumplings was very small and mushy with the caviar not being caviar but tasted of lumpfish roe. The Chicken Tom Kha soup tasted good but all the chicken breast was very overcooked so had a very dry texture.Cocktails were good - but the Jasmine tea was very bitter most likely due to not using correct temp water for brew.We didn't complain as we decided we were there to enjoy each others company as we hadn't seen each other (friends) for over 18 months - so food was secondary.For mains we ordered : Lemon Seabass - just a minute or so overcooked, good flavours but for £20.50 + 12.5% service was the smallest single fillet I have ever seen!Kieaw Wan Lobster : Was served very undercooked and even raw on the thicker piece....tho it was only one very small tail approx 200grams max in total so for £28 + 12.5% service wasn't very pleased.Chicken Kieaw Wan - again chicken breast was very dry.Prawn Pad Thai - was very good, beautiful flavoured noodle but only 2 grilled prawns that were over cooked and priced at £19.80 + service........All in all - we did have a good time in each others company, but the chef must have had a really bad day even tho the restaurant was half full - He forgot his timing and his flavours as there was completely no warm spicy heat in any of the curry dishes.Ended with one cup of coffee and one Mangoand sweet rice desert which was very good - finished off with a bottle of Founders Pinotage £22......The end bill being £240 for the four of us was on the steep side as we were all still very hungry which was fine as we made a short trip to chinatown for some dumplings. So had a good time in each others company - the service provided by the waitress was great so didn't mind the service charge....but not a value for money restaurant and had I visited with other friends I would of most likely complained.

Went for afternoon tea using Tesco 2 for 1 vouchers ( full price was £37 I believe ). The setting is just adjacent to a railway bridge over the Thames - so if your sitting on the deck be aware of trains going by. The service was good and the cakes were certainly plentiful and large ! We wasn't rushed (sometimes you are 'pushed' along at some venues when using discount vouchers). Not sure i would value it so highly at full price though

Perfect for a girly afternoon, we came here before a shopping trip, this hotel lobby is very glam and you feel very special dining here as soon as you walk in it has the wow factor, would love to return, only down side is the staff we did not find particularly helpful, which did let it down.

Had chicken katsu curry in Finsbury Pavement branch in city of London. Long day at work just needed a good value fulfilling meal. Did just that. The hot chilli chicken is good as well and certainly has a kick. Yummy!!!

What a wonderful treat to return to this quintessential English restaurant after more than 40 years and find that everything about the place is as good if not better than memory serves. While other famous restaurants have sadly deteriorated or disappeared, Rules remained at the pinnacle of truly English cuisine. The ambiance takes you back to a time that you now only see on BBC miniseries! We only wish we had more time to examine the fascinating pictures and the other decor of the restaurant but for this, we will have to hurry back.We turned up 1 1/2 hours before our allotted reservation on a Saturday night, and the maitre d': Mr. Ricky McMenemy, couldn't have been more accommodating and had us at our table within 10 minutes. Our only regret was that that meant we could not take advantage of the wonderful upstairs bar but that should not be missed. One goes to a restaurant to eat and in our case we ordered the roast beef for two which came perfectly cooked and with two of the largest and most delicious Yorkshire puddings. My first course, was a delicious home-made tomato soup, all of which I would recommend.We certainly will not wait another 40 years before returning to this wonderful landmark.

As with the Cote brand you know what to expect. We had lunch - the set menu and we were not disappointed. A three course delightful lunch was £13.95 and could not be faulted. It was very busy and the staff managed without difficulty. Highly recommended.

I came here with a group of friends & many of us said "never again" after we left. The service is extremely poor - a friend asked for our plates to be cleared away after we had eaten starters (and for a fresh plate for our main courses), the waiter refused and told us to scrape our plates off instead. She and I asked for spoons for our main courses, this was met with displeasure. When the bill came, there was an argument regarding the credit card charge, as we had been informed that paying by card was "no problem" upon arriveal with no reference to a charge. Staff were once again uncooperative and pretty rude. The icing on the cake had to be when the waiter pointed out 4 times that service was not included. After counting up the cash (from those of us paying by cash) & including the amounts on card, he proceeded to say that we were "only" paying £x (where x was more than the bill and quite reflective of the standard of service, in fact I felt it was a bit generous all things considered!) A friend replied by saying "yes, this is more than the bill" and the waiter repeated what he said, thus implying our tip was in some way insufficient. No frills is one thing, rudeness & poor service is quite another. I rarely fail to tip/tip below 10%, often I give far in excess of 10%, however tips must be earned & they were not in this case. The food was average, we ordered from the set menu which meant a selection of starters & mains for £14. The only reason I rated this place a 2 instead of a 1 was because the starters were quite good; onion & chilli bhajis were really good, though the chilli ones are naturally pretty hot! The dosa were ok, if a little bland. The main course wasn't particularly good, I predominantly had the chicken curry. I can't say that I found any of the other dishes (lamb bhuna & dahl) packed with flavour. We didn't order dessert. The appearance of the restaurant was also pretty poor, however that wouldn't bother me if the food and service were good. It's certainly not the kind of place that I would advise for a romantic evening or celebration, the atmosphere isn't good! All in all, I would not recommend that people go here if they want to be treated with respect or if they want to enjoy an evening. By the time we were leaving, I couldn't wait to go. It just found it unpleasant..

Serving breakfast menu until twelve noon when wider range of food is served. Very good poached eggs and coffee for give pounds! Also tasty nachos with vegetarian chilli sauce. Refreshing ginger drink. Excellent, central location with many tables to sit outside.

We knew about Elliot's, but we had not necessarily planned on eating there (not sure why, really), but when we spotted it during a downpour on our way to Borough Market, we dashed in out of the rain and had a fabulous lunch! I had pasta with vegetables and I would so love to be back in London right now eating it again. Very fresh, seasonal food and very delicious. My daughter said her hamburger was the best she has ever had. We ate at two of the St. John's restaurants, but I considered this to be better food and the prices were much more reasonable. Friendly, helpful staff, too.
Food is very tastyAmbience is greatService is goodPrice is a little bit highGood selection of food

Food is the same as Stradas all over: uninspired but competent and reasonably priced. What makes this a 'poor' rather than 'average' judgement is the service.We came as two families: four adults, five kids. They were able to seat us without a reservation and without a problem, which was great. However, they broke a glass under our table before we even sat down, forcing us to wait with whiny hungry kids while they cleaned up. They took five minutes to bring the menus, 20 minutes to take our order - and then only after we tracked the waitstaff down - and about 30 minutes before the first course Arrived. This when the restaurant was not particularly full, though it certainly became so. Wonder if our order was forgotten and then joined the back of the queue.Also, they have highchairs but didn't think to offer them. Again, had to track someone down to confirm their existence.Poor, poor, poor showing.

Just not a brilliant experience.Starter came out wrong, jalapeÌ±os on the nachos and I was waiting a while for my mocktail filled with crushed ice, that it was finished in two gulps.Got given a rubbish seat next to the high chairs.Mains took forever to come out and even then it wasn't that brilliant, it was a Monday afternoon at 3pm so wasn't busy at all.The waitress did apologise for the situation with the starters, wouldn't recommend for the money you're paying - may as well go to Chiquito's or Pizza Hut.
Love going here for a roast, the pork is my fav. Nice atmosphere with quite a relaxed vibe. Bit on the expensive side but I never regret it. Make sure you try the sticky toffee pudding!

Bombarded with text messages and emails with offers decided to book take away, few issues with order, manager decided to lecture and quibble over small amounts- the customer apparently is always wrong, very rude

There are not enough superlatives in our language to describe this gastronomic experience! Warm, friendly staff who were genuinely interested in ensuring that we enjoyed our meal. Amazing attention given to my dietary needs. The food - well fantastic, brilliant, superb, amazing etc.....The souffle was the best ever! Thank you to Vaivea for looking after us so well. We cannot wait to return!

After a busy and most enjoyable day in Central london myself and four other girlfriends from Redcar went on board to enjoy a bottle of wine and relax before catching our train home. Great atmosphere on the deck seating area. Staff very attentitive and friendly. Ordered our wine which was served in a profesional maner. After the wine had been quaffed we ordered coffee to finish off our day. After approx 20 minutes no coffee Arrived. I prompted one of the staff who apologised and went off to sort it out. Another 10 minutes passed and still no coffee. We couldn't stay any longer as we had a train to catch. As we left the ship the coffee was being prepared. The staff were very apologetic for the delay. I would point out that there were only a handful of customers. perhaps just an oversight on their behalf. We would return when next in London to possibly try the restaurant.

Itsu has always been a safe place for a quick snack or a light meal when in West End. In our experience it never failed to deliver, due to its simple formula, basic menu and fail proof concept.Alas, something went wrong between transporting Itsu bowls from their central kitchen and adding water to them. To cut long story short, the meal was OK, but not more than that, certainly nowhere close to what we have experienced before at other Itsu branches.That and a bit relaxed service, turned this into a forgettable experience.Pity!We shall certainly be back, but hope not to have this kind of experience again.

We have been to Buona Sera on several occasions and have enjoyed the experience each time. Yesterday was no exception. It appears to be an unpretentious pizza and pasta restaurant but is in fact far superior, offering a wide menu (with several vegetarian options) and a good wine list as well as a mind-boggling selection of grappas. The service is always excellent and staff are kind and good-humoured.

Excellent coffee and we enjoyed our macaroon to accompany it. The staff were efficient and entertaining, we had a laugh which the food and drink was being prepared. It was refreshing for London and I would return for that alone.Seating is limited inside, however, tables are cleaned shortly after someones departure making way for new customers.

I went to Tempio with my colleagues for a Christmas lunch. Everybody was happy with their food, however the starters were rather basic (the squid felt that it had been cooked from frozen). Given the prices we were charged it was reasonable. House wine was also fairly priced. The pizza toppings were generous. The staff were friendly and attentive.Good if you are in the area, but not worth going out of your way for. If you want to impress a client, then there are definitely better places to go, but if you want a simple meal with colleagues, then this restaurant will probably hit the spot.

Ate dinner here last week. Good location and a cosy place to eat.As the name suggests, it is more of a deli than a restaurant. You order food at the counter and then go grab a table. The good thing is that you can pick and choose the dishes you want. You can combine hot and cold dishes or pick either one. I went for a hot dish and 3 cold dishes. The variety was good and change daily. The food was well seasoned and had some good flavours.Depending on the combination you order, the dishes can be a bit dry. Even though I ordered some humus as one of my 4 dishes, it was a pretty dry humus. It would be good if the staff suggested a tasty combination - I should have gone for the pesto sauce/dip in this instance. Even better, I think a side dip should be incremental rather than one of the four dishes to be honest, but a smaller portion.Service was good with the staff friendly. Seating and atmosphere was nice.I actually felt a bit unwell after my meal here, hence the 3 stars. Would try it again, however, I would think a bit more on the combination of food. What I had was all a bit too dry.

What an outstanding experience: from the phone call confirming the booking to receiveing our coats at the cloakroom after dinner. Extremely friendly, but not imposing, staff, delicious food, good portions, great ambience. I would highly recommend it. Yes, it is a bit pricey, but it's worth it. And to top it off, we were invited into the kitchen and someone explained every station to us. Nothing to complain here at all!
Came here for the first time today, was really impressed with the service and the food was so tasty and had a lot of flavour. One of the prettiest places ive been to eat in a while!

Not very impressed. Had heard good things, but the place is a little tired, food was only average. Service was pleasant enough. To be honest, there are so many better restaurants in London and even in the Bermondsey/London Bridge area so I'd save your money and go else where. Cash only on the night also...really???

Oh dear. This is my local. I keep trying it to see whether it has improved, but little progress over the last eight years. The wine is fine. The bread and olives are edible. The rest - rubbery squid, terrible patatas bravas, mediocre Spanish omelette, over fried croquettes. It is always busy, due, I can only think to location and the fact there are very few bar / restaurant options round here. I find the rave reviews for the food very surprising. I don't know what the Spanish think of this place. On the upside, it is always busy, but I can only think most reviewers have imbibed rather a lot before they embark on the food.
I visited this pretty while in the Centre and found it to be a sanctuary of coffee and good conversations. I recommend visiting while in town.
Lovely restaurant. Food and service always exceptional. Been there a few times with my boyfriend and we're never disappointed. Lovely view over the Thames and just a short walk from Waterloo Station!

My partner and I rocked up to Rules on a wet and miserable days 5 years ago.I was dressed in jeans and a T-shirt over which I was wrapped in a large duffel coat my partner was a little better attired but equally off the street we had not anticipated the lunch that followed. We presented ourselves to the young lady at the reception desk (without a booking) and we were greeted with charm and more courtesy than we deserved. We were ushered to a table and seated. To say we felt a little out of place was an understatement, we were very under dressed. The staff soon put us at our ease and proceeded to guide us through their extensive menu and wine list, at no time were we made to feel other than we were very welcome and belonged.We had a large meal which consisted of oysters natural a selection or 3 different types, pheasant, pudding and a wonderful stilton that was introduced to us on its own trolly and told to have at it.The wines were unknown to us (French) but were selected for us by the sommelier who was spot on with his recommendations. The experienced staff were fantastic and the food was wonderful and we felt very reasonably priced, we spent about AU$400.00 half of which was wine.After lunch we were shown through the property and were invited into the room where a Royal personage used entertain friends in priveacy and comfort. We were told that the restaurant owners installed a side entrance exclusively for this person and his guests use. What a day we had cant wait to return, this time a little better dressed!The lady that greeted us so charmingly when we first entered the restaurant turned out to be an Australian she was delight and made the experience memorable indeed! Thank you to the staff and compliments to the owners.

Since the demise of my beloved kastoori restaurant RKB has become my go to place to eat Indian in Tooting.Not for you if you are a tikka Masala or rogan Josh fan but if you want to experiment with different south indiian flavours I think its one of the best. Makes it hard to eat Indian when I'm away from tooting. My favourite is the lamb with coconut, Cochin prawns and beetroot thoran.Inspired me to try cooking thorans at home.
This is my second time to dine in one of his restaurants and both times were amazing! It was my favorite meal while I was in London and I would recommend Bar Boulud...if you can get a reservation!

Popped in the Hispaniola on the off chance, it was Bank Hol Monday so didn't hold out much hope of getting a table for two but hay ho we did. The waitress was lovely, couldn't do enough for us....we opted for one of their grazing platters and it was spot on, had a lovely afternoon......the only down side was that the river was a bit choppy so the boat was moving about a bit, it then that is what happens when your on a boat, so I can't really moan can I.

I was booked for the smallcarBigcity tour and this is the starting point, so went in here for a pint while I wanted.A little bit out of the way, yet seems to be right in the heart of all the actions (minutes walk from Westminster and St James Park, and even Trafalgar Square is no more than 10-15 minutes walk away).Looked nice and inviting, and though didn't eat, what the couple at the next table had looked good (seemed to be ok prices, FOR LONDON) and would probably make a effort to try it out again when in London.

We asked for a table for three. Although we could see one available we were shown to a table for two and a third place was set. Consequently when our food came it was difficult to fit it all on. A special was advertised but when we tried to order it we were told it was not available. We ordered our main courses and side dishes. The green bean side dish was not available so we asked for broccoli instead. The main dishes Arrived but the sides were several minutes behind, the broccoli considerably so. The food itself was well cooked and tasty. The only reservation was that the vegetables were cooked al dente and the knives were not sharp enough to cut them. When we had finished our main course the plates were cleared and the bill brought. Nobody asked if we wanted dessert. Maybe we'll try Jamie's Italian just up the road next time.

I have been to The Princess of Shoreditch a few times before and have really enjoyed it, so much so that I am always recommending the place to our clients at work (we have a venue next door).On my last visit (weekend just gone), my friend and I ordered the steak and chips and we both agreed the steak was really tough and chewy and not enjoyable to eat. We mentioned this to the waitress as she cleared our plates however I do not think she took much note.I suspect this is just a small glitch for the usually up to standard Princess of Shoreditch however it was quite a disappointing visit.
Had a couple of drinks here having spend all day in London. Real ale was good but top end prices. Nice atmosphere and surroundings though.

Evening meal for two. Parking outside. Modern decor and comfortable seating inside. Quick service. Varied menu. Reasonable prices. Food well cooked and presented. Excellent sized portions. Gratuity 12.5% included on bill, so no need for cash tip.

Loved the vintage afternoon tea at this venue.The sandwiches were fresh with great fillings - really liked the smoked salmon with creamed horseradish. Scones were warm, pistaschio meringue gorgeous and the shot glass with rhubarb and custard was very retro. Free flowing champagne was definitely free flowing! The service although a little slow at times was excellent with the waiter recommending different types of teas. It is a great location and at £32.50 (including champagne) excellent value. Am already planning a return visit!
Very pleasant staff but the food, the main reason for a restaurant is adequate at best. There are numerous alternatives close by.
Only went due to location of University of the Arts open day for coffee, but non the less good coffee and excellent service

We went for dinner just as the pre-theatre crowd was departing, and were able to get a table without a reservation. All the staff were excellent throughout the meal.The starter of liver parfait was creamy and rich; my husband enjoyed his French Onion Soup.Our main was one of the Cote specials Ò half a Breton chicken. This can be a difficult dish to get right for the balance between crispy outside and tender inside Ò they struck the balance perfectly.We passed on dessert because we'd had a bottle of wine and the portions were quite generous.Nice atmosphere and a relaxed evening.

Popped in on the back of a lot of hype from the PR company plugs in Time Out and the Evening Standard. Being honest i ate a very bland lamb toasted sandwich, one warmed through sweaty lettuce leaf, along with a small amount of cheese and a minimal spread of whole grain mustard. That cost 7 quid. No queue, 4 people inside. Tells you something. Need to back up the PR campaign.

I went here for afternoon tea with friends and found it good but lacking a bit of atmosphere for my liking. The scones were nice and good tea selection but the sandwiches were a bit boring. Good and attentive staff and overall good for the price, but have had better.
A great variety of food to chose from, cooked fresh on-site daily. Top service with International professional staff and a great location.

We dined as a group of 14 on a Thursday evening and I must say we were all quite impressed by the experience overall. The food was truly delicious and the service exemplary. We started with Houmous, Baba Ganoush, Soujouk, Halloumi and a Fatoush Salad, all of which were delicious, the mains were huge and we thoroughly enjoyed them, we will return for sure.
The food was served fast, it wasy tasty and good price/performance ratio. Would recommend to friends to go for a tasty pasta

A friend and I visited Polpo on a Saturday at 5 30 pm with the intention of having a few small plates and a glass of wine as I was quite tired and wanted to get back home early. Instead we ended up spending more than 2 hours at the restaurant polishing off two bottles of a fantastic Montepulciano d'Abruzzo and ordering one small plate at a time. The salmon and arancini cicheti was outstanding. The goats cheese bruschetta was amazing as was the mushroom pizzete. The bill for the two of us came to 90 pounds including tip but considering we went through two bottles of wine and 5 small plates between the two of us, I thought was quite justifiable. Highly recommend. Come early with a few hours to spare. Order a small plate at a time and enjoy the wine

Perfect couples night out! Fantastic food, wonderful customer service and great entertainment. The Frankie Valli tribute singer was excellent. We had a fabulous evening, fun-filled and we were well fed! We will definitely return! Highly recommended!

Myself and my partner booked in for a four courses meal here. The restaurant was very well presented...exactly what I expected to see in this type of restaurant. The staff was not very friendly at all, in the way we felt a little unwelcome by just by the way they spoke dealt with us. They never seem to answer any phone calls! Which can be quite annoying sometime!The courses were soup, starter, main and desert.All the dishes was cook to an absolute perfection nothing to fault. The presentation was also very appealing. I would definitely recommend for the food not the service!

This was our first visit and certainly will not be our last, it was a busy Sunday night and we had (thankfully) booked previously. The service was excellent, friendly and also helpful with the menu too. The food was served in good time, cant stand it too soon or too late for that matter and they got it just right. We had a shared starter which was served after 10 minutes or so and was extremely good Ciabatta, grilled with cheese, sundried tomatoes etc.Main was A delicious chicken dish for my wife and a brilliant fillet Steak for myself.Highly recommended

After attending a showing of When Elephants Fight (definitely worth watching) we took one of the producers (from the US) to Rules for some proper British Nosh. Our waiter was superb. Welcoming / professional / helpful and humorous. The food was exceptionally well cooked old school British fare. My steak and kidney pudding avec with a cooked oyster on top with gravy, mashed spuds and butter spinach was perfectly cooked as was my wifes halibut with clams with duck fat chips. Our American friend had his first grouse with game chips & bread sauce. Rules definitely should be visited when in London. Why bother with the mediocre chains and microwaved food served in the pubs. Visit the oldest restaurant in London and you'll see why it's still open.

This family pizzeria has only been open a few weeks so I was surprised to see someone on TA had gotten there first. Located in Homerton, a fairly obscure but up and coming suburb three changes from London this restaurant is packed every night, mostly with locals. Expect this to change as word gets around, but they do take reservations. The pizza is delicious, ditto large packed calzones, but there's also a full, imaginative Italian menu. They even comped us a limoncello to finish the meal. The service is very fast and friendly. Highly recommended.

Surprisingly good food and service better than the prices would suggest. My scampi risotto was cooked to perfection. Perhaps my only slight disappointment was the cheese and biscuits but is probably because I like cheese I am not that keen on Italian cheeses. However my companions desert of gelato with a cold expresso poured over it (not on the menu but they were happy to do it for her) was excellentOverall very good and I will make a point of eating there again next time I am in the area

We spent a few hours here on Sunday evening, it's a lovely place with a great atmosphere and friendly staff, although we didn't eat the food looked lovely and I wish we hadn't left to go elsewhere as this place was by far the best.

Donde is a newly refurbished local gem in Honor Oak Park. Great tapas which is consistently good and great value for money, especially on a Tuesday when they special offers on meze plates and tapas dishes. Also has a friendly lively bar serving a variety of beers and cider on tap and a good selection of wine. Highly recommended.

What a great find! We went on a Thursday lunchtime and the place was busy and buzzing. Very friendly staff and a great selection of Turkish food with generous portions. We shared a mixed hors d'oevres which was about 6 different starters then had a lamb shish kebab with salad and rice. The bill came to £8.50! Its BYOB and so it's perfect for a good, cheap and tasty meal.
Restaurant downstairs is quieter than upstairs, but less fun. Ffod is good is not fussy. I recommend the sardines a la plancha and the almond tart. The ratatouille isngood too.

Only a few customers so no excuse for this. Ordered English tea got Earl Grey (hate it) ordered a cheese toastie (sandwich) got ham & cheese croissant which was soggy & luke warm. These incorrect 'delicacies' cost me £5.15Tables not cleared inside, outside tables surrounded by many cigarette butts, for what they charge awful! & that is being generous. All food is displayed in the 'open' yeah nice!No real interest taken by staff, I left half of the croissant & all the tea. I have emailed their customer services but looking at other feedback don't hold out much hope. Avoid this place!!!!!

Absolutely disgusting. The worst take-away we have had in liveing memory. The hot & sour soup was like eating thick congealed gravy. Nearly every dish was thrown away in its entirety. Pretty much inedible. May just as well have torn up a £50 note instead. More Dustpan Asian than Pan Asian.

Maria and Filipo will make you very welcome from the moment you enter the door.The whole restaurant exudes Italian family style and their pride in the place is evident from the number of photos of them with famous visitors, mounted all around the walls.Lots of daily specials on the blackboard, and a very extensive menu with a shorter wine card. Prices are amazing given the location. Bottle of Prosecco 16 GBP, litre of house wine for 14 GBP, or a bottle of good Barolo for 36 GBP. We had Prosecco with antipasti, bread and olives for 4, followed by various main courses off the blackboard (fillet steak x 2, sea bream, tortellini) accompanied by a Montepulciano Masi, and followed by coffees all around. The bill came to 110 GBP including tip! All the food was fresh, well prepared and well seasoned. Service was familiar and attentive. A great find - thanks for the recommendation, John Sparks!
Old movie theatre, people dining comfortably alone or in groups, not too noisy, nice variety and price of food, friendly staff, beer is good and so is their tap water

I visited Union Jacks for the first and, it must be said, last time with some friends last week for a late supper on a Friday evening. The ambience was great with plenty of people still ordering food and we were looking forward to trying Jamie's restaurant for the first time in such a brilliant location. Unfortunately it went downhill from there! We ordered soft drinks and although this may be me being picky, they were truly awful - how you can ruin lemonade i'm not sure but it tasted of nothing but ginger. My friend sent her dandelion & burdock back as it tasted so bizarre. Our starters were nice but nothing special, however we each had a different pizza for our main course which was a major disappointment. They were greasy and not at all enjoyable. Our waitress was rather unhelpful, forgetting to bring anything extra we asked for such as water and mayonnaise, and she didn't bother to ask us how the food was at any point. Overall the experience was not what we had hoped for and I certainly won't be recommending the restaurant to anyone - in such a competitive area I cannot understand why the food and service were such a let down.
The food here is amazing, staff are great too! I have been a few times now and wont stop returning, its a great venue for any kind of evening. Would highly recommend

After looking for somewhere to eat and on reading good reviews we booked for 7pm.Arrived in a beautiful bar and we went upstairs. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our choice was mutton for the main, it was served with an overpowering anchovy sauce and sadly the meat on both plates was both tough and fatty. Mutton we believed was cooked long and slow to tenderise it!It didn't help when two people asked for steak, which wasn't on the menu, and they said it was great. The dessert was ok .

We normally wouldn't go into a place with photos, but after a great trip to the imperial war museum popped in here with the family.Not great from the outside (opposite Lambeth tube)Really quick, cheap and good quality sushi and sashimi plus all the other favourites.The king prawn bento box is great value at £10.95.Wouldn't travel just to go here but if you like this type of food and near worth popping in.

Excellent value and quality for a pre-theatre meal. £20 for 3 courses and a glass of wine. Service was brilliant. We ran out of time for the 3rd course and asked if we could come back for it after our play finished which they agreed to.Very friendly.Great atmosphere and secluded location.

Went here for a Birthday meal recently. Helpful staff saved our reserved table even though we couldn't get there until nearly an hour late due to traffic. Food was pretty quick to be served in good sized portions, tasted lovely. Can recommend the Calamari and the rack of ribs was huge too. Just be aware of the 10% service charge automatically added to your bill! Would definitely go back none the less!

I have been coming here since the opening week and have never had a bad time.The drinks change a lot and are always unique, balanced and served by bartenders who know there stuff.Full most nights so get there early or a make a reservation as you wont want to miss out.

The lemongrass and lychee cocktail is my most favourite!!! This a little treasure of a place where the atmosphere was so relaxed that we took our sweet time going through 12 baskets of dim sums and fritter desserts. Although the restaurant was short-staffed, the head waiter was honest about it upfront but the servers were still attentive enough. In short, delicious food, juicy cocktails, great service- it all helped my friends and I have a really good time! Many thanks!!!

Had Sunday lunch there for 6 people 7.12.14. Just awful. Starter for £6. of chorizo had only 5 small pieces. We complained and they brought a few more.The roast beef roast was the worst roast ive had. 2 small dry and chewy pieces of beef, a Yorkshire pudding that belongs to pancake day and a few bits of undercooked vegetables.We complained and were given a few extra pieces of Beef. So much choice of great places to go for Sunday lunch in Clapham we will not be going to The Calf again.

I had an afternoon to kill, so i grabbed a paper and went in here. The service was very friendly, nice real ales, incl tasting before you buy. A quiet original feature bar, with subtle music. A very civeilised way to spend an hour or two. Will return sometime.

I'll do my best to be balanced on this. Myself and five old university pals had our annual pre Xmas London blow-out here this year. The positives- A very impressive space, great table right by the pass, really friendly and knowledgeable staff, fabulous prawn starters, a rib-eye described by one of our party as the best steak he'd ever had, and above all a manager who did all he could to make things right.The negative- despite asking for medium rare, and double checking and told what this meant, first effort over cooked. At £90 thought this poor so sent it back. So there was minimal (but surprisingly briefly some) quibbling over this but another was to be put on "straight away". After fully ten minutes and with pals well through their meal- and being reassured steak had indeed been put on the grill straight away- I said I'd have it as it came, as I'm fine with rare. This was of course my mistake as the steak was blue. In any event whether medium or rare the USDA was frankly bland - my first choice of Hereford Porterhouse or all other on the bone (all described as "gamier") being not available. So I ended up with a few chips (ok) steamed spinach (average) and one of my pal's left over bits of whatever steak he had (actually quite nice). We passed on puddings and discussing the evening through over a drink next door at Browns (very good by the way) another pal mentioned his "medium' steak was rare. He had a different cut before the obvious is assumed. My steak was taken off the bill, and we did pay the Service charge as the staff were great, but unfortunately the evening ended up as an expensive (the wine prices!) disappointment. Obviously I'm just one review and below are a ton of exceptional recommendations, but all I can say is the next time I am going to have a "premium" steak in Town I'm going to Mash- where I and thirty or so guests had a truly memorable steak meal for a significant birthday not too long ago.

We thought we would try the pre show deal at this restaurant. The soup was watery ,salty and tasteless. My main course was not too hot and my wifes vegetarian meal was terrible. Service funnily enough was ok. I really should have checked on trip advisor first.

We were looking for something reasonably priced and a bit different for lunch before going to the theatre when we spotted this place. The lunch menu was extremely reasonably priced - half a lobster plus chips, salad & sauce for under £10. Tasted amazing, really friendly staff and a lovely environment.

We tried soup,potatoes,burger,sausages,fish and chips,they were cooked as we prefer it,finally fish and chips not greasy..the dessert was also really good.it is really difficult to find friendly service,warm atmosphere,good price and quality food,dessert in london at the same time...
Great food at a reasonable price, with a lovely quaint atmosphere. Service from Tom feels very personal, and unlike anything you'll get in a larger restaurant.
Best food we had the entire time in London. Service was great and the restaurant was very clean. A bit high priced. Wished they had more locations in the US.

Because the space allows you to talk across the table. Make a reservation.Food is reliably good as we have been several times now. They don't rush you - which is nice especially if you are having fun and want to relax.Chef has great specials and the desserts don't just look good - they are good.We have yet to be in town on a Saturday when they have a special champagne add on....can't wait to make that happen.Great location - off of Shopping Street. Nice staff....great food. We will return and try their other locations.

Amazing views of London and amazing food to match. Whilst it is a fine dining experience it feels friendly and welcoming regardless of how much you spend on your bottle of wine. The food is incredible as you would expect but the environment isn't pretentious, would happily again visit in an instant.
Great atmosphere have visited several times the service was excellent,lovely cocktails,great lunch and we have also sampled the afternoon teas on other occasions

I visited this restaurant on a Sunday lunchtime with family to celebrate mine & my brothers birthdays. I chose this restaurant mainly because it was a good balance between fancy dining and a reasonable price. Pros: The venue is lovely, the location great and easy to get to, the menu had a good choice with 2 courses for £21 and 3 courses £26Cons: We were unable to have our birthday cakes for dessert as the staff wanted to charge us £30 per cake (we had 2 separate cakes, one for myself and one for my brother) and I did not think the food tasted particularly great.Overall we had a nice meal here but I do not think I would return or recommend here highly unless the main priority is a 'posh'er meal at affordable prices.
i love their fish burger and hamburger and their sweet potato fries. waiters/waitresses are very friendly as well.
So much better than most pubs out there for food, especially in this area, service attentive, decent priced (ish) for good quality pub food.

We booked the upper deck for a priveate function for 140 travel professionals. Everyone on board was most helpful from the events manager at the planning stage through to the end of the event. Bar service was excellent - friendly, helpful, polite, efficient and nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. Canapes were very tasty and again the service faultless. And the panoramic view of the Thames from St Paul's Cathedral to the London Eye is spectacular at night. For a central London venue, with the service, quality and help that we experienced, we found Hispaniola to represent excellent value for money. Thank you for a very successful evening. We re-booked for next year the following morning.
Love, love, loved the music in the bar last night............mainly punk/new romantic. Fabulous.Great vibe.We will be back.
The service as usual was Top. Unfortunately this time the food was very disappointing - such a shame as we brought people from abroad.
Food very tasty and staff very pleasant. Well done to all. Busy place so book if possible. Visited on a Thursday evening and restaurant got very busy after 6.30.

I joined a friend who lives close by and recommended Trullo as place to eat. It doesn't look amazing from outside given that it's in a row of unprepossessing shops. However, inside it is simply but tastefully furnished.The food was wonderful. My fish tasted so fresh and the accompanying cucumber salad with dill and creme fraiche was to die for. Service as excellent...just right. The waitress was friendly and helpful and DIDN'T interrupt us every five minutes to ask if we were all right. Well worth the money...around £80 for 2 with nice wine.
Liked this a lot - great place for a quick drink in the summer, good outside area. Has function room upstairs

I visited this branch of Pizza Express a couple of weeks ago, and I go there regularly. The service is excellent and the pizzas are of a consistently high standard.The layout of the restaurant is not ideal, as tables are close together, and because it is in such a popular location, it is always busy. However, the staff cope really well.

Finally went to eat in on a Friday night - had meant to go for ages. Place is clean and always busy. And deservedly so. I had the skate, which was cooked fresh to order - and everything fish and chips shop fish should be; piping hot, crunchy golden batter, fresh. Chips were the same. Also had mushy peas which took a while to arrive but, you can't go wrong with mushy peas really.I'd have given a 5* but they were pretty disorganized and orders placed after ours Arrived before... the peas Arrived long after we'd been served.Will definitely go back.
Enjoyable meal. Would certainly dine here again.The staff were helpful and the surroundings pleasant. Good healthy, wholesome food and a good size meal.

Great Atmosphere, reasonable prices, staff were fine. I wasn't expecting great things reading reviews of late but I get the impression all those that have commented about a poorly thought out sign might themselves have been those on strike. Take those comments with a pinch of salt,vthis was a great little pub. Can't comment on food as didn't eat here

The restaurant is cozy and warm. There's a wide range of food and evry single one delicious. I thought initially its just for dressed up people but its for everyone. Staff are lovely, you can ask anything and its no trouble for them at all, especially Ken who served me twice this month now. He made me and my son feel welcome and didn't mind us staying too long because of the break in my son's rehearsals are the royal opera.Thank you and we will see you all again. Soon.

First let me say that the food was better than expexted! I let my daughter taste the pasta fagoli that I started with and then the bowl migrated in front of her. Each of our main courses were perfect. I was a little disapointed with the service but in fairness we did arrive around 5pm (before the dinner rush) and there were only one or two servers and they were busy (I think) getting ready for the evening rush, which within an hour or so hit and the restaurant was full. We could have had another bottle of wine or so, the drinks could have been refilled, etc....
Went here for the first time last week....had a great evening.....good food and excellent service.....nice atmosphere...will return soon with friends....
Quite expensive but always the same good value. When there's nothing else around it is definitely a good choice. If there are other bars around, I'd always look for something more home-made though.

The place is cool even if in the basement;nice rustic tables and chairs make you feel comfortable and easy.They have a 16 pound menu for lunch that is interesting and big portions.I had tasty and crunchy pork belly squares and fresh oysters,my husband absolutely meaty Cornish anchovies and sea bass on a fresh broad bean , green peas and mussel light sauce to die for.Exquisite real Italian coffee and kind service.
very nice Italian restaurant in the city, close to St Pauls staion, good food and winefriendly service
We went there for lunch and we had a very good time, attentive service, good food and great juices, I would recommand that place and come back for sure!

I have visited their new restaurant, Fish Cafe, twice since it opened. On both occasions the good food and reasonable prices (certainly for Hampstead) were let down by slow and sullen service. The staff at at the take-away end are much better and should be serving rather than in the kitchen.

We have been to this restaurant several times now. I usually go for one of the thalis, and my wife has a milder curry and rice. Excellent. The only thing is, it is rather pricey - especially the drinks, but that is only to be expected in this location. It is not easy to park nearby, either. Take the tube, is our advice.

We were really looking forward to our dinner at tramshed, having read a lot about it. The restaurant is set in a large barn of a room, with a Damien hurst centrepiece. Its a fun place and the drinks were good, the hix fix lethal. I really wanted the food to be great, but unfortunately the execution was shocking, and not what I would expect of a hix restaurant. We went for the chicken liver pÌ¢te and Yorkshire pudding. The Yorkshire was burnt and far too crispy as a result and the pÌ¢te was rock solid and straight out the fridge. Not a great start(er) sadly. Then came the shocker. The place only does roast chicken or steak for main course, so you are expecting fireworks. However, my medium rare steak came well done and so black and charred on the outside that it tasted of charcoal. Really poor execution and amazed a top kitchen sent it. My wife's was a little better, but still over cooked compared to how she requested it. The sides were good. Price is a bit Punchy too. My 500g rib eye seemed to be the same size as my wife's 250g sirloin? but 40 quid instead of 20? So, in conclusion - the service was good, the setting quite cool, drinks good but our experience of the food was very poor and most of the food we were given was over cooked. Maybe this was an off night, but as far as first impressions go, this was not a good one I'm afraid.
ive been here five times now, and everything ive tried has been amazing.Really friendly staff, a must visit if you're in Dalston

My friend and I decided to try the Marco Grill at Stamford Bridge after having visited most of the other Marco Pierre Whites in London with great succes and we were definitely not laid down this time. The staff was very polite and aware of us all the time, the food was mouth watering, and the surroundings in the restaurant were simply beautiful; dark with glittery lights here and there, making the atmosphere both sophisticated and comfortable. We will definitely come back for another dinner here next time we visit London!

First of all don't go here expecting a traditional pub/restaurant. Do go here expecting the best traditional pub food you have ever tried in your life. I went with my father (always book ahead!) and was greeted by the owner Tom. He's a real character and sat down with as at the table to read the choices. There's no menu, you pick from whatever Tom decides to cook that night. But what he does is exceptional, I chose a steak, mushroom and red wine pie and my father chose the chicken bacon and leek pie. Both where deeply filled, had flakey light pastry and the best chips you will ever try. It was all served with vegetables and real gravy. Fantastic value for money and beautifully cooked, just remember to always book ahead, bring your own wine, make your mind up quickly (Tom doesn't hang around!), and don't expect anything fancy. Sometimes it doesn't need to be.

We were having a stroll in the area and we decided to try this new place. The Lobster was tasteless and the birger was average. For a place that only sells lobsters and burgers it was really disappointing.The place is really new and I guess they are still trying to work their way around things... however I hope they understand the quality of food is key for their success in a difficult aeea like pimlico-victoria.

We were really excited to try what was the best fish and chips in London! It s was a very poor experience. The chips are undercooked and not nice. The fish is nice but really expensive £14.50 and £3.00 for peas! If you dare asking tap water they don't literally give you any ! The service is really poor. Had to ask 5 time for the drinks. I won't recommended it. No atmosphere. At last if you re a expensive place look after your customers.

i have organised a Christmas Brunch at this restaurant on Sunday. Tiziano, restaurant manager was very helpful and accommodating. the food was very good and we had an option to choose from a few set menus so everyone was happy that we could have a meal on a budget. I had antipasti which was so big that i could share with others and then followed by a salad which was very well prepared with a lot of panchetta as i like. We have a great service and been looked after very nicely.recommend this place for sure

This restaurant serves excellent food. We were looking for a restaurant which served Dover sole nearby and we found a gem thanks to trip advisor. They offer a variety of seafood starters and entrees along with other dishes. We had ravioli with scallops and crab, moules mariners as starters for entrees Dover sole,scallops and magnet de canard. All excellent. Service excellent , staff very friendly and cosy atmosphere. We came to know that this restaurant has been there for 32 years. I believe that the constant presence of the owner adds a lot to the charm of the place. The only weak was the dessert.

Coming from up north we had no idea of where to eat in Greenwich. On a freezing cold Sunday we wanted somewhere warming and that could fit us in without booking. We tried a few places before coming across this Pub. As soon as we Arrived we were made to feel welcome. They were booked up but they accommodated us by opening up the back room. The service and food were both great. Definitely recommend and will visit again if in the area.

Overprocessed and overpriced (for what it is). If you want good quality burgers and steaks, go to a Black & Blue restaurant. I struggle to see what the point is of this 'restaurant'...and I think MacDonalds is better.

I am a massive fan of TGIs, but since my last trip I am not so sure. Went there with a group (6 of us in total) to celebrate a 25th Birthday. The cocktails we purchased had near to no alcohol in them - a bit pricey for us to be cheated out like that. The starters were the best part of the meal, decent quality and lots to go around (we shared 3 sharing platters). However, the mains were of poor quality - I have no idea how little they pay for their meat but it was so dry and flimsy! I didn't particularly mind because I was having a burger, but for my friends who enjoy steak, this was not the TGI Fridays we knew. To add to this, the staff were horribly fake and I wish that they just admitted they hated serving tables rather than making such a bad attempt at enthusiasm. Everyone has bad days!A bit sickly to be honest. Maybe they should focus a bit more on quality, not quantity in order to regain their high standards?

We had a superb meal with my parents. The food was the finest as was the service. We have been before and this is now my No.1 restaurant ! Thank you Rules for keeping standards up and allowing us to to rely on you for excellent food and outstanding service in a fantastic ambiance.

Son and I had small haddocks and chips this afternoon. We had to wait over 15 minutes for the fish - obviously fresh, but........they needed a reminder before they put the fish in. I thought it was average at best and they are clearly trading on their reputation of when it used to be great back in the seventies and eighties. Portion / cost ratio needs looking at urgently. This would not be the best chippy in Sheffield or Liverpool never mind London. Rather sad but that's the way it goes.

Afternoon tea here was ok, but I wasn't particularly impressed by anything in partcular, so if you are looking for something special you might have to look at somewhere else. The restaurant is located in a wonderful area and the place itself is quite nice. We had the Vintage Afternoon Tea (you have a choice between Vintage and Gentleman); food was ok, but nothing special and I think that the tea selection should be expanded. While champagne is refilled, food is not, so if you want any refill you will have to pay for it. Service was a major disappointment; when we walked in the restaurant the staff at the reception was carrying on in their conversation ignoring us, tea was poured and we weren't asked previously if we wanted so, eventually my tea was spilled by the waiter while pouring, but afterward he didn't make any effort other to replace it or to clean the mess.

Dont waste your time going here. Youre just setting yourself up for dissapointment. The staff barely spoke english and they put the 3 of us on a table which fit 1 person. The guy also said 15 minutes for the table, ended up being 45 minutes

ive walked past this restaurant many times, but finally ate there today for the first time, using a really good Groupon deal they have running.The waiter was very courteous - he made us feel at home straight away, and relaxed. I do like calm service like this, it makes a big difference.The food was delicious. I had a stuffed spicy pepper, with mushrooms & egg. It was astonishingly hot - I think it might have been a stuffed chilli pepper, because I went bright red & my nose was streaming LOL! But all good - I enjoy seriously hot food!Main courses were very tasty too - my guest had lamb casserole, which I tried too, and it was proper lamb, and very tasty. I had Lomo - a chicken dish with onion, red pepper, rice, spring onion, etc. It was great - very tasty.We had Peruvian beer, which was good, and well chilled. Also the Melbec wine at £7 a glass was superb, and a large glass too. Cheesecake to finish was tasty. We also tried several sides, including fried plantain with honey - delicious! Plus cheese with little white beans, also very nice.Overall - ive not had Peruvian food before, but we really enjoyed this. It was ace value with the Groupon deal too.The waiter told us they do a brilliant all you can eat lunch on Sat & Sun for £21. So we're definitely going to return to try that out.Good food, and nice people too - I spoke to the lady doing the cooking behind the counter, and told her how much we had enjoyed it, and she beamed!Well worth a try - a good restaurant, at reasonable prices I think.

Our group of 8 was reduced to 6 but we still decided to use the reserved priveate room for our get together. Judging by the other clientele this was a good decision. We started in the dark, very quite, cocktail bar and then made our way to our seats. Plenty of room, so no complaints there. We were a mix of ages and tastes so we decided on a traditional menu. Salmon and grated scrambled eggs, beef roast followed by a lemon meringue. I did not finish any one of the courses due to bland taste and unappetising presentation. The service was OK, no more. This I think was due to the lack of English on behalf of the waitress and a couple of the other waiters. The rest of the staff were obviously only there as it was their work and made no effort to enhance our visit. Then came the bill. This unfortunately spoilt the day for a few of the guys as they could not come even close to understanding why we paid £250+ each on top of the £200 to reserve the room. We were either ripped off or this restaurant is selling its wares far above their worth. Even if the bill was <£100 I still would not be able to recommend it.

I was here many months ago, last night we decided to have 'fish & chips', the variety of fish on the menu is amazing, the starters are really tasty and a whole range of 'sides' are on offer. If you like your seafood, this is the place to visit, but make sure you book first, it does get really busy, this restaurant does not disappoint, the staff are very friendly and the service is excellent. The wine list contains some truly enjoyable wines, good value for money
Our first experience of Searcys restaurant was disappointing, however 2nd time round was fantastic. The staff were more attentive and the food was delicious.

We were told by close friends that this was the best place for fish and chips in London. They were right - though we dare you to finish the enormous tasty portions! The Plaice and Chips at just GPB15 was brilliantly done but the fillet must have been 30cm long by as much as 15cm wide. One of our number ordered a Salade Nicoise, but it came with an entire filet of tuna - more than a grown woman can handle for lunch! Service came with a smile and a nice ambiance of modern art and furniture, This is definitely worth a visit but consider sharing.

This TGI Friday's was really good compared to others. The staff were nice and the atmosphere was comfortable. I find with all TGI Friday's the food is kinda the same. I think this is the best one so far...

Visited the Dulwich branch during the week after Christmas 2016 in the evening and it was totally packed. Cocktails/The BarWe had a couple of cocktails at the bar whilst waiting 20mins for a table. They were amazing.At the bar, one attendant also served and made drinks for the resturant so the drinks service was extremely slow but pleasant.FoodMy cheese burger and hubby's bacon burger was dry & well done even though it was meant to be medium well ??Fries were good but massively overpriced. Onion rings were large greasy, battered, unfavourable , soggy things.Service/Atmosphere After eating we were asked if we would like the bill even though we had a full glass of cocktail.People were eargerly waiting at the bar to be seated literally an arms length away which was uncomfortable. There is barely enough space for the staff to walk around as this eatery is tight. If you are sat at the aisle sometimes you have to move a leg or arm to allow staff/people to pass. Literally every 5 seconds if busy.The ambience is a cool hang out that is loud, buzzing and rocky. Ages 20s - 50Overall too small and a rushed feeling. Not a place to chill out and eat and drink. Which is what I think dining is about!!

4 of us ate at Goya last night, it was easy to find and very welcoming. The food was very good, huge portions and the service first class. We will certainly return when we are next in the area and would recommend to anyone.

We went to vertigo 42 for pre dinner drinks and were not disappointed. The views are absolutely stunning especially at night. You have your own table but can walk virtually 360degrees. If you are drinking only you will have a limited time usually 1 hour
Good healthy food at a good price. I could have had lunch here every day during our week long trip. The sandwiches and salads were delicious. The coffee was good as well.
Average gastro fare. Fish pie with bones in. 'Artisan bread' was sliced and stale. Specials on web site don't exist in real life.

Jumped in here to have a quick snack after a tortuous 2.5 he business meetingIt was quite busy, staff were friendly with a good sense of humour - initial service to take the order was slow, but once taken was quick to arrive

We find the venue wonderful most of the time except when we encounter the heavy set barmaid with long straight blondy/brown hair (we think she is from New Zealand)This woman needs to be trained in customer services, her rude attitude is not placed well in a client facing role. Perhaps she would do better in a back office role where clients will not hear her swearing or see her clearly intoxicated eating the food behind the bar.We had asked her a question (the bar at this point was quite so it's not like she was rushed off her feet) she responded by snapping back at us and raising her voice as though she was telling us off. Interestingly what had happened also was that we ordered a single rum and coke, she accidentally poured a double dose and said 'oops I poured a double' the young male bartender said he will not charge us for the extra dose and she snapped at him as though he had done something wrong...He on the other hand was very personable, sweet and accommodating and clearly a victim of her bullying. This unfortunately is not the first time this has happened with this particular barmaid. Her attitude needs to change or please get someone to replace her.

visited here for saturday lunch with my wife and two sons. Childrens menu was very good value and very tasty. Both myself and my wife really enjoyed our meal. The kids loved the ice cream in particular the "after eight". Jamie definately has the atmosphere and retro theme spot on. Really good value for money, will definately be visiting again!!

We went to London for the Sainsburys Anniverasary games and stayed in Kensington. We saw an offer for the Park Terrace Resraurant which was less than a ten minute walk from our hotel. The reviews looked good so we paid £29.50 each for a 4 course meal including a cocktail.We're so pleased that we went. We couldn't remember such a pleasant dining experience in our 24 years of married life, and we've eaten in many restaurants.The waiting staff were very friendly and efficient. We were told to take our time as there was lots to eat and the table was ours for the evening.The table was spacious and the surroundings well decorated.All of the courses were absolutely lovely and beautifully presented. Usually when you enjoy a meal and consider returning you choose the same meals again, but the menu was so interesting we could have gone back for 3 or 4 more nights and tried something different on each occassion.We will definately eat here again next time we;re in Kensington.
Everytime we visit London we come and wait here, it is always busy but service is prompt and care is taken with our food. Definitely keep coming back

We came here on a Wednesday evening with tastecard which offered you 2-4-1 on all the hot/cold mezze's and mains, but not the seafood mains.There was a huge selection of dishes which all looked delicious so we ordered 4 dishes from the hot mezze section: Jawaneh, Arayess, scallops and shrimps marinated. We'd been really looking forward to ordering some Halloumi too but they were all out that evening unfortunately. However, we soon forgot about the Halloumi as all of these dishes were absolutely amazing! The flavours were incredible and I would happily order them again. They even brought us a basket of flat breads for the table at no extra cost to mop up the juices from all the starters. The scallops were excellently priced at £7.50 which included 3 big ones, usually other restaurants ive eaten in have priced each scallop at £3+. The portions were huge for starters, so by the time the mains came me and my partner were both stuffed already! For the mains we ordered the Lamb fillet and Shawarma chicken with no extra sides as these already came with rice and vegetables each which was more than enough. The Shawarma chicken portion was huge and we could barely finish it between both of us after all the starters to. So I would recommend one between two if you have a few hot/cold mezze's to begin. I wouldn't order the Lamb Fillet again as after all the other lovely flavours we'd had earlier, it seemed quite bland itself. We didn't order desert but when we were given our bill they gave us 3 free baclava's, which were to die for! This was more than enough and filled any gap we had left for something sweet. The service throughout our meal was very attentive and I didn't need to ask once for more water or another drink. Lovely evening, great atmosphere and delightful food! We will definitely be back.

from the fantastic smiling and warm waitresses and the delicious beautifully prepared food-this is a winner in every way.the somellier was helpful and knowledgeable and the chef was charm personified.our friends had been two or three times before and were spot on in their choice.not one bad dish between 5 of us.the amuse guile was as good as I have eaten anywhere.we will be back

Came here after another very original cocktail bar. Cocktails here are strong which is how they should be! Waitress walked passed me as I was getting something out of my pocket and I accidentally bumped her whilst she was carrying a drink. She looked at me terribly and rolled her eyes. Just not acceptable. Liked the place but need to realise customers are everything.

If London Parties this is the epicentre. New year Eve opposite the London Eye fireworks, the Queens Jubilee Thames Pagent this is the place to go and eat on the water a seagulls wing away from the action. For the Thames Day Fireworks you have to be further downstream at Oxo Tower. Beware on big occasions road close for miles around here many hours before the event.Join me for a cigar outside any celebration night.

Food was good but almost cold by the time you find a table went on a Sunday so it was rammed! Pasta was nice although bits stuck together in a big heap so it could have been cooked better £10 a dish..nice place prefer table service instead of queuing for 20 minutes for a dish.

Went for afternoon tea last Tuesday at the Palm Court. We were booked in at 11.30 and although a little early for afternoon tea, we decided that a visit at this time enabled us to get some sightseeing done afterwards. When you approach The Ritz you sense you are about to enter somewhere special. We actually Arrived at 11.10 and went into the hotel to change footwear and were shown where the powder room and cloakroom were. The 'ladies' was like entering what I imagine to be a French boudoir. Very pink (think Barbara Cartland) but pretty amazing - there were chairs to rest on and glasses placed on a tray with bottled water (set with an ice bucket and tongs) for you to help yourself to. No paper-towels or hand driers here - you had a white face cloth rolled in a basket on the side of each marble sink to dry your hands on and then place in the laundry bin! When you gave your coats to the cloakroom attendant, you were given a brass token with a tassel on to retrieve your items at the end of the visit.Once this was done we went to the Palm Court where we checked in and although we were early we were shown to a table in the centre of the room. The room was richly gilded and there were many mirrors, chandeliers and beautiful flower arrangements. All the tables were set with tablecloths as you would expect and silver cutlery. The waiters were all dressed in frock coats and tails and were immaculately presented. They came to the table and placed our linen napkins on our laps. We chose our teas (from 18) and these were delivered to the table in silver teapots along with hot water, milk, tea strainer and bowl. At this point the waiters offered to take our photos which was a lovely gesture. Then the cake stand Arrived. Our sandwiches were on 2 levels as I have a nut allergy and they were keen to make sure there was no cross-contamination. The sandwiches were lovely and fresh and a very nice selection. The cakes for my friend were on the stand but mine Arrived on a separate plate. The warm scones were lovely and the jam and clotted cream were served on a dish. The waiters kept an eye on your cup and refilled when required. Half way through a dessert trolley was wheeled round with a further choice of either cake or pear tart. Nothing seemed too much trouble and we both felt very special. A pianist played mainly the old songs while we ate and everything was perfect. Although there is a dress code and you wore your 'Sunday best' there was a good mix of ladies wear on show, but we still felt comfortable. We had 2 hours per slot and we had plenty of time. The ambience was wonderful and it felt a priveilege to be at The Ritz. A very special day. Thank you.

I had been looking forward to our visit but it didn't get off to a great start. We were greeted by staff who were indifferent, or maybe bored! We were taken downstairs and shown to our table with little friendliness. I have to say the ambience and decor downstairs is lovely. The service was efficient but not attentive and staff not overly helpful.Food Arrived quickly and I opted for the salt & pepper squid to start. A very light batter but no seasoning so had to rely on the minuscule drop of chilli sauce for flavour. I would recommend the dumplings they were lush. All in all aside from the ambience, and cost, this was not fine dining at its best. Food was nice but not much different from a local takeaway. Staff were efficient but indifferent and we didn't have the same waiter at any point! I won't be back!

I have been to this restaurant many times. It is ideal for breakfast, lunch or dinner. The food is delicious and the service is always warm and friendly. It is the perfect place for a business lunch or for a fine dinner. They have a great wine selction.
We have eaten here five or six times and each visit has been excellent. Great value and superb quality. The staff are always friendly and helpful.

Just wanted a small lunch.cheap and hot.great choice.I went for the Japanese spicy chicken with rice and my partner had the chicken curry with noodles .delicious food £5 each great value. good customer service.place was clean and basic just want you need and no more.will add we went to the branch in borough high St though am sure this one will b just as good.

We visited with our very good friend Yoshi, (a London local). The restaurant location and view - superb, food - amazing, and if you are lucky enough to get 'Elisabetta' looking after you, life will be good. Elisabetta made our first London experience one that will be very hard to beat. Thank you!... we are here for 9 days and already booked to come back! favouritemeal #sashimicoma great mocktails :)

This was the first time for all of us and we were extremely impressed with both the wine list and the food. Courses were reasonably priced for Hampstead but amazingly tasty - I would recommend the risotto or the seared tuna which were both absolutely delicious. The other thing that worked for me was the portion size - you could have either a large or small portion of every starter and every main course which is perfect if you're either starving hungry or just fancy a piccolo. Customer service was attentive, consistent and friendly and the tables were a nice distance apart from each other so that you didn't feel hemmed in which I hate. Overall, a lovely experience and great for couples, a business lunch or for a friendly get together.

We were recommended and visited this location a few years ago and decided that a return visit would be a good start for a New Years Eve visit to London.Located 100m from the Plaza at Covent Garden, it is ideal to visit London attractions and the London Theatre options close by.Pre lunch at Covent Garden for a coffee and listening to the excellent street entertainment, buskers if so their performances were great.Short walk to Clos Maggiore located in King Street, on arriveal we were warmly welcomed by well informed and committed staff. After missing out the chance to be located in the "conservatory" we were shown to our table on the first floor.A small area of the restaurant that overlooks the busy Kings Street below. People watch or review of the menu. Having made up our mind we did both. The menu was varied and provided a very good range of options.The wine menu was like a book in itself, the choice of wines and liqueurs were excellent.All of the staff had a great knowledge and were keen to provide guidance if it was needed. They engaged in conversation and were friendly and attentive in the service they provided and in taking the inevitable photographs. In know time at all our visit had to come to a close and the staff and management were as warm when wishing us well for the new year as they had been when we Arrived.It is a beautiful location and well worth visiting, it is from the outside a narrow fronted venue, it is however like a Tardis inside.I would strongly recommend early bookings and request the tables in the conservatory as your first choice, it will provide you with an experience to remember.

Booked the LP sadly for a wake. From the get go Gatis and his team managed the entire process from the food requirements to the function room to the beverages. Confident and competent our family felt reassured by his and his teams approach. On the day itself we had access to the public area and in the evening the function room, the food was as promised plentiful and superbly cooked (many of the guests commented on the foods quality and quantity) while the bar staff ensured no one had to wait too long for drinks, even ferrying teas and coffees to the guests tables. All in all the team made a difficult day a little easier. Would recommend for priveate functions

We had our works unofficial 10th anniversary reunion here... centrally located, no minimum spend, and the upstairs area is perfect for our size around 70-80 people. Phil and his staff were on hand to answer any questions. We're thinking about doing the same next year for the 11th!
I live round the corner so this is my local chippy. It has always been expensive but recently standards have slipped. Three trips in a row and each one has given me cold chips.

Decided to have dinner here after it was raved on by my friends as being very good based on their experience many years ago. Had rack of lamb for starters and this was dry and unseasoned; the King prawn was nothing special; rack of lamb was dry - very disappointed, would not return ever again. However, service and cocktails were so so.
Food was good and well presented. A little pricey but situation superb looking over tower bridge. Menu had good choice but for food intolerances you had to request alterations which were no problem.

The food is terrific, as a first timer who was eating Sushi, the staff there was very friendly and went out of their way to reccommend and advise on the various sushi dishes available. A great place for a quick, healthy low calorie meal.
