I booked this restaurant for myself and my husband for his 40th birthday on Tuesday. We had already had a big family meal elsewhere but I wanted to take him somewhere nice just the 2 of us. I booked the restaurant as I had read very good reviews on trip advisor. We Arrived at the restaurant and waited a few minutes by the door for someone to show us our table. When the waiter eventually saw us he he just waved over saying sit anywhere which I found quite rude. We then waited 15 minutes for someone to ask us if we wanted a drink and I had to ask for the menus. in this 15 minutes I saw that the waitress was being quite attentive to fellow diners, she kept asking them if they wanted drinks so we thought we would give them the benefit of the doubt. We ordered our food which to be honest could not be faulted, they were big portions and cooked perfectly. We were not asked again if we wanted more drinks yet the other diners were being asked (it seemed to me that they were regulars) we were being completely ignored. The waiter kept looking over to see if we were finished so I asked for another drink. Once we finished our mains the plates were taken and that was it! we were not asked if we wanted desserts or coffees, the waiter just kept talking to the other guests so we asked for the bill, paid and left. The decor wasnt great but it had a homely Italian feel and because we have Italian family we would have definately brought them here but we were given such awful service. If the service was good then I would rate 5 out of 5 as the food was lovely. Overall very disappointing.

Read about the company that runs this chain and decided to visit the restaurant hidden in a side street behind Victoria Railway Station, London. The large dining room is neatly diveided up into sections giveing diners in some areas a certain priveacy. The menu is extensive although the desserts are geared to satisfy western tastes. I ordered a claypot chicken that was generous in size with plenty of varying tastes. My companion chose three dim sum and was pleasantly surprised by the inclusion of a sea bass a miso dim sum. All three were deemed of good quality.No room for dessert after enjoyable main course. If you go with an open mind and not expecting a tradition Chinese restaurant then this establishment should be found good value.
This bar is excellent great food, great beer very relaxed atmosphere and the staff are great nice and friendly super !!
Once again a lovely meal with value that cannot be beaten locally. Good service good food and good fun!
consistently good and excellent value. A must visit restaurant. Brilliant staff and easy to find at Trafalgar Square end of Whitehall

Four of us decided to pop into Henrys for lunch yesterday. One thing they did have is helpful friendly staff hence a star. There were nowhere near enough of them. Service was painfully slow. I had the worst Long Island iced tea ever. More like rum and coke. I gave that up went for a brandy with ice, by the time it Arrived the ice had melted giveing me a brandy and cold water. The avocado in the salad was tasteless mush and the tomato lifeless and dry, probably been sitting around for ages. The scampi was dry and mainly overdone breadcrumb. Think I will give this a miss in future. Steve L
If you're around in Spitalfields go to have a break and enjoy some glutenfree bakery with a good coffee... don't miss it

ive been here a couple of times now and the service is never great but last week was ridiculous. The food was so slow coming out (we were in there for 3.5hour for lunch), when it finally did come out we were missing a meal which did not arrive until we had asked three separate members of staff followed by the manager and even then it didn't come out for about 30mins by which time everyone else on the table had finished eating. We saw this happen to other tables in the restaurant too. You had to ask for everything at least three times to get it- sauces, water etc. The waiting staff didnt seem to have a clue what they were doing. We did get offered some free prosecco as an apology which was appreciated but I won't be going back! It's a shame as the food is good (when it finally arrives!)

As usual having my morning coffee at Balans is a extension of my home. Whether there is one other table seated or a queue at the door i am always treated as welcoming customer if not an old friend .The staff are friendly and attentive to my every need ,even changing my ashtray after ever butt has been put out .I now even have my client meetings here as i know the staff and supervisors will be professional at all times. As for trying to keep this secret of a home away from home to myself i now tell my own customers where to go for a relaxing lunch or a cheeky cocktail .Well done guys .
TGI's is one of my favourite restaurants so always impressed. The one in Covent Garden was nice but cocktails wasn't the best. Food was very nice, can't go wrong with a jack Daniels chicken :) Thanks
I so wish we had Arrived before 11.30 and had made a reservation as the menu looked brilliant.Such a beautiful place inside. We had a great coffee at the bar.Would love to go back and eat here....

If Villa Bianca was a car, it would be a vintage Merc soft-top. Flawless service - it caters for the posh of NW3 admirably. Unimpeachable food too. It's possible the formality might put you off - you'd not want to turn up here in shorts with a rucksack - but it's class trad Italian food done on rails.
Food was nice but very pricey for what you are getting. I guess you are paying for the fact that this after all is Selfridges!

I chose the Park Terrace to hold an afternoon tea party to celebrate my 30th birthday. I was given the priveate dining room for this, which was perfect for my group of 30 people. From the organisation to the actual occasion, I received dedicated and professional service. The staff kindly made me place cards which were arranged just as I had asked on beautifully dressed tables. The tea, sandwiches and cakes were all delicious and plentiful and the staff looking after us were so helpful and polite. I could not have had a better venue to hold my party and my guests all seemed to have a good time too!

Although not a vegetarian, I will continue to come here on my visits to London. The food is of a high standard and good value, the staff very friendly. Well worth a visit. You can't book ahead and it tends to be busy, possibly due to the large student population nearby, but ive not had any problems getting seated. Can be a bit noisy, mainly with people talking, but it seems to add to the ambience.

Have always wanted to visit this magnificent and historic ship. In the end went by coach with 20 or so other people. The weather was glorious and against the blue skyline the Cutty Sark looked regal. Much bigger than I thought but it certainly is impressive. An amazing piece of history which can be explored from port to starboard at your leisure. Definitely recommend a visit to this great ship.

If you are hungry, also in the late evening, this is one of the best place in soho where you can find good food at a very convenient price. The main dish is ramen and you have a whole menu with ramen options. Delicious!!

This restaurant is part of a chain, offering mainly Japanese dishes. The range of choice is impressive, and service is fast and pleasant. The one downside is that when it is crowded, the noise is extreme. Nothing wrong with people having a good time, but the walls and ceiling are bare, and do nothing to muffle the sound. Wooden tables with only paper mats don't help dim the racket. Impossible to have a conversation without needing to shout, but when everyone shouts the noise gets even worse.

We came upon this place by accident, but when we saw the menu we thought this was a good choice to have a nice evening meal. The restaurant is supposed to appear as a French brasserie, but this I felt was a bit far fetch.We got a table in the middle of the restaurant which was a bit of a nuisance as it was difficult to have a proper conversation. On the other hand the ambiance was great and our waiter a South-African gentleman was fantastic. He was very attentive and even attempted to speak with us in our own language. He took our order very quick and extremely efficient and the food came out very quickly afterwards. The quality of the food was very good and the price was very modest as well. All in all a good restaurant and a great experience.

Went in with my son and friend to get them a quick burger. Service was really slow for a Saturday. I think they were recovering from lunch time rush and preparing for the evening. Find it surprising that they don't offer a childrens menu so we had to order from the main menu. The burgers were ok but not exceptional. ive tasted better. The Oreo milkshakes were delicious but took about half an hour to make. Overall ok but for a place that specialise in burgers they were average.

The service was so lovely! Staff were so nice and we got our table really quickly! The cocktails are absolutely amazing you should definitely try Peach Crush! You should also try the deluxe burger which is absolutely amazing. I will also recommend the deserts.

Visited last weekend with my boyfriend, was a lovely relaxed atmosphere in the afternoon with a lovely lunch (if slightly overpriced). In the evening there was an acoustic guitarist playing which was just lovely. Would definitely recommend for couples or small groups.

This is the revised edition I made a stupid error for which I am very sorryI visit this restaurant when I go to the O2, it's a short bus ride from the venue. The food is fresh Tom does not believe in microwaving or cooking from frozen. (and I owe him an apology for not proof reading the last review I wrote, I removed it and edited it immediately when I found I'd caused offence, a lesson learnt)this is it Tom's food is organic and probably the best value around. The atmosphere relaxed and welcoming. The great thing is the value, piping hot food and the service simple and charming. I have a table booked for another visit when I see Fleetwood Mac with a group of friends. The legendary lamb shanks are on order.

Amazing sauce on Spaghetti Bololgnese, rich in flavour, I had breaded chicken with mine, so much food... But lovelyMums Sea bass was very very nice, we'll presented and she is hard to please... All in all, this trip was a spur of the moment because mum wanted to eat and the sun was shining down on the reasturant, the doors were open and people were smiling.Lovely x

A very good atmosphere, excellent service from a very professional restaurant. The chefs have acquired very good skills I would have to say the best food in Chingford and the best hospitality in the whole of E4 area.

We ordered two meals and drinks. We had refills before before we received our food so the service was slow. When we received our food it was worth the wait was really tasty. The reason I gave it a 3 is that the service was slow, the toilets were really smelly and unclean (smelled like strong pee), and the menus and table felt quite sticky.Definitely worth going for the food though.
Great restaurant. Fantastic pizza if you like authentic Italian! Bring your own wine! What else could you ask for. I go at least once a week!

I live in Greenwich and if I'm ever stuck for something to do on a Sunday night or have friends visiting or a date lined up, I always take them here.I think the pub has a great vibe about it and the Sunday night pub quiz is just terrific!! Tip : book at table if you plan on taking part in the pub quiz.

The food we both had was superb (beetroot soup followed by steak), cooked very well and really hot. Waitress was definitely not angling for a tip, she barely spoke or smiled. And when we saw a mouse running across the restaurant and the response was totally nonplussed, we decided this venue was not for us.

This restaurant is owned by 3 Italian brothers from the South of Italy. It was really like having a great meal in Italy. Great food, really friendly service. They also have a deli on the Fulham Road which I would also recommend. I strongly recommend this restaurant. Also, I think they are planning something for the world cup rugby games so it would be a good place to watch a match!

Very handy location for a quick beer and snack at lunch time around Liverpool Street area. Fine choice of beers although no Draft Guiness. They offer a nice scotch egg and pickle and good pork pies, sandwiches and a good selection of nuts. Does not get crowded, no background music so a good venue for a business lunch

There is plenty of competition around here but I feel this place I streets ahead of the nearby offerings - not too big, not too noisy good amount of bar space and a menu which is not too long but has a good offering of veg fish and meat.We had a 1200-1330 table - the place was just about full by 1300.I had an excellent salad followed by swordfish teak and absolutely faultless courgette 'frites' - I would go back for those alone.This is my new two minute walk from the office lunch destination - thoroughly enjoyed.

ive always been a Jamie's fan, specially because of his simple yet delicious approach of food and cooking. Food doesn't have to be fancy to taste good. Union Jack is all that at a nice corner of Covent Garden. Great food (if you have a chance, try the sausage or the mushrooms for appetizers and the empire chicken for main course) and the most lovely and joyfull staff. A curious yet lovely space is the restrooms. Located at the underground, the place have such a great decor.
Excellent service from our waitress Sanne, who was friendly and efficient. The meal was above average but I found the lamb curry a little too salty for my tastes.

Ee have been here several time to have linch or dinner, yesterday we had an aperitive with one guava, another juice with carrot , prawn cracker and cashew nut cooked in the pan woth some spices. Service fast and drinks amazing. It is not the last time we went there!

If I had been reviewing this as myself only, I would have been full of praise but I have to reflect the meal as a whole so I have had to downgrade slightly.First off, first impressions are great. Very pleasant man on the door to open for customers and the first few people we met were extremely genuine and friendly. Rooms themselves are grand and fantasticly decorated. Certainly not your run of the mill establishment.Service was friendly if not a bit rushed. Were told on arriveal that we had a two hour slot and the starters coming out were quick but the turnaround between starter and main was incredibly quick. One second starter was being taken and literally straight out were mains! Not ideal, would like to have had some time to spend between courses - generally felt like they we're working to the clock more than to customers needs.Meals: my food was incredible, my co-diners not so much. My starter was the mackerel salad which was one of the best salads I have ever eaten. I could have had plates and plates of it. Fresh, vibrant and we'll balance. We also had a smoker salmon starter which was basic and generally underwhelming. Mains, again, my partridge was beautiful and cooked to perfection. Find sometimes that restaurants can skimp on the meat itself but not the case here. Meat was the seat of the show. My companion had the gratin of rabbit which he thought wasnt quite balanced enough and possibly needed a touch of something sweeter to set it all off. On the side we had roast potatoes whilst nice were very very pricy at 4.50 for 4 bits of roast potato, very disappointing value there. Desserts, mines was a beautiful chocolate and espresso tart and companion had the rum baba which he found too strong and overpowering (yes, he knew what to expect, but has had much better previously). Lovely cocktail bar upstairs and bathrooms lovely also.All in all, I would highly recommend, not so much my co-diner
2nd visit to this beautiful restaurant. Venue, staff, food and atmosphere very good.Not too expensive compared to similar restaurants. Would highly recommend.

Spent nearly a full afternoon here with friends and not once were we rushed or made to feel we had to hurry up and leave. Lovely server who was attentive but not obtrusive. Good food and even better drinks. The blueberry mojitos amazing.

I'm neither vegan nor veggy but I am a GOOD FOOD EATER.... this doesn't need a long song and dance ... CHIPS to die for, portion was very generous. Hellumi burger very nice but the .... chocolate beetroot coconut cream dessert - IMMA-BE-BACK -FOR-DAT !!! ( more than one more time)

Pricey but good food in a buzzing atmosphere and stylish venue. It's nice to be talked through the uncooked steaks on a board and to talk about differences, sauces, how cooked and so on. 4 out of 5 of ours were cooked as requested and they offered to replace the other (though she opted for a free dessert instead). It's not cheap, and it's easy to get carried away with extras and end up with a hefty bill - we hit £100 a head without trying hard!!

Really lovely food and Daniel the manager was exemplary. From the moment we Arrived in the small intimate establishment we were made to feel welcome. Melt in the mouth food and exciting variety in the courses as well as superb saki. Cannot wait to return for another special occasion.

Mmm definitely recommend eating here. The tables are big squares where you sit on a corner which is good for two or three. Alessia my waitress was very pleasant, attentive and made excellent recommendations. I liked the incense but this might put some off I guess. The atmosphere was good. Had duck massaman curry and squid starter. Apparently squid is best seller and can understand why, was gorgeous and worth a trip alone. The curry was nice and potato-ish with sticky rice. A delicious meal and will go back and try other things.

I booked this restaurant for an early Mothers Day gift and to benefit from the views. There was an a La carte menu, set lunch menu and a 5 course taster menu to choose from. We both had the set lunch menu at £39.95. The food was very well presented and really tasty, it was perfect! I really enjoyed the red wine that I had by the glass too. The staff were all very attentive and informative and helped with any questions or menu choice options.

Took my sister for champagne afternoon tea, however they forgot the champagne. Sandwich selection very basic quality, cold scones with one curl of cream between two people, two cakes on top tier, not adequate at all. I have had AT at approx. 30 different venues & this was by far the worst experience. We were also freezing cold too. Never again!

We visited Elliot's Cafe for the first time on Saturday. The booking system had worked well, and when we Arrived the restaurant was half full, so we had choice of tables. Whilst the ambiance is pleasant and functional, like many small venues the table sizes are tiny. The service and food were very good and our waiter took great care to explain to us about the potions and how we should order, he was also very helpful with the wine selection. The food itself was excellent and as we ordered a number of plates it came to the table in appropriate intervals. As the produce is sourced locally (Borough Market) The menu changes on a daily basis, but what ever we chose was good. As is the norm in London the wine prices are high, and while the quality is excellent, the price added almost 33% to the total. Over all we enjoyed it and would go back again. One small complaint, the seating needs to be changed as the light fabric looks worn and dirty.

We have been to many HoH Timeout Bottomless brunches both here and in Old Compton St and for the first time we left a little bit disappointed. There was no main, the delivery of the food was haphazard, the room was cold and some of the food likewise. Whilst the prosecco was reasonably free flowing, there were only 2 waiting staff working the ground floor front room which is 2 too few IMO, so they struggled to keep us topped up and keep the food flowing too. Probably won't be returning until I hear of a marked improvement.

I had my engagement party here a couple of years ago just before they refurbed the back bit. They was nice enough to let us play music off our phone and they didn't rush us out at closing.Nice garden as well but found half our party was outside smoking all night which was a bit frustrating. Let us let off some candle lanterns in the garden (not sure if they actually knew) however they flew straight into the neighbours tree's lol...... ooopsBeen back a few times since and will keep going back. Quite pricey but matches the area

Slightly disinterested service. I was disappointed that the pudding chocolates Arrived long after the coffee had been served. I had to ask for it.Decent burger, but for 15 pounds the serving was small.
Nice Lebanese restaurant in Marylebone where we look forward to dining. Somewhat off on this occasion with an inattentive waitstaff and missing courses.

We visited during a trip to the capital on a rare sunny day, 4 adults and 4 children. The doorman was very helpful in accommodating our large group at a busy time and we soon seated. The food came fairly quickly but some things were missing from dishes, this was rectified quickly by staff. The food was nice but a little pricey although the junior meal deal was good value. Overall it was ok but probably wouldn't return as one of our party is a coeliac and was ill the day after (having only eaten own packed lunch the rest of the day).

Booked a set meal and although the portions weren't big, the taste and presentation of the food was superb. The service was excellent and to be able to watch the birds catching their lunch made it a very memorable experience for all of the right reasons.

Unfortunately the visit to Stuzzico was not a very thrilling experience. The restaurant itself is clean and does have atmosphere but I had expected more, especially compared to the prices they charged.

efficient service over a busy tuesday lunch! great experience from the start: the host at the door was very nice and welcoming and brought us to our table promptly. we have ordered mains,side and a dessert with coffee. the salmon and the the special were phenomenal and full of flavours and by looking around other tables im sure others were thinking the same! the waiter was very knowledgeable and smiley; i liked he kept on checking on us throughout lunch. we didnt feel rushed but actually enjoyed the buzz,music and atmosphere overall. will definitely recommend and come back in the near future.

Went in for a snack. We were told that if we ordered a bottle of wine, at any price, the sharing platter for two was free! It was wonderful. Lots of tasty fresh food and good size portions. The waitress was delightful and the service was excellent. I would certainly recommend it and return.
Really nice place to have a lunch. The view is breath taking and the food is on really high level, had a nice sauterness as well
I booked a table for 10 for my birthday. The services was Amazing, the food was Delicious and the atmosphere took me back to Marrakech! Higherly recommended little gem in Tooting!!

Excellent food. It is a place where the food is the main focus. A sober and simple place where the food is of a great quality. No useless decoration, the energy just goes to serve the right food. Cash is king.
Lovely food, wine and service at the Bistro One Ninety. Couldn't fault it! Really nice cosy dining room with a good value pre-theatre dinner menu.
It is not always easy to find inexpensive food in London, but Pret is an excellent place to grab a quick sandwich or drink for a reasonable price.

Popped in here with a friend for a quick pint. Excellent range of beers, friendly staff and a wide-ranging bar with plenty of seating space. Highly recommend and want to go back soon to spend a lively Friday/Saturday evening.

been there many times and i did noticed how poor is the service and how expensive they become! dont forget that this is a place were you get your food re-heated in a microwave, service is very poor expecially when there are only girls in charge. way to expensive for eating on stall, not very friendly.

Oh how i loved their food. Their tomato cheese croissant is to die for. For the little time i stayed in London, i mostly ended up having the same. It was so affordable and so damn tasty. Oh how i miss it. I wish i could find such tasty croissants here in India.

Been back to the Imperial again on a very sunny day and again they didn't let me down.Anton the manager was remembering my name from my previous visit which is very impressing.It was very busy but the service was spot on and my main course mussels just delicious.Especially their service is matching to a top end restaurant and their food is simple locally sourced and delicious.My wife also enjoyed her roast pork belly very much.Her only complaint was it was a big portion so she didn't have any space for dessert.Definetely recommended!!!

This was a special treat for some special occasions I have always wanted to eat in the famous and very grand restaurant. I was not disappointed. The meal was delicious, beautifully presented and the wait staff when bringing food were superb and entertaining to watch. They move at a fast pace and play their roles well. The entertainment and dancing were excellent and we were very comfortable on the dance floor. I rated this occasion a 4 instead of 5 because there were a few slight disappointments. When the booking was responded to by The Ritz, it noted that we had a good table. (There are not really any bad tables!) However our table was close the to serving entry, too large for a party of 4 so we could not really have a close conversation, and the singer was not in our view as pillars were in the way. Also, we requested an after dinner drink but even though there were many waiters, none followed up with service . Perhaps one waiter per table, instead of many would have seen us get our last drinks. Overall, a fabulous night out and well worth the money as a one off for tourists from Australia.
Always wonderful! The food is excellent and so is the service. I always enjoy coming here when I am in London.
Pret a Manger was near by our hotel in paddington central so we often went there for a nice bagel sandwich and coffee. cosy and delicious!

I'm a fan of Yo Sushi, and have been to quite a few across the UK - always enjoy them. The outlet in Selfridges lets the side down, and some. Having passed Rocked up at 6pm on a Saturday and there was no queue, and no one eating in there - should have read more into that. No buttons to press for service, so I asked how it worked. The waitress said, 'you'll have to catch my eye,' and walked off. From there-on-in I didn't catch any part of her at all, as I never saw her again, so I ordered from the chef. However, said 'Chefs' were bumbling around, chatting, and doing alot of nothing. I ordered a Chicken Katsu Curry and waited 25 mins (not sure why, there was only me and my daughter in there) only to be given pumpkin something or other. WRONG. 5 mins later I got the katsu. It was disgusting. Bits of rice floating in a thin soup of watery sauce that filled the bowl up to the brim, with 3 bits of dried up Katsu chicken. Now, if you know how Yo Sushi serve their Katsu, it's not like that! If that had been my first experience of Yo Sushi I would NEVER be going there again. Needless to say, I asked for the bill and left without complaint, as I wouldn't have wanted anything else from there and just wanted to leave. It's kind of embarrassing for such an opulent and upmarket store to house something that lets it down so badly.

Wonderful afternoon spent celebrating a birthday. Bit concerned when realised that another very large party had to be catered for, but the staff worked tirelessly and provided a first class service. Thoroughly recommended.

Me and My family were visiting Cote Muswell Hill 4 times so far for last 1 year and I can't say bad word for this site. The staff is always very helpful and careful, attentive and positive, doesn't matter that my daughter is very naughty and was making mess all the times. Definitely kids friendly place. Food is well presented, very tasty even we always have different stuff from the previous times. I never had a dish so far which doesn't match my criteria for taste. Good wine and even better desserts. Affordable prices for French orientated restaurant. Nothing more to say, just big THANK YOU and see you again in near future.

I had lunch at the Oxford Street branch with my wife on 8th July. This was my second visit: the first was at 12:30 - very busy restaurant, attentive service, excellent food. The second was later, around 3 pm, towards the end of the lunchtime service. The restaurant was quiet. Fortunate really, since they had no record of my booking. Our starters were excellent - beef carpaccio and calamari. The mains were painfully slow to arrive - my wife's pescatora eventually Arrived, my pizza did not. Since the waiter made no comment I assumed that it was on its way. After five minutes being studiously ignored by the waiting staff, I got up and button-holed one of them who went off to find it. The pizza Arrived with a mumbled comment that pizza takes a long time to cook. Really?! Assuming that both mains were prepared at the same time, my pizza was twenty minutes in the oven. The waiter returned to announce that, since they had let us down, coffee would be free of charge. Following dessert and after another struggle to attract somebody's attention to get the bill, there was the cost of the coffee, large as life on the bill. Since life is too short, we paid up and complained afterwards, and they gave us a voucher for 20 per cent discount on our next visit to Oxford Street. Perhaps restaurant service generally flags towards the end of a session, but it should not. The cost of a restaurant meal covers the quality of ingredients, culinary skills, and service to present that food to the diners. The quality of the food was up to standard, it was cooked and presented perfectly, but the service staff were disinterested. They preferred to stand chatting in groups rather than raise their eyes and attend to their customers

We all like the little pigeon wings here (too small to be actually chicken wings) but man, could they train their waiters and waitresses to occasionally pay attention to the customers. We were there on a Sunday, not especially busy, seated quickly enough. And then... nothing. Eventually the waiter swung by and took our order, and this Arrived in a reasonable time. And then again... nothing. Days later the server returned and we ordered more. If you want to eat at Westfields, there are better choices. If you want to eat Thai, there are WAY better choices. But those wings... BTW similar service experience at Busaba in Covent Garden; Oxford street and Bicester experiences unremarkable.

I came here for a business lunch. Tasty food with a large menu. The warm madelines with ice cream for dessert were amazing ! Nice decor. Informal surroundings. Situated in a lovely new quiet park off Goodge Street. Good for a business lunch or meeting friends.
Quiet weekend with the students away. Service seemed disinterested. Poor real ale for the second consecutive visit.
Stopped in here for a late dinner, their burgers are so fine! Service was a bit on the slow side but our drink refills were on the ball! Friendly, cheerful staff

We went to this Little Frankies around 7pm so the pre-theatre rush was over. We got the booth in the window so we had a good view of Trafalgar Square.Service was prompt and our waitress was very pleasant. We shared a garlic pizza bread for our starter and had the grilled chicken in the pitta with fries, corn on the cob and coleslaw for our main, which is one of their new dishes and cheesecake to finish. all very nice, main course was large and brought to our table piping hot.We use Frankie and Benny's a lot so we find it reasonable but even better we had a £10 0ff voucher when you buy 2 man courses. Only one negative, we think they should offer refillable soft drinks on main menu not just on lunch menu.We will visit this restaurant again.

The mussel-based broth is specific to this restaurant and delicious and complex. I haven't had this broth anywhere else in other western ramen joints. The noodles are a perfect consistency. I prefer to have some extra pork on the side and they make a beautifully tender flaking version. Their egg yolk is nicely runny. The place is friendly and reasonably basic. ive been many times and ive never had a bad experience - consistently delicious.

I can' believe such a rude waiter in a resturant in londonThe food was terrible we ordered mixed grills for 4 of us , all the kebabs were tasteless and not cooked in perfection,Dessert ( bamiya) wasn't fresh

Based on other friends coming here for afternoon tea and rating it highly we decided to give this a try for a family afternoon tea.We had an excellent 6 seater oval table that was in the middle of the restaurant. Due to its size it meant other diners tables weren't very close which was nice.The service was excellent throughout with the staff helpful and attentive. We ordered a mixture of the Vintage and Gentleman's afternoon tea. I think all of us felt there could've been been a few more savouries included that could've been at the expense of some of the cakes. The only other negative point was that some of the bread on the sandwiches at the end of each stack had started to go slightly hard and crispy which suggested to me it had been left to stand for a period of time. I know this happens quickly with bread, but given the volume of afternoon tea they serve I'm quite surprised it could start getting stale. It's a minor point.The food was very tasty and everyone really enjoyed both types of afternoon tea that was ordered. It's also reasonably priced. Service was relaxed and at no point did we feel rushed to leave when we'd finished the tea. I would definitely return.

The sushi and sashimi was mediocre. The rice was undercooked. The nori (seaweed) was stale and limp. The fish was ok. The Service was efficient and friendly. The prices were very good. Overall, It's ok to mediocre, but I wouldn't go out of my way to visit this place.As calibration, I am Japanese so maybe my standards for Japanese food is higher than regular visitors, so take my review with a grain of salt.

We ate here yesterday and it was lovely - a great pit stop while out shopping with my mum, we had pizza which was diveine, sides and some very moreish cocktails. Yes it is a busy venue but what else do you expect in the centre of Covent Garden near the street entertainers? Service was quick, but we were not hurried and the staff were lovely. Yes toilets are in the basement of the bar but this is really not an issue. We will definitely return.

Booked through 'Bookatable' free flowing prosecco deal. Very good service,constant topping up of the wine glasses! Shame it was a rainy day which meant the views weren't the best & the boat swayed a little but the food was good (we had crab mornay,beef & pork belly followed by ice cream sandwich & cheesecakes) & we got a free mini Benefit mascara...result!!

Four of us came to eat here after a visit to the Royal Albert Hall. Easy walking distance from the RAH. Beautiful surroundings on the edge of the hotel, we were greeted smoothly, coats and bags were taken and safely stored and then shown to our table in the stylish surroundings of the restaurant. The food for our evening meal and service was excellent although the choice was not huge. The wine was rather expensive-the cheapest bottle being £24 and overall the meal was quite dear but not for the good quality of food and presentation I suppose.If it is for a special occasion I would recommend it but for your average meal - no.

eat friday lunchtime had a nice fish dish recommended by the waitress, stone bass. never had it before was delicious. service funky and different, warm welcome and thanks on leaving with be back when next in london.

No wait and given Jamie's Italian usually has consitantly good food we looked forward to a good meal.The atmosphere was fantastic, the service was good, but unfortunately the food was less than average, with over-cooked steak and burnt salmon. On leaving the restaurant and seeing the street vendors amazing food I really regretted the dinner choice.Although childrens meal was a good value and good tasting pizza, and the soft drinks were refreshing and unique
The food is halal and feels really like home! If you are in London, do drop by the place. It is side by side to a halal cafe too!! ;-)

We hired the R.S Hispaniola out for our company summer party. The best summmer party we have ever organised ! The BBQ was very nice, and all the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I would recommend this venue to anyone

Bland pizza with a cardboard feel to it.The staff sneakily overcharge you for "tomato sauce" on the pizza.I assume that they don't expect people coming back so they try to squeeze as much as possible from customers.

Absolutely terrible place. My husband and I went last December and both of us left with food poisoning. We thought that this was just unlucky and tried it again tonight for his 36th birthday - hoping that we wouldn't be so unfortunate. We waited 15 mins before anyone took our order and then another 45 mins for the food to arrive. We only ordered main meals and no sides. Other tables who had come after us were being served and when we questioned it- we were told it was coming. When the food Arrived mine was inedible. The veg was limp and mashed potato was so dry I had to cut it with a knife. They had clearly sent out my husband's burger with another order and had stuck mine under the heat lamp to keep it warm/continue cooking it. I have never sent food back before but I did not hesitate. I would not have fed it to my dog. My husband's burger was average but by then he was so hungry I think he would have eaten anything. If I were him- I would have sent that back too. We will never come back to this hovel. It was dirty and the service was terrible. The music was so loud, we could hardly hear each other speak and there was a bogie on the wall next to where I was sat. The food was terrible and hugly overpriced. AVOID THIS AT ALL COST!

6 of us went to eat at this restaurant last Saturday. We had a table booked for the 8.30 sitting. On arriveal at 8.20 we were told it would be at least 20 minutes as the 6.30 booking sitting at our table hadn't finished yet. The manager did seem a bit harassed at the time. We did eventually sit down around 8.50 ish. After we placed our orders a big group of about 20 people came and sat at the table next to us and the noise from this table was deafening, one particular chap could only speak by bellowing like a megaphone. If the manager knew he had a large booking he should have informed us on arriveal so we could have made an informed decision on whether we stayed or not.Throughout the meal we all had trouble hearing and speaking to each other because the noise was so loud.On to the food, as mentioned most of it was good but the service was not. You expect to get your main course and the rice within a few minutes of each other, this did not happen. The manager was not having a good evening and when we pointed things out to him he either didn't understand or chose not to understand and in his non understanding part just told not to bother paying the bill.This was not what we wanted but just a reasonable understanding of what our evening had been like.We left paying nothing

We went for a bottomless brunch and had a lovely morning sitting outside in the sunshine. I think the weather helped to soften the negative aspects of the Exhibit though. If we'd had to sit inside, we maybe wouldn't have enjoyed it as much.Pros: + very friendly and efficient staff who get the balance right between serving without harassing + good range of food, including for vegetarians+ fresh ingredients and pretty tasty+ not stingy with the Prosecco! Some places claim to be 'bottomless' but then you struggle to get more than one glass. Here they top up reasonably regularlyCons:- It is very expensive for what you get. I had poached eggs and avocado on toast which cost £8, but you only get one slice of toast and a very thin amount of avocado & salsa. - The fry up is almost £10 but again the portion size is very small for the price. - Benedict Royale was £8.50 and again you only get one slice of toast and a very tiny amount of salmon. It meant that even though the food was tasty and we had a nice time sitting in the sunshine drinking bubbles, we left feeling quite hungry. You wouldn't really expect that for a bottomless brunch. For 3 of us, it totalled £90, which is an extortionate amount for feeling hungry afterwards! That's £20 per head for the fizz, and approx £10 per head for the single plate of stingy food. Then the service charge pushes it up to £100. We're not expecting mountains of food, but they would need to sort out the portion sizes vs. price ratio for us to return

Myself and 2 friends booked a free flowing champagne afternoon tea here to celebrate our joint 50th birthdays! We were greeted in a friendly manner even though we were a little early, we were sat in the comfy bar and given bellinis to get the party started!! Once shown to our table the waitress explained the menu and left us to decide what we wanted whilst our first glass of champagne was poured and it kept on coming, completely unprompted by us! We chose the gentlemen's afternoon tea, which was different and delicious - the cakes/desserts were fantastic! The cost was £36.50 and is excellent value for money!!
The staff was friendly and helpful. We ordered the fish and chips from their classic menu; the fish was fine, the fries not great. All in all okay but not a place to put on your "must do" list.

We ate in the bar/brasserie (?) section adjacent to the main restaurant, as I made a booking error, and it was full. Nonetheless the food was still great, and the service very good - attentive, friendly and not obtrusive. It was a serene setting as well. My only issue was the the wine was expensive for what was on offer. Also, while it wasn't an issue for us on the night, it did not seem that wine was available by the bottle (I might be mistaken). A solid recommendation however.

For some strange reason I decided I wanted a really good burger and chips for Sunday lunch! I was actually en route to another highly recommended (by Time Out London) burger place that is very close by. The menus outside Reform caught my I and I liked the look of choices. Then I spotted their burger and chips. Devon Ruby beef and Keene's Cheddar (both excellent quality ingredients I recognise) were shown. I went in and asked if they were doing their full menu or just Sunday lunch menu (no burger and chips). The helpful lady on the desk said they were only doing the Sunday lunch menu. I said I was only interested in the burger and chips - she then offered to check with the kitchen if they would oblige - good news!I was shown to my table in the characterful dining room. I was asked how I wanted the burger cooked which is always a good sign in my view. The burger was delicious. Perfectly cooked, juicy, full of flavour and well seasoned. The chips were great too - crispy outside but fluffy in the middle. All washed down with a very agreeable glass of Chilean Pinot Noir (which I wouldn't have got at my original destination!).This may seem a lot of bother for a burger and chips BUT really good burgers are a different ball game to McD's or BK. Think... A Lada is a car and a Rolls Royce is a car...!Yes I would go back to try something else at the Reform. If they take that much care over burger and chips, I would hope the other menu items are of a similar quality.

I have been there twice in the evenings. On both occasions the service was attentive and the sommelier was knowledgeable about the wine in general and how the wines mixed with the menu.The place has a combination of formal tables for dinner and more informal 2x2 high chaired tables for wine and snacks. Overall it provides an excellent environment to meet up or hold business meetings. Definitely likely to return.
The pretty near perfection and not 150% perfect is that my patner and I had to wait 30 seconds after we Arrived to be asked what we wanted to drink

This is a small but high quality sushi option near Middlesex University in Hendon. The fish is fresh and the chefs create some very great special items in addition to the items on the menu. Service is adequate and the pricing are in line with the food quality.

Dining at Bill's is a very pleasant experience. The layout is good, the food is very good and the staff are excellent from the moment you ask for a table until the bill is paid. With so many other choices (and many different cusines) to choose from in Soho, Bill's offers a good choice of both starters and main courses. The tortilla chips were fab, though the lemon feta in the lamb burger tended to overpower te flavour of the burger. The wine choice is good and was not hugely expensive and using recycled catering tins as the cooler was a smart idea. Although the restaurant was busy, we didnt feel pressured to eat and move on as you do in some other places. Overall, a fine find and a good place to find well cooked food.
Had a meal with family. First impressions not good due to soiled menus, but the food was good, and service attentive. Reasonably priced.

The food was great so well done to the Chefs. The customer service was very poor, went with friends our orders were mixed up, the waitress and manager offered no apology and blamed the mistake on one of my friends saying "well it's not our fault u haven't got your food as your friend came late and she took your order" my thinking was even if that's the case my order is different as she ordered hers without bacon and mine was with bacon so her taking my order is totally incorrect. The whole meal the manager spent chatting up 2 of my other friends and neglected to do his duties. The attitude from the waitress and manager on duty that night was very bad and can be portrayed as ethic minorities are treated as just that "Minorities"! The waitress and manager should focus on their duties as we are all paying customers and stop treating others differently because of their race or ethnicity!!!!! Will never dine at this burger and lobster location again!!!
We ate pasta , pizza and risotto. All of them is so good!We enjoyed so much.The staff who working here is so kind. I would like to go again.

We had reserved a table for four for 7:30pm on Saturday. One member of our party was almost 2 hours late but all the time we sat and waited we were made to feel very welcome by the cheery staff. The menu offered plenty of choice, the starters and main courses were all of excellent quality and well presented and the chocolate mousse was diveine. We had a minor problem with the white chocolate sauce that accompanied the frozen berries as it had separated a little. We pointed this out rather than complained but the waiter immediately replaced the sauce and gave us complimentary desserts by way of apology. This level of customer care in a chain restaurant is uncommon these days. We will definitely return.

After wandering around Covent Garden we decided to try Union Jacks. It would have been nice to sit outside as the atmosphere was great, but after being told we had a 10/15 min wait we decided to go downstairs. We sat at the underneath the stairs, which was a bit out of the way, but fine for us. We had fish and chips and the Margaret pizza, both were really tasty and very filling. We contemplated having a dessert, but the waitress left us waiting for over 10 mins without coming back, so I flagged someone else down and just asked for the bill. Amazing the amount of restaurants that seem to forget about you after you have finished your main course. 3.5/5.
Nice little pub. Food was good. Enjoyed watching people come in and visit, did get crowded in the evening. Really enjoyed the atmosphere.

Met a friend for drinks and food. It is a lovely old fronted building wi lots of rooms. For starters we chose the olives, and the selection of bread. We received a dichotomy of an enormous bowl of extremely salty but tasty marinated olives, and a basket of three small, dry bread rolls, which had clearly been finished off in the oven but not heated through properly, so they were both tepid and dry. We couldn't eat more than a few olives because they were so salty so we sent them back, and should have done the same with the bread really. We chatted to the waited about the food afterwards and he said they had raised the issue of the paltry bread portion with higher management before and they wouldn't budge, which made me wish we had sent it back. So if any higher management are reading this, 100% of the starters we tried were disappointing. We each had the butternut squash etc salad, which was good; quite leafy. My friend's rhubarb creme brÌÈlee was good, as was my rum n raisin ice cream with an inexplicably pink biscotti. We rounded off the meal with a port each, and happily the barman didn't know that port is served in measure smaller than wine, so we got about 175ml of port each for the price of a normal measure. This was nice. But a lot of port.

Great place for pre theatre dinner.Food very good and good choice on menu. Waiter asked what time we neede to be gone by which is a great idea so they can judge the timing of your course.very good wine list

We live 100 yds away from the Maynard and I wish it was just that bit better. I would certainly go more often if I could just have 1 good meal without fault.The Maynard has a lot of potential and it's intentions are fantastic. Unfortunately the food just falls short of the 'gastropub' image that just about every pub in the country claims to have.The drink is excellent, the bar staff are good and as a pub, the place ticks every box. The bar food/light bites are also very good and as a pub you can't go wrong!The food is almost always very well presented however it is very average in terms of taste and aside from its presentation and the odd dish is nothing more than average enough pub grub but certainly isn't 'gastro' in any respect. The food lacks that special something, it's good enough but you generally feel underwhelmed by itOne of the main waiters(dark hair) black t-shirt normally) in there is a little on the condescending side and if you ask for something (i.e a jug of water) it generally won't arrive until you have finished. When he asked if we enjoyed our meal , you answer 'yes', however I would have preferred my water with my meal you get told that you should have asked him again'- hardly the point. The waiting staff walk round very quickly avoiding eye contact. Cutlery is generally dumped on the table in paper napkins in the centre of the table- this is cheap and tacky.In so called gastropubs the staff wear uniforms or are at least are smartly dressed. Managers in the maynard seem to think that they have earned the right to wear a t-shirt and jeans - fine, but don't market yourself as upmarket if you are not going to make the effort.The tables are usually sticky and often you find yourself plonked in in the middle of the bar area around people drinking - this is the essence of dining in a pub and not so much in a gastropub where there would be some differentiation in seating; warning customers beforehand might be an idea.They could do with some more Sunday lunch staff too as they appear to be rushed off their feetThe Maynard needs to up its game on the restaurant side and add a little bit more finesse and refinement to the service and take a little bit more care with putting some of the items of food together. - overall, the place is average but one to keep an eye on as you might get a really good meal there one day but then be let down the next hence why I don't go anymore. I wish them luck with the business and hope that they manage to refine it every so slightly and I'll be back.
One of the best traditional restaurants in London. It's good to go to in the winter and at Christmas time, would recommend the roast beef.
Second time here and still love it. The location along the canal is just perfect for summer time. Staff are very friendly specially Virginie. My new favourite spot in Hackney.

This little restaurant cannot be faulted for excellent food quality, friendly and prompt service, and a well-heeled but mixed and fun clientele.The octopus was the best I have had. All other dishes were delicious too, we ordered 3-4 each and it was a feast.It's not cheap, we were approaching £50 per head but that included wine and a couple of glasses of sherry. Recommended for a treat.
This is a lovely little restaurant serving home made pizza at its best. The staff are all very friendly and there is a good atmosphere. I would definitely return. Excellent value for money.

The Old Dairy has a lovely atmosphere.We took our parents there for a meal to celebrate their 67th wedding anniversary and they absolutely loved it.A great wine list and something to suit everyones palette and taste. Amazing starters, steaks and good for the little ones as well.Service was a bit slow, but the food was worth the wait.I'd definitely recommend and return.

Wow! You can never eat the full desserts here as they're so big but they're delicious so you'll definitely try as they look amazing! The staff are attentive and the place is clean and nice inside. Desserts are well presented. Good customer service and very reasonably priced. I'll definitely be going again. Much, much better than Afters!
A feast for the senses and the palate. The cafe is beautiful and the presentation of the deserts for sale made you want to buy everything on the shelf!

The restaurant has been newly refurbished and is buzzy, beautifully decorated with a friendly atmosphere. The food was wonderful - great variety with good quality and generous portions. Service was very attentive. Our waiter Memo was very attentive without being overbearing. Nothing was too much trouble. We'll be back again soon. Such a lovely restaurant.
The Richmond was a pub in the east zone of London. Now is a fashionable oyster restaurant. Great tuna tartar and good wine list!

Should have knowing when I Arrived in about food as no one was eating. The service was good. The food was nice but not for the price. I ordered starter and main and it all Arrived together, which was disappointing. I had the stake sandwich which came out and I was wondering where the other half was. It's Defo not work the £9.95 as most other places is cheaper and bigger portions.
I have been here last week for a lunch time and was everything great. Me and my friends tasty the Neapolitan pizza. Hope they will open soon in Paris.

I returned to this pleasant restaurant after a two year absence and found it to be even better than last time. The atmosphere both inside and outside the place was buzzing with people having a good time. A few more eateries have opened nearby since my last visit and this has upgraded the area. I chose Chilli Beef Burrito accompanied by Skin on Fries, which was a good choice. I also had both the time and space for an Apple Crumble, which may sound a little ordinary but it was far from that. No wine this time so I washed it all down with a Diet Coke which was disappointingly, just like a Diet Coke! The meal was prepared quite quickly and was served by a charmingly polite and smiling waitress. A guitarist sang some pleasant songs without being intrusive.
Superb menus, great choice, brilliant service. Everything a restaurant should be. The atmosphere is great and the whole experience makes for a very special meal out.

We ate here. Had fish and chips and some sides with glass of red and white. All of it was so dissapointing. Wine was very sharp... food looked and tasted like it had been cooked the day before.So sad to see a nice pub go downhill or did we arrive on an off day?

I really had a great time her the other night. Meal was splendid! Great wine selection. Great Service. Dinner was just like dining in France but in London. So good booked again in September. Usually never do this but the other half demanded to be taken. Looking forward to it...

The first problem is that this restaurant is listed twice, once as Hardcore (with 100% good reviews, and on which I based my visit) and again as Hardcore Lobster and More but they are one and the same.It seems a nice, busy little restaurant although the service isn't noticeably friendly or quick and certainly the waitress wasn't prepared to help me make a choice.I had a pate of lobster, crab and prawn which was spicy and quite good, followed by the steak which was served as I ordered. The chips were really not special, neither was the salad. I maybe wish I had gone for lobster though I have no idea whether this was good.They do add on a service charge which I calculated as 12_ % so two courses and a glass of wine came out at a little over £30 which feels maybe a bit steep. Not sure if I'd give it another go.
Cheerful and happy little Thai restaurant by Victoria station. Good and prompt service from very friendly staff. Aubergine curry was delightful. Happily visit again.
Had breakfast here as part of my stay in the ajoining hotel! Can't complain ! massive selection! and helpful staff! my traditional breakfast buffet was very tasty !

What can I say, favourite burger place in London! For £9-£10 you can get a burger+ chips. The chips are sooo nice and the burgers are perfect. I like the cheeseburger with blue cheese, I always order that one. The service is always nice( been to more locations), the Camden branch is very small inside but you can eat at a mini bar outside as well. Our orders were taken very fast and the food was ready in about 10 minutes. Very impressed and I highly recommend it!

Drinks are too expensive when glasses are full of Ice Cubes. Burgers, Chicken, Nachos all great tasting and hot. Nearly too much to eat. Vegetables with the Chicken, broccoli, peppers and Beans were a little bit watery, no too tasty either. Fries superb.

The food was alright, nothing too special but good value for money. The service though was poor. I guess we got unlucky, as the waitress who initially gave us the table was very nice, but the waiter that served us all day was bored, grumpy and impolite. It was clear that he didn't want to be there and he didn't enjoy his job, not that it required any particular skills or effort anyways. A real pity, as the place looked nice, although the whole experience was ruined by a poor and crappy service. With all the choice there is in London, they really should put more effort in supplying at least an acceptable service.Avoidable.

We stopped at Ponti's for lunch on New Year's Eve before pantomime at London Palladium. Food delicious, fresh and tasty, all our meals great quality and quantity. Good menu choice. Waiters attentive and helpful. Definitely will return...

Having read good reviews on TripAdvisor thought we would try it for lunch. Big mistake. The food did not look appetising, there was a toilet odour about the place and the miserable 'elderly' man behind the bar was rude beyond belief. After a couple of minutes of the barman's mindless rudeness we decided to leave.

Nearly perfect ramenExcellent GyozaSuperb tastesExcellent presentationFriendly and helpful staffGood pricesRelaxed atmospherePlenty of roomClean tablesSuperb SakePerfect after a days shoping in the area

The service is excellent; The food even better;The atmosphere traditional English and a beautiful place for a meal. Rules has some of the most impressive English food to be found. It is well-known amongst the London elite and is London's oldest restaurant. I eat here every time I am in London. It is is Covent Garden down a quiet street so great atmosphere but also close to nightlife after your meal.Book reservations early as it is difficult to get last minute availability.Enjoy the food and atmosphere!

Went with a friend for lunch, we both wanted the burger but went for the healthier option, butternut squash salad. well ...... Maybe 100 calories !!! Just a plate of lettuce, 4 pieces of butternut squash and some sundried tomatoes. A complete rip off. I complained and a small plate of tomato and b/s was sent out. I must admit it was very tasty, but sooo overpriced for such a small amount. Also had to ask twice for a glass of wine.

I have eaten at the Goya, both Pimlico and Belgravia (now closed), for several years. Recently I took a group of ten people there for a leisurely dinner after an opera matinee.I find the combination of tapas and main meals excellent for such an occasion. I can order a selection of tapas to get everyone settled in, they can then take their time to look at the menu and select a few that they particulary like and then we can go for perhaps a paella which takes 30 minutes to cook. That way we can spread out the eating, thus making it better for the digestion and eating hot food whilst it is still hot.This visit was as good as any previously, we were well looked after and everyone enjoyed the food and atmosphere.

Came here for a pre-ballet dinner, we hadn't booked so didn't expect to actually get in but knew they offered a pre-theatre dining offer. The lady on the door was very helpful and got us in downstairs. The atmosphere was romantic and cosy. Waitress downstairs was excellent she was polite, friendly and very attentive. She noticed we had our theatre tickets so brought over complimentary 'kir royales'- really sums up how good her service was. The service was quick and the food was absolutely delicious. We had pate for starter- fresh, beautifully presented and yummy. For our mains we both chose the steak; it was fantastic. I had to eat slowly to savour every bit! Dessert was a creme caramel- not my sort of thing but my boyfriend loved it. The pre-theatre deal was also so reasonably priced and worth every penny. Would definitely recommend and eat here again.

Service was fine, however, be aware that if one person wants a tasting menu and the rest would like a la carte they won't do this. We were 4 and 2 wanted the tasting menu, we weren't allowed to until I asked to speak with a manager and said I understood their meal would take slightly longer. I was finally allowed to order what we wanted but felt they were doing me a favour. By the way, their menu didn't take much longer than ours. It put a huge damper on a birthday lunch when you are told what you can or can't order! Very disappointing!!
My husband and I ordered the half of chicken with lime and mango and it was delicious! The staff was very friendly and helpful.
This one is 2nd time I took pizza , both time was cold , without mozzarella and raw ... There are many other restaurant much better and less prices!

I always like to pop in in a Wetherspoon pub (I love the Ice Wharf in Camden Town, included the food) but this time was not the same.The place is AMAZING.And food comes in just 10 minutes!I think was an old cinema/theatre.BEAUTIFUL.But NO MUSIC AT ALL (seems to eat in an hospital or something like this).I mean put even a little little bit of low low music.But PUT IT!I took my Tennessee burger as usual and was not as good as the same in Camden Town.My boyfriend took half chicken and,the vegetables,were DISGUSTING.Horrible broccoli and carrots.I mean: what it takes to cook properly a couple of broccoli and carrots (sorry, I am a chef so....I know that it it EASY).I
we stoped by for lunch and found very delicious food . I loved the mint tea.. it was a great start for cold day. should try the Lamp, rice with safran, and nice breads..

Have been frequenting Yama Yama over the last year and although I was not overwhelmed on my first visit the subsequent visits have been fantastic. The quality of the food as well as the level of service has been top notch. The couple that run the restaurant always make sure we feel welcome.

Discovered that this restaurant was associated with another in Broadway Market only afterward but is probably even better than its sister version because it is or appears to be new. We all had different pizzas with one of us having grilled fish and all meals were eaten with pleasure since each was well presented and cooked. Attentive staff makes for a pleasant experience and of course being able to see the chefs working away and appearing to enjoy being there shows that there is a decent spirit in the place and this is reflected in the food.Very reasonable price also for what we had and will go again

Having spent a lot of time in Italy, especially in the South, I have eaten many pizzas! This restaurant makes authentic ones using fresh ingredients and they are delicious. Service was very friendly and efficient. Service charge is automatically added to the bil. Try it if you are near John Lewis Oxford Street.

Arrived with friends about 9 ish wanting a simple meal with friends. ive never been to a Strada before and I was pleasantly surprised. We received attentive service from the start even with us being outside. All staff made a fuss of our dog but actually didn't touch her as they were working. Drinks Arrived promptly and food followed. I opted for a seafood linguine perfectly cooked and ample portion without feeling too full, my boyfriend went for vesuvio and advised that it had a bit of a kick to it, the only downside it really didn't- so more chillies please!! Whole bill £100 so good value, fab service and very enjoyable food.

Ate here twice, enjoying both the roast chicken with pesto and the woodman pizza with a light but enjoyable Pinot. Prices reasonable, service excellent and the flavour profiles of the dishes were both creative and very enjoyable. The combination of English basics with international elements was playful and surprising to the palate. Both dishes were well prepared if a tiny bit over salted for my tastes. Only problem was watching the server do set ups on a number of adjoining tables. She held all the silverware in one hand like a bouquet of flowers and then placed each indiveidual piece on the table by grasping it firmly by the knife blade or fork tines. Given that she appeared to have a slight cold, I am wondering who she might have been spreading it to. A staff review of basic hygiene is called for.
Me and my girlfriend come here often as we live near by and find it excellent every time!The food is brilliant, service always spot on and price very reasonable!

I visited here with my mum recently. We were walking past and decided to give it a try. The service was fast and very friendly. The waiters enjoyed a bit of banter with us and the food was very tasty and fresh. Reasonably priced aswell. I will definately visit again.
The owner, Pierre was incredibly warm and welcoming without being over-bearing and treated us SO well. Lovely food, great coffee, AMAZING baklava! What a lovely experience...

After finding my favorite Italian place closed I step inside here as now I was in the mood for Italian. Seated quickly and the staff was efficient. Good choices from the menu and decent wine selection. This is a casual place that also serves flat breads (aka a form of pizza). A good choice if you are in the area.

Stumbled over this place when wandering around Carnaby street. Great atmosphere, great staff and even greater food. I had a salad that was so, so good with mango, coconut and avocado with jerk chicken. The staff made us very welcome and really enjoyed the evening.

Just had lunch there today and it was fantastic. Both of us had the pork belly - Arrived promptly, well presented and absolutely delicious. The potatoes were sublime but unfortunately only 3 small ones on the plate, yorshire was dry and relatively tasteless. Overall a very pleasant meal. The pub itself is a nice space with an eclectic range of music playing( Beyonce, Joy Diveision, Gary Numan) - good beer selection and a very young and dynamic staff who were very helpful i thought. Was very impressed overall. Only 4 stars due to cost and the addition of the optional service charge and because 5 stars needs to be truly spectacular. Will definitely be back again if in this neck of the woods.

After visiting the poppy memorial we headed for St Katherine's dock for a late lunch. We did not book anywhere, after visiting a Turkish cafe we felt their prices were too expensive and left. We visited Strada at around 4pm and were welcomed. I expected a predictable dining experience, however I was impressed with the offerings on the menu. and felt the kitchen catered for traditional and contemporary tastes. The burrata we enjoyed for starter( Italian cured ham, motzerello cheese on toasted bread) was lovely. For mains we enjoyed a saltimbocca ( pork fillet) and veal both were delicious. For dessert we enjoyed an almond tart They served a fantastic Sicilian cider and had excellent wine list. The service was excellent and the lunch , considering the location and somewhat captive market was not expensive. I will return again.

Entered the bar. Tried to order only drinks at the bar. Nice Irish lady very anxious for us to take a seat . Said no I will order at the bar. Said no 'take a seat,' Reason is they like to add a service charge for serving your drinks. Which if you got at the bar they would not get.. Now if I had ordered a meal would be no problem with giveing a tip..but this was for a pint and a glass of wine.. Blatant. In 50 years had never given a tip in a bar. Raised this at the time. She offered to remove the charge fair enough but should not have added it in the first place. A minor irritation but i dislike them profiteering in this way.

Visited on a busy Sat night on our way to the cinema Two of my kids have Coeliacs and therefore require a GF menu Because of this a manager Tom took our order and the new GF menu is excellent He was simply superb The food was delicious Great food and great service I would highly recommend

I visited tradition G Kelly pie and mash but it was on Roman Road so not sure if this is the same one. It was wonderful nd the most friendly welcome from both staff and the local customers who helped me find my way to the shop, and then the return to the tube station. I ate the traditional meal and took sweet pies back to my hotel too. YUMMY

We booked a table outside for Sunday lunch online, no trouble at all. The courtyard is lovely, shaded and sunny areas... Nice big tables. We were welcomed by staff and seated then given long menus with specials on the board. 4 roasts, a steak and burger ordered. The lamb roast was delicious! Huge amount (unusual) of flavourful lamb with trimmings and a proper mint sauce. Steak good chips diveine! Burger was given 7/10 but tasty. Staff were lovely, relaxed but attentive. Clientele very mixed families and groups, fortunately the saddos star spotting go to the pubs which leaves the nice people here to chill. Will definitely go again, breakfast I think which looked delicious too.

My review is based on my experience dining here on a cold Sunday afternoon, I ordered a lobster roll and courgette fries. My friends and I chose to dine here as it is conveniently located near Victoria station. Other than the enjoyable company, I wasn't satisfied with my lunch here for several reasons. First, our order came approximately 30 minutes late. This was despite the restaurant being rarely occupied, only around 1 in 6 of its tables were. Second, upon enquiry of this delay, our hostess didn't appear too pleasant. Third, when our food eventually Arrived, the lobster roll was served as an open sandwich with the salad on it rather than on the side with the fries. To enjoy it as a roll, I first had to eat enough of the salad to enable the brioche to fold. By then the brioche had lost its crisp. Fourth, the fries similarly lacked crisp. Fifth, the restaurant was economical with their heating. Our table was about 10 metres from the door, perhaps it was our fault in our seating choice. Though when I went upstairs to the washroom, it was even more cold. The only thing I enjoyed about the restaurant were the courgette fries, soft on the inside with a crispy breaded layer on the outside. I had ordered it to replace my side of fries, and told the waiter I'd pay the difference. However, it came in addition to my fries and they mistakenly only charged me 55p instead of the full price. If you're looking for a good lobster roll, go to Burger & Lobster.

We stumbled upon this Asian restaurant by accident, and were so entranced by their delicious food that we ate there three days in a row. They set the bar for Dim sum for us now, and we never visit London without coming here for a meal or three. The menu is extensive, and we haven't had a disaster yet. It is also really well priced, as well as clean and neat. Service is efficient. It tends to be an "eat and go" venue, not a "sit around for hours chatting" joint.

I came in for a late lunch. The place was empty, but I was in the mood for Lebanese food, so took a gamble I had the meze. I found the portion sizes more than ample, and one of the best falafel ive had in a long time. The rest was delicious and the staff were wonderful. Exactly what I was after.

For a wednesday night to be full can only mean this is a good place to eat! My friend and I sat at the bar and was looked after immediately.it is sort of a tapas-we have chopped liver on brushetta, these yummy rice and cheese balls with the thinnest pizza-with spinach and a medium over easy egg in the centre. All delicious and washed down with an easy merlot. Prices were ok about £6 a dish (but all for sharing). Staff were very helpful and attentive and yes I would certainly visit again!

Great food, really recommend the advocardo on toast with poached egg. Staff are friendly and welcoming which for me is great, no snootiness and helpful with prams and anything you need. Great place to stop and refresh yourself.

Stayed at hotel next door and came here for breakfast three days in a row, really good tea/coffee and breakfast baked goods. Staff was friendly but seemed to be overwhelmed and had trouble with my order each time.

Came here twice in a week during a trip to London with my wife. The first time was with a Travelzoo deal: four-course dinner for two with cocktails. The service was first class and the food excellent. The second time my wife and I came for afternoon tea (which was part of a Kensington Palace package). The staff welcomed and looked after us very well throughout. The selection of teas, sandwiches, scones, and cakes was excellent and all tasted wonderful, including the gluten free items (which we needed to notify in advance).

Started upstairs with cocktails prepared by Adam and migrated downstairs for a lovely dinner of oysters, rib of beef for two, yorkshire pudding, amazing potatoes boulangere and creamed spinach. Sticky toffee pudding for dessert! Sat next to the "Downton Abbey" and "James Bond" tables. Fun! Loads of history on the walls. It's a splurge but worth doing while in London.
Excellent service even to grimey young travellers like ourselves. Pitchers of cocktails not bad value for money considering the service and the view. Would cocktail again

Went here about 1 week ago as a lunch time venue for a Houses Of Parliament tour and I was more than happy. We contacted ahead of the day due to my wife being Coeliac just to be sure that they could cope with this and whilst they do not offer a gluten free menu they were more than happy to let me known what could be served as a gluten free option.The dining room was not tiny more cosy but this gave it a pretty good atmosphere.Service was good and the food plentiful and hot and the staff were very engaging with suggestions etc.All in all good value for money in the heart of the capital close to a major tourist attraction.Would definitely patronise again

We tried this restaurant because of its pedigree as apparently the "oldest restaurant in London", and we had a good time. The decor is very over the top, with the walls stuffed full of antlers and framed pictures, but we enjoyed it. We had a great corner table with with a little corner banquette and a great view of the room. We liked that the waiters were formal and old school, men in tuxedos, and the service was great. The food itself was fine. It wasn't spectacular, but it was tasty and fine. The only thing we noticed was that it was quite hot at first. I think people were not expecting the weather to be so hot. Eventually it seemed that they turned on the air conditioning and everything was good (or maybe we just acclimatized). In the end, a fun place to visit if you want to feel like you're eating in old time London at a traditional British resto, but if you're a foodie looking for a gourmet meal, it's not necessarily that.

I go to London periodically for business, and I love to stop at the Newman Arms pie room, a cozy space at the top floor of a pub. For £10, you can get a delicious pie (and don't forget the traditional British desserts, which I recommend with custard). I especially like the Beef & Guinness and the Chicken & Broccoli. The pie room is small, so it can be hard to get a table at certain times, but if you go early in the evening (at 6 when they open for supper), it's usually not too crowded. Also note that it is only open M-F. I have had good experiences here and would absolutely recommend.

My husband and I agree: this was the worst meal we had while in London. Sure, it's convenient, right off Trafalgar Square. But his black-and-bleu burger was mediocre; too dry, overpriced, and nothing special about the chips (fries). My overly done margherita pizza was topped with parsley flakes (not basil!). While I don't expect to get great Italian food in the UK, we had gone to Pizza Express earlier in the week and had much better pizza. Our service was lackluster - many of the servers were involved in a gathering of others they knew visiting in the back. Took forever to get our check. Too expensive for what you get.

My husband and I have just returned from a relaxed lunch in first class surroundings. We had the five course taster menu, which include a bottle ow wine. The food was excellent, the wine delicious and the service was first class. We can honestly say that we could not fault one bit of our experience and will be returning.

We Spent 3 nights at IBIS Style Excel London and it was a great stay! We really like it. Every year, my family prefer to spend some days in IBIS Style Excel London. The food was great and the servers are just wonderful.I really need to highlight the excellent service we always receive by Ashwin. I cannot imagine this place without Ashwin.

Good food for the price, quirky fun and friendly and has a takeaway proposition. A bit disappointed that they don't do traditional spicy prawn soup, but I suppose I can live with this. Enjoy, you won't be disappointed.

To my fellow Americans on trip advisor. Be prepared to pay but it is well worth the money. When making a reservation you need to request a table with a view of Tower Bridge.The view is great.I ordered the ribeye and my wife had the filet. Both were cooked perfectly.
