One difference compared to the states is the filets are cut like a regular steak and not like the filet mingnon cooked in American eateries. That makes a BIG difference. My ribeye was great and went down easy.The sides are a little small but after a good steak one does not need a lot of sides. After our meal they called us a cab which took a little time but it was not a black cab with no AC.It is a once in a lifetime meal.

The meal we had tasted good. Portion size was not large. We shared a starter but could easily have eaten one each. My dining companion was talked into the special fish dish of the day. It was served in a paper bag but he had to pick through a lot of bones. I was pleased I opted for the vegetarian.It was because of the service that I gave an average rating. Our waitress didn't speak English very well. However the specials were listed on the black board so we had full access to the menu. We ordered water which as soon as it Arrived disappeared. A plate was left for the fish dish but again disappeared..Atmosphere was bustling and quite noisy but it suited me and I have no complaints about the ambience.Would probably go again.

Went with a friend of mine that knew the place and I have to say I really enjoyed it.Food was great and service was excellent.Funny staff members! Playing with each other during service.I had a steak with fries and saladLoved it!

Very nice pub. I loved the atmosphere, the back bar is amazing, nice selection of spirits.Very good selection of beers.Pizza bit disappointed especially because they call it sourdough, probably the pizza maker doesn't even know what sourdough doesn't mean.Service very poor, the girls behind the bar are not very friendly, and not very passionate.That's a shame because the place has a big potential

I ate here with a colleague for lunch, and I was looking forward to it, having heard about the venue and it's associated reputation.I have also eaten at another Hix restaurant and that was superb...Firstly, the room itself is great...very atmospheric and lots of oddities hanging (literally) around. The place was pretty busy considering it was a lunchtime and our service was pretty quick and attentive (although they all looked rather young).We both ordered the steak sandwich and it Arrived promptly. The portion size was good, however the taste was just OK...also it was lukewarm at best, and became cold as I ate through it.The chips were OK, however as we had ordered two portions, they came in a single sharing bowl...not what we had asked for. The value is good...it was pretty cheap considering the venue / reputation so this saved my review from being a poor to keeping it as average.

Venerdi is without a doubt the best delivery pizza option in the area. Extensive menu also offering pasta as well as a selection of starters. Reasonably priced and made with high quality ingredients. Haven't eaten at the restaurant but intend to do so soon. Delivery is normally relatively swift and the food still hoot.
We had a pre-theatre snack here - the tapas were good, the offer of a cocktail & tapas to share was reasonable value and the whole ambiance was relaxing and atmospheric ... good service too.

Very nice place with a good service. Went there for a dinner with my wife based on the recommendation of our friends. Nice decor, friendly staff and food in good quality. We came across some challenges with the Manager when he tried to take the wine order but brought completely different wine ;o) But just a small simple mistake that can happened to anybody. Overall we had very nice evening!

My friends and I had dinner here one wet Saturday night. The decor is lovely and you definitely feel the history of the place. We got off to a disappointing start when we were escorted upstairs to wait for our table and found that it wasn't possible to drink coffee upstairs!! No reason was given - just a straightforward 'no' - I always thought the customer was right? The waiters muddled our dishes up when they brought out our food and I was referred to as 'sir' .... a minor thing you may think, but our bill came to almost £100 a head, so my expectation was quite high. The menu reflects the London of yore, so has limited appeal, but the food was very nice once we got the right plates in front of us! But it isn't Michelin star quality and is very expensive. It's a good job London is packed with good quality restaurants to choose from as it's unlikely we'll be going back.
Had a great time here. Ate upstairs at the Queen Anne dining room. Burgers were good and service was quick. Will come here again for the beer!

Had a pre-theatre meal with 12 friends at this restaurant. The food was very good and was good value. Service was efficient and friendly and the house wine was much better than I have had in other restaurants.I am a Londoner will certainly be eating there again next time we are up in town.

Whilst we have had many good meals at Mango Tree and have taken many friends and recommended lots of clients and contacts I must write this review to say how appalled we were with the service last night.I booked a table online in the afternoon, received a phone call an hour later to advise we could have the table for 2 hours maximum. Arrived on time and seated straight away then the fun began.........Took half an hour to be served drinks and have our food order taken, waited a further half an hour for starters to arrive, waited another half an hour for the plates to be cleared away, at this point we expressed our annoyance with the poor service and were told our main would be straight out. Another half an hour later and no food with only minutes left before our table expired so we stood up and left! We explained on the way out how upset we were and that they had our email address so send us the bill as we were not waiting any longer.Expecting an email today with a bill and perhaps an apology but instead received an email telling us to refrain from ever booking and visiting Mango Tree again ! Nice !We understand they are busy at Christmas but maybe should not take bookings if they cannot cope , the food is the same price so why should the service be so much worse. Very disappointed and we will certainly not recommend to anyone in the future which is such a shame as we have always enjoyed it in the past.

Having lived in the Middle East for many years the one thing ive missed since moving home is Lebanese food. Warda has filled that hole! We had the mixed grill and shish taouk plate (with halloumi to start). The waitress bought over pickles and olives and warm Arabic bread to have with our humous and baba ghanoush while we waited for the mountain of grilled meat we had ordered. The food was all freshly prepared and the main courses are served with toum (garlic sauce) which is possibly the best thing ever to eat with any grilled meat. I had mint tea after my meal which was served Lebanese style (by the bucketload with small glasses to drink from) and even this was fantastic. The food was exceptional value for the quality and quantity provided. Even the chips are proper homemade which delighted us. Can't recommend Warda highly enough - it's worth travelling from out of the area for and there is loads of free parking nearby if you do.
Perfect Location Perfect Staff Perfect Food Perfect Perfect Perfect one of the best places in London to eat an Italian!!!!!

Lunched here as came well recommended and was close to hotel. Mussels dish was large and good. Rabbit leg was disappointing, coming in a bowl with watery sauce. Also came with spinach and fries, seemed an odd set of sides. Apple tart was bland. Service was prompt and friendly. Expected better. Not cheap either.
